1.verse: Book I: Psalms 1–41 - How blessed are those who reject the advice of the wicked, don’t stand on the way of sinners or sit where scoffers sit!

2.verse: Their delight is in ADONAI’s Torah; on his Torah they meditate day and night.

3.verse: They are like trees planted by streams — they bear their fruit in season, their leaves never wither, everything they do succeeds.

4.verse: Not so the wicked, who are like chaff driven by the wind.

5.verse: For this reason the wicked won’t stand up to the judgment, nor will sinners at the gathering of the righteous.

6.verse: For ADONAI watches over the way of the righteous, but the way of the wicked is doomed.

1.verse: Why are the nations in an uproar, the peoples grumbling in vain?

2.verse: The earth’s kings are taking positions, leaders conspiring together, against ADONAI and his anointed.

3.verse: They cry, “Let’s break their fetters! Let’s throw off their chains!”

4.verse: He who sits in heaven laughs; Adonai looks at them in derision.

5.verse: Then in his anger he rebukes them, terrifies them in his fury.

6.verse: “I myself have installed my king on Tziyon, my holy mountain.”

7.verse: “I will proclaim the decree: ADONAI said to me, ‘You are my son; today I became your father.

8.verse: Ask of me, and I will make the nations your inheritance; the whole wide world will be your possession.

9.verse: You will break them with an iron rod, shatter them like a clay pot.’”

10.verse: Therefore, kings, be wise; be warned, you judges of the earth.

11.verse: Serve ADONAI with fear; rejoice, but with trembling.

12.verse: Kiss the son, lest he be angry, and you perish along the way, when suddenly his anger blazes. How blessed are all who take refuge in him.

1.verse: A psalm of David, when he fled from Avshalom his son:

2.verse: ADONAI, how many enemies I have! How countless are those attacking me;

3.verse: how countless those who say of me, “There is no salvation for him in God.” (Selah)

4.verse: But you, ADONAI, are a shield for me; you are my glory, you lift my head high.

5.verse: With my voice I call out to ADONAI, and he answers me from his holy hill. (Selah)

6.verse: I lie down and sleep, then wake up again, because ADONAI sustains me.

7.verse: I am not afraid of the tens of thousands set against me on every side.

8.verse: Rise up, ADONAI! Save me, my God! For you slap all my enemies in the face, you smash the teeth of the wicked.

1.verse: For the leader. With stringed instruments. A psalm of David:

2.verse: O God, my vindicator! Answer me when I call! When I was distressed, you set me free; now have mercy on me, and hear my prayer.

3.verse: Men of rank, how long will you shame my honor, love what is vain, chase after lies? (Selah)

4.verse: Understand that ADONAI sets apart the godly person for himself; ADONAI will hear when I call to him.

5.verse: You can be angry, but do not sin! Think about this as you lie in bed, and calm down. (Selah)

6.verse: Offer sacrifices rightly, and put your trust in ADONAI.

7.verse: Many ask, “Who can show us some good?” ADONAI, lift the light of your face over us!

8.verse: You have filled my heart with more joy than all their grain and new wine.

1.verse: For the leader. On wind instruments. A psalm of David:

2.verse: Give ear to my words, ADONAI, consider my inmost thoughts.

3.verse: Listen to my cry for help, my king and my God, for I pray to you.

4.verse: ADONAI, in the morning you will hear my voice; in the morning I lay my needs before you and wait expectantly.

5.verse: For you are not a God who takes pleasure in wickedness; evil cannot remain with you.

6.verse: Those who brag cannot stand before your eyes, you hate all who do evil,

7.verse: you destroy those who tell lies, ADONAI detests men of blood and deceivers.

8.verse: But I can enter your house because of your great grace and love; I will bow down toward your holy temple in reverence for you.

9.verse: Lead me, ADONAI, in your righteousness because of those lying in wait for me; make your way straight before me.

10.verse: For in their mouths there is nothing sincere, within them are calamities, their throats are open tombs, they flatter with their tongues.

11.verse: God, declare them guilty! Let them fall through their own intrigues, For their many crimes, throw them down; since they have rebelled against you.

12.verse: But let all who take refuge in you rejoice, let them forever shout for joy! Shelter them; and they will be glad, those who love your name.

1.verse: For the leader. With stringed instruments. On sh’minit [low-pitched musical instruments?]. A psalm of David:

2.verse: ADONAI, don’t rebuke me in your anger, don’t discipline me in the heat of your fury.

3.verse: Be gracious to me, ADONAI, because I am withering away; heal me, ADONAI, because my bones are shaking;

4.verse: I am completely terrified; and you, ADONAI — how long?

5.verse: Come back, ADONAI, and rescue me! Save me for the sake of your grace;

6.verse: for in death, no one remembers you; in Sh’ol, who will praise you?

7.verse: I am worn out with groaning; all night I drench my bed with tears, flooding my couch till it swims.

8.verse: My vision is darkened with anger; it grows weak because of all my foes.

9.verse: Get away from me, all you workers of evil! For ADONAI has heard the sound of my weeping,

10.verse: ADONAI has heard my pleading, ADONAI will accept my prayer.

1.verse: A shiggayon of David, which he sang to ADONAI because of Kush the Ben-Y’mini:

2.verse: ADONAI my God, in you I take refuge. Save me from all my pursuers, and rescue me;

3.verse: otherwise, they will maul me like a lion and tear me apart, with no rescuer present.

4.verse: ADONAI my God, if I have caused this, if there is guilt on my hands,

5.verse: if I paid back evil to him who was at peace with me, when I even spared those who opposed me without cause;

6.verse: then let the enemy pursue me until he overtakes me and tramples my life down into the earth; yes, let him lay my honor in the dust. (Selah)

7.verse: Rise up, ADONAI, in your anger! Arouse yourself against the fury of my foes. Wake up for me; you commanded justice.

8.verse: May the assembly of the peoples surround you; may you return to rule over them from on high.

9.verse: ADONAI, who dispenses judgment to the peoples, judge me, ADONAI, according to my righteousness and as my integrity deserves.

10.verse: Let the evil of the wicked come to an end, and establish the righteous; since you, righteous God, test hearts and minds.

11.verse: My shield is God, who saves the upright in heart.

12.verse: God is a righteous judge, a God whose anger is present every day.

13.verse: If a person will not repent, he sharpens his sword. He has bent his bow, made it ready;

14.verse: he has also prepared for him weapons of death, his arrows, which he has made into burning shafts.

15.verse: Look how the wicked is pregnant with evil; he conceives trouble, gives birth to lies.

16.verse: He makes a pit, digs it deep, and falls into the hole he made.

17.verse: His mischief will return onto his own head, his violence will recoil onto his own skull.

1.verse: For the leader. On the gittit. A psalm of David:

2.verse: ADONAI! Our Lord! How glorious is your name throughout the earth! The fame of your majesty spreads even above the heavens!

3.verse: From the mouths of babies and infants at the breast you established strength because of your foes, in order that you might silence the enemy and the avenger.

4.verse: When I look at your heavens, the work of your fingers, the moon and stars that you set in place —

5.verse: what are mere mortals, that you concern yourself with them; humans, that you watch over them with such care?

6.verse: You made him but little lower than the angels, you crowned him with glory and honor,

7.verse: you had him rule what your hands made, you put everything under his feet —

8.verse: sheep and oxen, all of them, also the animals in the wilds,

9.verse: the birds in the air, the fish in the sea, whatever passes through the paths of the seas.

1.verse: For the leader. On the death of Labben. A psalm of David:

2.verse: I give thanks to ADONAI with all my heart. I will tell about all your wonderful deeds.

3.verse: I will be glad and exult in you. I will sing praise to your name, ‘Elyon.

4.verse: When my enemies turn back, they stumble and perish before you.

5.verse: For you upheld my cause as just, sitting on the throne as the righteous judge.

6.verse: You rebuked the nations, destroyed the wicked, blotted out their name forever and ever.

7.verse: The enemy is finished, in ruins forever; you destroyed their cities; all memory of them is lost.

8.verse: But ADONAI is enthroned forever; he has set up his throne for judgment.

9.verse: He will judge the world in righteousness; he will judge the peoples fairly.

10.verse: ADONAI is a stronghold for the oppressed, a tower of strength in times of trouble.

11.verse: Those who know your name put their trust in you, for you have not abandoned those who seek you, ADONAI.

12.verse: Sing praises to ADONAI, who lives in Tziyon; proclaim his deeds among the peoples.

13.verse: For the avenger of blood remembers them, he does not ignore the cry of the afflicted:

14.verse: “Have mercy on me, ADONAI! See how I suffer from those who hate me; you raise me from the gates of death,

15.verse: so that I can proclaim all your praises at the gates of the daughter of Tziyon and rejoice in this deliverance of yours.”

16.verse: The nations have drowned in the pit they dug, caught their own feet in the net they hid.

17.verse: ADONAI made himself known and executed judgment; the wicked are ensnared in the work of their own hands. (Higgayon; Selah)

18.verse: The wicked will return to Sh’ol, all the nations that forget God.

19.verse: For the poor will not always be forgotten or the hope of the needy perish forever.

20.verse: Arise, ADONAI! Don’t let mortals prevail! Let the nations be judged in your presence.

1.verse: Why, ADONAI, do you stand at a distance? Why do you hide yourself in times of trouble?

2.verse: The wicked in their arrogance hunt down the poor, who get caught in the schemes they think up.

3.verse: For the wicked boasts about his lusts; he blesses greed and despises ADONAI.

4.verse: Every scheme of the wicked in his arrogance [says], “There is no God, [so] it won’t be held against me.”

5.verse: His ways prosper at all times. Your judgments are way up there, so he takes no notice. His adversaries? He scoffs at them all.

6.verse: In his heart he thinks, “I will never be shaken; I won’t meet trouble, not now or ever.”

7.verse: His mouth is full of curses, deceit, oppression; under his tongue, mischief and injustice.

8.verse: He waits near settlements in ambush and kills an innocent man in secret; his eyes are on the hunt for the helpless.

9.verse: Lurking unseen like a lion in his lair, he lies in wait to pounce on the poor, then seizes the poor and drags him off in his net.

10.verse: Yes, he stoops, crouches down low; and the helpless wretch falls into his clutches.

11.verse: He says in his heart, “God forgets, he hides his face, he will never see.”

12.verse: Arise, ADONAI! God, raise your hand! Don’t forget the humble!

13.verse: Why does the wicked despise God and say in his heart, “It won’t be held against me”?

14.verse: You have seen; for you look at mischief and grief, so that you can take the matter in hand. The helpless commits himself to you; you help the fatherless.

15.verse: Break the arm of the wicked! As for the evil man, search out his wickedness until there is none left.

16.verse: ADONAI is king forever and ever! The nations have vanished from his land.

17.verse: ADONAI, you have heard what the humble want; you encourage them and listen to them,

18.verse: to give justice to the fatherless and oppressed, so that no one on earth will strike terror again.

1.verse: For the leader. By David: In ADONAI I find refuge. So how can you say to me, “Flee like a bird to the mountains!

2.verse: See how the wicked are drawing their bows and setting their arrows on the string, to shoot from the shadows at honest men.

3.verse: If the foundations are destroyed, what can the righteous do?”

4.verse: ADONAI is in his holy temple. ADONAI, his throne is in heaven. His eyes see and test humankind.

5.verse: ADONAI tests the righteous; but he hates the wicked and the lover of violence.

6.verse: He will rain hot coals down on the wicked, fire, sulfur and scorching wind will be what they get to drink.

7.verse: For ADONAI is righteous; he loves righteousness; the upright will see his face.

1.verse: For the leader. On sh’minit [low-pitched musical instruments?]. A psalm of David:

2.verse: Help, ADONAI! For no one godly is left; the faithful have vanished from humankind.

3.verse: They all tell lies to each other, flattering with their lips, but speaking from divided hearts.

4.verse: May ADONAI cut off all flattering lips and the tongue that speaks so proudly,

5.verse: those who say, “By our tongues, we will prevail; our lips are with us. Who can master us?”

6.verse: “Because the poor are oppressed, because the needy are groaning, I will now rise up,” says ADONAI, “and grant security to those whom they scorn.”

7.verse: The words of ADONAI are pure words, silver in a melting-pot set in the earth, refined and purified seven times over.

8.verse: You, ADONAI, protect us; guard us forever from this generation —

1.verse: For the leader. A psalm of David:

2.verse: How long, ADONAI? Will you forget me forever? How long will you hide your face from me?

3.verse: How long must I keep asking myself what to do, with sorrow in my heart every day? How long must my enemy dominate me?

4.verse: Look, and answer me, ADONAI my God! Give light to my eyes, or I will sleep the sleep of death.

5.verse: Then my enemy would say, “I was able to beat him”; and my adversaries would rejoice at my downfall.

6.verse: But I trust in your grace, my heart rejoices as you bring me to safety. I will sing to ADONAI, because he gives me even more than I need.

1.verse: For the leader. By David: Fools say in their hearts, “There is no God.” They deal corruptly, their deeds are vile, not one does what is right.

2.verse: From heaven ADONAI observes humankind to see if anyone has understanding, if anyone seeks God.

3.verse: But all turn aside, all alike are corrupt; no one does what is right, not a single one.

4.verse: Don’t they ever learn, all those evildoers, who eat up my people as if eating bread and never call on ADONAI?

5.verse: There they are, utterly terrified; for God is with those who are righteous.

6.verse: You may mock the plans of the poor, but their refuge is ADONAI.

7.verse: How I wish Isra’el’s salvation would come out of Tziyon! When ADONAI restores his people’s fortunes, Ya‘akov will rejoice, Isra’el will be glad!

1.verse: A psalm of David: ADONAI, who can rest in your tent? Who can live on your holy mountain?

2.verse: Those who live a blameless life, who behave uprightly, who speak truth from their hearts

3.verse: and keep their tongues from slander; who never do harm to others or seek to discredit neighbors;

4.verse: who look with scorn on the vile, but honor those who fear ADONAI; who hold to an oath, no matter the cost;

5.verse: who refuse usury when they lend money and refuse a bribe to damage the innocent. Those who do these things never will be moved.

1.verse: Mikhtam. By David: Protect me, God, for you are my refuge.

2.verse: I said to ADONAI, “You are my Lord; I have nothing good outside of you.”

3.verse: The holy people in the land are the ones who are worthy of honor; all my pleasure is in them.

4.verse: Those who run after another god multiply their sorrows; To such gods I will not offer drink offerings of blood or take their names on my lips.

5.verse: ADONAI, my assigned portion, my cup: you safeguard my share.

6.verse: Pleasant places were measured out for me; I am content with my heritage.

7.verse: I bless ADONAI, my counselor; at night my inmost being instructs me.

8.verse: I always set ADONAI before me; with him at my right hand, I can never be moved;

9.verse: so my heart is glad, my glory rejoices, and my body too rests in safety;

10.verse: for you will not abandon me to Sh’ol, you will not let your faithful one see the Abyss.

11.verse: You make me know the path of life; in your presence is unbounded joy, in your right hand eternal delight.

1.verse: A prayer of David: Hear a just cause, ADONAI, heed my cry; listen to my prayer from honest lips.

2.verse: Let my vindication come from you, let your eyes see what is right.

3.verse: You probed my heart, you visited me at night, and you assayed me without finding evil thoughts that should not pass my lips.

4.verse: As for what others do, by words from your lips I have kept myself from the ways of the violent;

5.verse: my steps hold steadily to your paths, my feet do not slip.

6.verse: Now I call on you, God, for you will answer me. Turn your ear to me, hear my words.

7.verse: Show how wonderful is your grace, savior of those who seek at your right hand refuge from their foes.

8.verse: Protect me like the pupil of your eye, hide me in the shadow of your wings

9.verse: from the wicked, who are assailing me, from my deadly enemies, who are all around me.

10.verse: They close their hearts to compassion; they speak arrogantly with their mouths;

11.verse: they track me down, they surround me; they watch for a chance to bring me to the ground.

12.verse: They are like lions eager to tear the prey, like young lions crouching in ambush.

13.verse: Arise, ADONAI, confront them! Bring them down! With your sword deliver me from the wicked,

14.verse: with your hand, ADONAI, from human beings, from people whose portion in life is this world. You fill their stomachs with your treasure, their children will be satisfied too and will leave their wealth to their little ones.

15.verse: But my prayer, in righteousness, is to see your face; on waking, may I be satisfied with a vision of you.

1.verse: For the leader. By David the servant of ADONAI, who addressed the words of this song to ADONAI on the day when ADONAI delivered him from the power of all his enemies, including from the power of Sha’ul.

2.verse: He said: “I love you, ADONAI, my strength!

3.verse: “ADONAI is my Rock, my fortress and deliverer, my God, my Rock, in whom I find shelter, my shield, the power that saves me, my stronghold.

4.verse: I call on ADONAI, who is worthy of praise; and I am saved from my enemies.

5.verse: “For the cords of death surrounded me, the floods of B’liya‘al terrified me,

6.verse: the ropes of Sh’ol were wrapped around me, the snares of death lay there before me.

7.verse: In my distress I called to ADONAI; I cried out to my God. Out of his temple he heard my voice; my cry reached his ears.

8.verse: “Then the earth quaked and shook, the foundations of the mountains trembled. They were shaken because he was angry.

9.verse: Smoke arose in his nostrils; out of his mouth came devouring fire; sparks blazed forth from him.

10.verse: He lowered heaven and came down with thick darkness under his feet.

11.verse: He rode on a keruv; he flew, swooping down on the wings of the wind.

12.verse: He made darkness his hiding-place, his canopy thick clouds dark with water.

13.verse: From the brightness before him, there broke through his thick clouds hailstones and fiery coals.

14.verse: “ADONAI also thundered in heaven, Ha‘Elyon sounded his voice — hailstones and fiery coals.

15.verse: He sent out arrows and scattered them, shot out lightning and routed them.

16.verse: The channels of water appeared, the foundations of the world were exposed at your rebuke, ADONAI, at the blast of breath from your nostrils.

17.verse: “He sent from on high, he took me and pulled me out of deep water;

18.verse: he rescued me from my powerful enemy, from those who hated me, for they were stronger than I.

19.verse: They came against me on my day of disaster, but ADONAI was my support.

20.verse: He brought me out to an open place; he rescued me, because he took pleasure in me.

21.verse: ADONAI rewarded me for my uprightness, he repaid me because my hands were clean.

22.verse: “For I have kept the ways of ADONAI, I have not done evil by leaving my God;

23.verse: for all his rulings were before me, I did not distance his regulations from me.

24.verse: I was pure-hearted with him and kept myself from my sin.

25.verse: “Hence ADONAI repaid me for my uprightness, according to the purity of my hands in his view.

26.verse: With the merciful, you are merciful; with a man who is sincere, you are sincere;

27.verse: with the pure, you are pure; but with the crooked you are cunning.

28.verse: People afflicted, you save; but haughty eyes, you humble.

29.verse: “For you, ADONAI, light my lamp; ADONAI, my God, lights up my darkness.

30.verse: With you I can run through a whole troop of men, with my God I can leap a wall.

31.verse: “As for God, his way is perfect, the word of ADONAI has been tested by fire; he shields all who take refuge in him.

32.verse: “For who is God but ADONAI? Who is a Rock but our God?

33.verse: “It is God who girds me with strength; he makes my way go straight.

34.verse: He makes me swift, sure-footed as a deer, and enables me to stand on my high places.

35.verse: He trains my hands for war until my arms can bend a bow of bronze;

36.verse: “You give me your shield, which is salvation, your right hand holds me up, your humility makes me great.

37.verse: You lengthen the steps I can take, yet my ankles do not turn.

38.verse: “I pursued my enemies and overtook them, without turning back until they were destroyed.

39.verse: I crushed them, so that they can’t get up; they have fallen under my feet.

40.verse: “For you braced me with strength for the battle and bent down my adversaries beneath me.

41.verse: You made my enemies turn their backs in flight, and I destroyed those who hated me.

42.verse: “They cried out, but there was no one to help, even to ADONAI, but he didn’t answer.

43.verse: I pulverized them like dust in the wind, threw them out like mud in the streets.

44.verse: “You also freed me from the quarrels of my people. You made me head of the nations; a people I did not know now serve me —

45.verse: the moment they hear of me, they obey me, foreigners come cringing to me.

46.verse: Foreigners lose heart as they come trembling from their fortresses.

47.verse: “ADONAI is alive! Blessed is my Rock! Exalted be the God of my salvation,

48.verse: the God who avenges me and subdues peoples under me.

49.verse: He delivers me from my enemies. You lift me high above my enemies, you rescue me from violent men.

50.verse: “So I give thanks to you, ADONAI, among the nations; I sing praises to your name.

1.verse: For the leader. A psalm of David:

2.verse: The heavens declare the glory of God, the dome of the sky speaks the work of his hands.

3.verse: Every day it utters speech, every night it reveals knowledge.

4.verse: Without speech, without a word, without their voices being heard,

5.verse: their line goes out through all the earth and their words to the end of the world. In them he places a tent for the sun,

6.verse: which comes out like a bridegroom from the bridal chamber, with delight like an athlete to run his race.

7.verse: It rises at one side of the sky, circles around to the other side, and nothing escapes its heat.

8.verse: The Torah of ADONAI is perfect, restoring the inner person. The instruction of ADONAI is sure, making wise the thoughtless.

9.verse: The precepts of ADONAI are right, rejoicing the heart. The mitzvah of ADONAI is pure, enlightening the eyes.

10.verse: The fear of ADONAI is clean, enduring forever. The rulings of ADONAI are true, they are righteous altogether,

11.verse: more desirable than gold, than much fine gold, also sweeter than honey or drippings from the honeycomb.

12.verse: Through them your servant is warned; in obeying them there is great reward.

13.verse: Who can discern unintentional sins? Cleanse me from hidden faults.

14.verse: Also keep your servant from presumptuous sins, so that they won’t control me. Then I will be blameless and free of great offense.

1.verse: For the leader. A psalm of David:

2.verse: May ADONAI answer you in times of distress, may the name of the God of Ya‘akov protect you.

3.verse: May he send you help from the sanctuary and give you support from Tziyon.

4.verse: May he be reminded by all your grain offerings and accept the fat of your burnt offerings. (Selah)

5.verse: May he grant you your heart’s desire and bring all your plans to success.

6.verse: Then we will shout for joy at your victory and fly our flags in the name of our God. May ADONAI fulfill all your requests.

7.verse: Now I know that ADONAI gives victory to his anointed one — he will answer him from his holy heaven with mighty victories by his right hand.

8.verse: Some trust in chariots and some in horses, but we praise the name of ADONAI our God.

9.verse: They will crumple and fall, but we will arise and stand erect.

1.verse: For the leader. A psalm of David:

2.verse: ADONAI, the king finds joy in your strength; what great joy he displays in your victory!

3.verse: You give him his heart’s desire; you don’t refuse the prayer from his lips. (Selah)

4.verse: For you come to meet him with the best blessings, you place a crown of fine gold on his head.

5.verse: He asks you for life; you give it to him, years and years forever and ever.

6.verse: Your victory brings him great glory; you confer on him splendor and honor.

7.verse: For you bestow on him everlasting blessings, you make him glad with the joy of your presence.

8.verse: For the king puts his trust in ADONAI, in the grace of ‘Elyon; he will not be moved.

9.verse: Your hand will find all your enemies; your right hand will overtake those who hate you.

10.verse: At your appearing, you will make them like a fiery furnace. ADONAI will swallow them up in his anger; fire will consume them.

11.verse: You will destroy from the earth their descendants, rid humankind of their posterity;

12.verse: for they intended evil against you; but despite their scheme, they won’t succeed.

13.verse: For you will make them turn their back by aiming your bow at their faces.

1.verse: For the leader. Set to “Sunrise.” A psalm of David:

2.verse: My God! My God! Why have you abandoned me? Why so far from helping me, so far from my anguished cries?

3.verse: My God, by day I call to you, but you don’t answer; likewise at night, but I get no relief.

4.verse: Nevertheless, you are holy, enthroned on the praises of Isra’el.

5.verse: In you our ancestors put their trust; they trusted, and you rescued them.

6.verse: They cried to you and escaped; they trusted in you and were not disappointed.

7.verse: But I am a worm, not a man, scorned by everyone, despised by the people.

8.verse: All who see me jeer at me; they sneer and shake their heads:

9.verse: “He committed himself to ADONAI, so let him rescue him! Let him set him free if he takes such delight in him!”

10.verse: But you are the one who took me from the womb, you made me trust when I was on my mother’s breasts.

11.verse: Since my birth I’ve been thrown on you; you are my God from my mother’s womb.

12.verse: Don’t stay far from me, for trouble is near; and there is no one to help.

13.verse: Many bulls surround me, wild bulls of Bashan close in on me.

14.verse: They open their mouths wide against me, like ravening, roaring lions.

15.verse: I am poured out like water; all my bones are out of joint; my heart has become like wax — it melts inside me;

16.verse: my mouth is as dry as a fragment of a pot, my tongue sticks to my palate; you lay me down in the dust of death.

17.verse: Dogs are all around me, a pack of villains closes in on me like a lion [at] my hands and feet.

18.verse: I can count every one of my bones, while they gaze at me and gloat.

19.verse: They divide my garments among themselves; for my clothing they throw dice.

20.verse: But you, ADONAI, don’t stay far away! My strength, come quickly to help me!

21.verse: Rescue me from the sword, my life from the power of the dogs.

22.verse: Save me from the lion’s mouth! You have answered me from the wild bulls’ horns.

23.verse: I will proclaim your name to my kinsmen; right there in the assembly I will praise you:

24.verse: “You who fear ADONAI, praise him! All descendants of Ya‘akov, glorify him! All descendants of Isra’el, stand in awe of him!

25.verse: For he has not despised or abhorred the poverty of the poor; he did not hide his face from him but listened to his cry.”

26.verse: Because of you I give praise in the great assembly; I will fulfill my vows in the sight of those who fear him.

27.verse: The poor will eat and be satisfied; those who seek ADONAI will praise him; Your hearts will enjoy life forever.

28.verse: All the ends of the earth will remember and turn to ADONAI; all the clans of the nations will worship in your presence.

29.verse: For the kingdom belongs to ADONAI, and he rules the nations.

30.verse: All who prosper on the earth will eat and worship; all who go down to the dust will kneel before him, including him who can’t keep himself alive,

31.verse: A descendant will serve him; the next generation will be told of Adonai.

1.verse: A psalm of David: ADONAI is my shepherd; I lack nothing.

2.verse: He has me lie down in grassy pastures, he leads me by quiet water,

3.verse: he restores my inner person. He guides me in right paths for the sake of his own name.

4.verse: Even if I pass through death-dark ravines, I will fear no disaster; for you are with me; your rod and staff reassure me.

5.verse: You prepare a table for me, even as my enemies watch; you anoint my head with oil from an overflowing cup.

6.verse: Goodness and grace will pursue me every day of my life; and I will live in the house of ADONAI for years and years to come.

1.verse: By David. A psalm: The earth is ADONAI’s, with all that is in it, the world and those who live there;

2.verse: for he set its foundations on the seas and established it on the rivers.

3.verse: Who may go up to the mountain of ADONAI? Who can stand in his holy place?

4.verse: Those with clean hands and pure hearts, who don’t make vanities the purpose of their lives or swear oaths just to deceive.

5.verse: They will receive a blessing from ADONAI and justice from God, who saves them.

6.verse: Such is the character of those who seek him, of Ya‘akov, who seeks your face. (Selah)

7.verse: Lift up your heads, you gates! Lift them up, everlasting doors, so that the glorious king can enter!

8.verse: Who is he, this glorious king? ADONAI, strong and mighty, ADONAI, mighty in battle.

9.verse: Lift up your heads, you gates! Lift them up, everlasting doors, so that the glorious king can enter!

10.verse: Who is he, this glorious king? ADONAI-Tzva’ot — he is the glorious king. (Selah)

1.verse: By David: I lift my inner being to you, ADONAI;

2.verse: I trust you, my God. Don’t let me be disgraced, don’t let my enemies gloat over me.

3.verse: No one waiting for you will be disgraced; disgrace awaits those who break faith for no reason.

4.verse: Make me know your ways, ADONAI, teach me your paths.

5.verse: Guide me in your truth, and teach me; for you are the God who saves me, my hope is in you all day long.

6.verse: Remember your compassion and grace, ADONAI; for these are ages old.

7.verse: Don’t remember my youthful sins or transgressions; but remember me according to your grace for the sake of your goodness, ADONAI.

8.verse: ADONAI is good, and he is fair; this is why he teaches sinners the way [to live],

9.verse: leads the humble to do what is right and teaches the humble [to live] his way.

10.verse: All ADONAI’s paths are grace and truth to those who keep his covenant and instructions.

11.verse: For the sake of your name, ADONAI, forgive my wickedness, great though it is.

12.verse: Who is the person who fears ADONAI? He will teach him the way to choose.

13.verse: He will remain prosperous, and his descendants will inherit the land.

14.verse: ADONAI relates intimately with those who fear him; he makes them know his covenant.

15.verse: My eyes are always directed toward ADONAI, for he will free my feet from the net.

16.verse: Turn to me, and show me your favor; for I am alone and oppressed.

17.verse: The troubles of my heart are growing and growing; bring me out of my distress.

18.verse: See my affliction and suffering, and take all my sins away.

19.verse: Consider my enemies, how many there are and how cruelly they hate me.

20.verse: Protect me and rescue me; don’t let me be disgraced, for I take refuge in you.

21.verse: Let integrity and uprightness preserve me, because my hope is in you.

22.verse: God! Redeem Isra’el from all their troubles!

1.verse: By David: Vindicate me, ADONAI, for I have lived a blameless life; unwaveringly I trust in ADONAI.

2.verse: Examine me, ADONAI, test me, search my mind and heart.

3.verse: For your grace is there before my eyes, and I live my life by your truth.

4.verse: I have not sat with worthless folks, I won’t consort with hypocrites,

5.verse: I hate the company of evildoers, I will not sit with the wicked.

6.verse: I will wash my hands in innocence and walk around your altar, ADONAI,

7.verse: lifting my voice in thanks and proclaiming all your wonders.

8.verse: ADONAI, I love the house where you live, the place where your glory abides.

9.verse: Don’t include me with sinners or my life with the bloodthirsty.

10.verse: In their hands are evil schemes; their right hands are full of bribes.

11.verse: As for me, I will live a blameless life. Redeem me and show me favor.

12.verse: My feet are planted on level ground; in the assemblies I will bless ADONAI.

1.verse: By David: ADONAI is my light and salvation; whom do I need to fear? ADONAI is the stronghold of my life; of whom should I be afraid?

2.verse: When evildoers assailed me to devour my flesh, my adversaries and foes, they stumbled and fell.

3.verse: If an army encamps against me, my heart will not fear; if war breaks out against me, even then I will keep trusting.

4.verse: Just one thing have I asked of ADONAI; only this will I seek: to live in the house of ADONAI all the days of my life, to see the beauty of ADONAI and visit in his temple.

5.verse: For he will conceal me in his shelter on the day of trouble, he will hide me in the folds of his tent, he will set me high on a rock.

6.verse: Then my head will be lifted up above my surrounding foes, and I will offer in his tent sacrifices with shouts of joy; I will sing, sing praises to ADONAI.

7.verse: Listen, ADONAI, to my voice when I cry; show favor to me; and answer me.

8.verse: “My heart said of you, ‘Seek my face.’” Your face, ADONAI, I will seek.

9.verse: Do not hide your face from me, don’t turn your servant away in anger. You are my help; don’t abandon me; don’t leave me, God my savior.

10.verse: Even though my father and mother have left me, ADONAI will care for me.

11.verse: Teach me your way, ADONAI; lead me on a level path because of my enemies —

12.verse: don’t give me up to the whims of my foes; for false witnesses have risen against me, also those who are breathing violence.

13.verse: If I hadn’t believed that I would see ADONAI’s goodness in the land of the living, . . .

14.verse: Put your hope in ADONAI, be strong, and let your heart take courage! Yes, put your hope in ADONAI!

1.verse: By David: ADONAI, I am calling to you; my Rock, don’t be deaf to my cry. For if you answer me with silence, I will be like those who fall in a pit.

2.verse: Hear the sound of my prayers when I cry to you, when I lift my hands toward your holy sanctuary.

3.verse: Don’t drag me off with the wicked, with those whose deeds are evil; they speak words of peace to their fellowmen, but evil is in their hearts.

4.verse: Pay them back for their deeds, as befits their evil acts; repay them for what they have done, give them what they deserve.

5.verse: For they don’t understand the deeds of ADONAI or what he has done. He will break them down; he will not build them up.

6.verse: Blessed be ADONAI, for he heard my voice as I prayed for mercy.

7.verse: ADONAI is my strength and shield; in him my heart trusted, and I have been helped. Therefore my heart is filled with joy, and I will sing praises to him.

8.verse: ADONAI is strength for [his people], a stronghold of salvation to his anointed.

9.verse: Save your people! Bless your heritage! Shepherd them, and carry them forever!

1.verse: A psalm of David: Give ADONAI his due, you who are godly; give ADONAI his due of glory and strength;

2.verse: give ADONAI the glory due his name; worship ADONAI in holy splendor.

3.verse: The voice of ADONAI is over the waters; the God of glory thunders, ADONAI over rushing waters,

4.verse: the voice of ADONAI in power, the voice of ADONAI in splendor.

5.verse: The voice of ADONAI cracks the cedars; ADONAI splinters the cedars of the L’vanon

6.verse: and makes the L’vanon skip like a calf, Siryon like a young wild ox.

7.verse: The voice of ADONAI flashes fiery flames;

8.verse: the voice of ADONAI rocks the desert, ADONAI convulses the Kadesh Desert.

9.verse: The voice of ADONAI causes deer to give birth and strips the forests bare — while in his temple, all cry, “Glory!”

10.verse: ADONAI sits enthroned above the flood! ADONAI sits enthroned as king forever!

11.verse: May ADONAI give strength to his people! May ADONAI bless his people with shalom!

1.verse: A psalm. A song for the dedication of the house. By David:

2.verse: I will exalt you, ADONAI, because you drew me up; you didn’t let my enemies rejoice over me.

3.verse: ADONAI my God, I cried out to you, and you provided healing for me.

4.verse: ADONAI, you lifted me up from Sh’ol; you kept me alive when I was sinking into a pit.

5.verse: Sing praise to ADONAI, you faithful of his; and give thanks on recalling his holiness.

6.verse: For his anger is momentary, but his favor lasts a lifetime. Tears may linger for the night, but with dawn come cries of joy.

7.verse: Once I was prosperous and used to say, that nothing could ever shake me —

8.verse: when you showed me favor, ADONAI, I was firm as a mighty mountain. But when you hid your face, I was struck with terror.

9.verse: I called to you, ADONAI; to ADONAI I pleaded for mercy:

10.verse: “What advantage is there in my death, in my going down to the pit? Can the dust praise you? Can it proclaim your truth?

11.verse: Hear me, ADONAI, and show me your favor! ADONAI, be my helper!”

12.verse: You turned my mourning into dancing! You removed my sackcloth and clothed me with joy,

1.verse: For the leader. A psalm of David:

2.verse: In you, ADONAI, I take refuge; let me never be put to shame; in your justice, save me!

3.verse: Turn your ear toward me, come quickly to my rescue, be for me a rock of strength, a fortress to keep me safe.

4.verse: Since you are my rock and fortress, lead me and guide me for your name’s sake.

5.verse: Free me from the net they have hidden to catch me, because you are my strength.

6.verse: Into your hand I commit my spirit; you will redeem me, ADONAI, God of truth.

7.verse: I hate those who serve worthless idols; as for me, I trust in ADONAI.

8.verse: I will rejoice and be glad in your grace, for you see my affliction, you know how distressed I am.

9.verse: You did not hand me over to the enemy; you set my feet where I can move freely.

10.verse: Show me favor, ADONAI, for I am in trouble. My eyes grow dim with anger, my soul and body as well.

11.verse: For my life is worn out with sorrow and my years with sighing; my strength gives out under my guilt, and my bones are wasting away.

12.verse: I am scorned by all my adversaries, and even more by my neighbors; even to acquaintances I am an object of fear — when they see me in the street, they turn away from me.

13.verse: Like a dead man, I have passed from their minds; I have become like a broken pot.

14.verse: All I hear is whispering, terror is all around me; they plot together against me, scheming to take my life.

15.verse: But I, I trust in you, ADONAI; I say, “You are my God.”

16.verse: My times are in your hand; rescue me from my enemies’ power, from those who persecute me.

17.verse: Make your face shine on your servant; in your grace, save me.

18.verse: ADONAI, don’t let me be put to shame, for I have called on you; let the wicked be put to shame, let them be silenced in Sh’ol.

19.verse: May lying lips be struck dumb, that speak insolently against the righteous with such pride and contempt.

20.verse: But oh, how great is your goodness, which you have stored up for those who fear you, which you do for those who take refuge in you, before people’s very eyes!

21.verse: In the shelter of your presence you hide them from human plots, you conceal them in your shelter, safe from contentious tongues.

22.verse: Blessed be ADONAI! For he has shown me his amazing grace when I was in a city under siege.

23.verse: As for me, in my alarm I said, “I have been cut off from your sight!” Nevertheless, you heard my pleas when I cried out to you.

24.verse: Love ADONAI, you faithful of his. ADONAI preserves the loyal, but the proud he repays in full.

1.verse: By David. A maskil: How blessed are those whose offense is forgiven, those whose sin is covered!

2.verse: How blessed those to whom ADONAI imputes no guilt, in whose spirit is no deceit!

3.verse: When I kept silent, my bones wasted away because of my groaning all day long;

4.verse: day and night your hand was heavy on me; the sap in me dried up as in a summer drought. (Selah)

5.verse: When I acknowledged my sin to you, when I stopped concealing my guilt, and said, “I will confess my offenses to ADONAI”; then you, you forgave the guilt of my sin. (Selah)

6.verse: This is what everyone faithful should pray at a time when you can be found. Then, when the floodwaters are raging, they will not reach to him.

7.verse: You are a hiding-place for me, you will keep me from distress; you will surround me with songs of deliverance. (Selah)

8.verse: “I will instruct and teach you in this way that you are to go; I will give you counsel; my eyes will be watching you.”

9.verse: Don’t be like a horse or mule that has no understanding, that has to be curbed with bit and bridle, or else it won’t come near you.

10.verse: Many are the torments of the wicked, but grace surrounds those who trust in ADONAI.

11.verse: Be glad in ADONAI; rejoice, you righteous! Shout for joy, all you upright in heart!

1.verse: Rejoice in ADONAI, you righteous! Praise is well-suited to the upright.

2.verse: Give thanks to ADONAI with the lyre, sing praises to him with a ten-stringed harp.

3.verse: Sing to him a new song, make music at your best among shouts of joy.

4.verse: For the word of ADONAI is true, and all his work is trustworthy.

5.verse: He loves righteousness and justice; the earth is full of the grace of ADONAI.

6.verse: By the word of ADONAI the heavens were made, and their whole host by a breath from his mouth.

7.verse: He collects the sea waters together in a heap; he puts the deeps in storehouses.

8.verse: Let all the earth fear ADONAI! Let all living in the world stand in awe of him.

9.verse: For he spoke, and there it was; he commanded, and there it stood.

10.verse: ADONAI brings to nothing the plans of nations, he foils the plans of the peoples.

11.verse: But the counsel of ADONAI stands forever, his heart’s plans are for all generations.

12.verse: How blessed is the nation whose God is ADONAI, the people he chose as his heritage!

13.verse: ADONAI looks out from heaven; he sees every human being;

14.verse: from the place where he lives he watches everyone living on earth,

15.verse: he who fashioned the hearts of them all and understands all they do.

16.verse: A king is not saved by the size of his army, a strong man not delivered by his great strength.

17.verse: To rely on a horse for safety is vain, nor does its great power assure escape.

18.verse: But ADONAI’s eyes watch over those who fear him, over those who wait for his grace

19.verse: to rescue them from death and keep them alive in famine.

20.verse: We are waiting for ADONAI; he is our help and shield.

21.verse: For in him our hearts rejoice, because we trust in his holy name.

22.verse: May your mercy, ADONAI, be over us, because we put our hope in you.

1.verse: By David, when he pretended to be insane before Avimelekh, who then drove him away; so he left:

2.verse: I will bless ADONAI at all times; his praise will always be in my mouth.

3.verse: When I boast, it will be about ADONAI; the humble will hear of it and be glad.

4.verse: Proclaim with me the greatness of ADONAI; let us exalt his name together.

5.verse: I sought ADONAI, and he answered me; he rescued me from everything I feared.

6.verse: They looked to him and grew radiant; their faces will never blush for shame.

7.verse: This poor man cried; ADONAI heard and saved him from all his troubles.

8.verse: The angel of ADONAI, who encamps around those who fear him, delivers them.

9.verse: Taste, and see that ADONAI is good. How blessed are those who take refuge in him!

10.verse: Fear ADONAI, you holy ones of his, for those who fear him lack nothing.

11.verse: Young lions can be needy, they can go hungry, but those who seek ADONAI lack nothing good.

12.verse: Come, children, listen to me; I will teach you the fear of ADONAI.

13.verse: Which of you takes pleasure in living? Who wants a long life to see good things?

14.verse: [If you do,] keep your tongue from evil and your lips from deceiving talk;

15.verse: turn from evil, and do good; seek peace, go after it!

16.verse: The eyes of ADONAI watch over the righteous, and his ears are open to their cry.

17.verse: But the face of ADONAI opposes those who do evil, to cut off all memory of them from the earth.

18.verse: [The righteous] cried out, and ADONAI heard, and he saved them from all their troubles.

19.verse: ADONAI is near those with broken hearts; he saves those whose spirit is crushed.

20.verse: The righteous person suffers many evils, but ADONAI rescues him out of them all.

21.verse: He protects all his bones; not one of them gets broken.

22.verse: Evil will kill the wicked, and those who hate the righteous will be condemned.

1.verse: By David: ADONAI, oppose those who oppose me; fight against those who fight against me.

2.verse: Grasp your shield and protective gear, and rise to my defense.

3.verse: Brandish spear and battle-axe against my pursuers; let me hear you say, “I am your salvation.”

4.verse: May those who seek my life be disgraced and put to confusion; may those who are plotting harm for me be repulsed and put to shame.

5.verse: May they be like chaff before the wind, with the angel of ADONAI to drive them on.

6.verse: May their way be dark and slippery, with the angel of ADONAI to pursue them.

7.verse: For unprovoked, they hid their net over a pit; unprovoked, they dug it for me.

8.verse: May destruction come over him unawares. May the net he concealed catch himself; may he fall into it and be destroyed.

9.verse: Then I will be joyful in ADONAI, I will rejoice in his salvation.

10.verse: All my bones will say, “Who is like you? Who can rescue the weak from those stronger than they, the poor and needy from those who exploit them?”

11.verse: Malicious witnesses come forward, asking me things about which I know nothing.

12.verse: They repay me evil for good; it makes me feel desolate as a parent bereaved.

13.verse: But I, when they were ill, wore sackcloth; I put myself out and fasted; I can pray that what I prayed for them might also happen to me.

14.verse: I behaved as I would for my friend or my brother; I bent down in sorrow as if mourning my mother.

15.verse: But when I stumble, they gather in glee; they gather against me and strike me unawares; they tear me apart unceasingly.

16.verse: With ungodly mocking and grimacing, they grind their teeth at me.

17.verse: Adonai, how much longer will you look on? Rescue me from their assaults, save the one life I have from the lions!

18.verse: I will give you thanks in the great assembly, I will give you praise among huge crowds of people.

19.verse: Don’t let those who are wrongfully my enemies gloat over me; and those who hate me unprovoked — don’t let them smirk at me.

20.verse: For they don’t speak words of peace but devise ways to deceive the peaceful of the land.

21.verse: They shout to accuse me, “Aha! Aha! we saw you with our own eyes!”

22.verse: You saw them, ADONAI; don’t stay silent. Adonai, don’t stay far away from me.

23.verse: Wake up! Get up, my God, my Lord! Defend me and my cause!

24.verse: Give judgment for me, ADONAI, my God, as your righteousness demands. Don’t let them gloat over me.

25.verse: Don’t let them say to themselves, “Aha! We got what we wanted!” or say, “We swallowed them up!”

26.verse: May those who gloat over my distress be disgraced and humiliated. May those who aggrandize themselves at my expense be covered with shame and confusion.

27.verse: But may those who delight in my righteousness shout for joy and be glad! Let them say always, “How great is ADONAI, who delights in the peace of his servant!”

28.verse: Then my tongue will tell of your righteousness and praise you all day long.

1.verse: For the leader. By David, the servant of ADONAI:

2.verse: Crime speaks to the wicked. I perceive this in my heart; before his eyes there is no fear of God.

3.verse: For, the way he sees it, crime makes his life easy — that is, until his wrongs are discovered; then, he is hated.

4.verse: His words are wrong and deceitful; he has stopped being wise and doing good.

5.verse: He devises trouble as he lies in bed; so set is he on his own bad way that he doesn’t hate evil.

6.verse: ADONAI, in the heavens is your grace; your faithfulness reaches to the skies.

7.verse: Your righteousness is like the mountains of God, your judgments are like the great deep. You save man and beast, ADONAI.

8.verse: How precious, God, is your grace! People take refuge in the shadow of your wings,

9.verse: they feast on the rich bounty of your house, and you have them drink from the stream of your delights.

10.verse: For with you is the fountain of life; in your light we see light.

11.verse: Continue your grace to those who know you and your righteousness to the upright in heart.

12.verse: Don’t let the foot of the proud tread on me or the hands of the wicked drive me away.

1.verse: By David: Don’t be upset by evildoers or envious of those who do wrong,

2.verse: for soon they will wither like grass and fade like the green in the fields.

3.verse: Trust in ADONAI, and do good; settle in the land, and feed on faithfulness.

4.verse: Then you will delight yourself in ADONAI, and he will give you your heart’s desire.

5.verse: Commit your way to ADONAI; trust in him, and he will act.

6.verse: He will make your vindication shine forth like light, the justice of your cause like the noonday sun.

7.verse: Be still before ADONAI; wait patiently till he comes. Don’t be upset by those whose way succeeds because of their wicked plans.

8.verse: Stop being angry, put aside rage, and don’t be upset — it leads to evil.

9.verse: For evildoers will be cut off, but those hoping in ADONAI will inherit the land.

10.verse: Soon the wicked will be no more; you will look for his place, and he won’t be there.

11.verse: But the meek will inherit the land and delight themselves in abundant peace.

12.verse: The wicked plots against the righteous and grinds his teeth at him;

13.verse: but Adonai laughs at the wicked, knowing his day will come.

14.verse: The wicked have unsheathed their swords, they have strung their bows to bring down the poor and needy, to slaughter those whose way is upright.

15.verse: But their swords will pierce their own hearts, and their bows will be broken.

16.verse: Better the little that the righteous has than the wealth of all the wicked.

17.verse: For the arms of the wicked will be broken, but ADONAI upholds the righteous.

18.verse: ADONAI knows what the wholehearted suffer, but their inheritance lasts forever.

19.verse: They will not be distressed when times are hard; when famine comes, they will have plenty.

20.verse: For the wicked will perish; ADONAI’s enemies will be like sheep fat, ending up as smoke, finished.

21.verse: The wicked borrows and doesn’t repay, but the righteous is generous and gives.

22.verse: For those blessed by [ADONAI] will inherit the land, but those cursed by him will be cut off.

23.verse: ADONAI directs a person’s steps, and he delights in his way.

24.verse: He may stumble, but he won’t fall headlong, for ADONAI holds him by the hand.

25.verse: I have been young; now I am old; yet not once have I seen the righteous abandoned or his descendants begging for bread.

26.verse: All day long he is generous and lends, and his descendants are blessed.

27.verse: If you turn from evil and do good, you will live safely forever.

28.verse: For ADONAI loves justice and will not abandon his faithful; they are preserved forever. But the descendants of the wicked will be cut off.

29.verse: The righteous will inherit the land and live in it forever.

30.verse: The mouth of the righteous articulates wisdom, his tongue speaks justice.

31.verse: The Torah of his God is in his heart; his footsteps do not falter.

32.verse: The wicked keeps his eye on the righteous, seeking a chance to kill him.

33.verse: But ADONAI will not leave him in his power or let him be condemned when judged.

34.verse: Put your hope in ADONAI, keep to his way, and he will raise you up to inherit the land. When the wicked are cut off, you will see it.

35.verse: I have seen a wicked man wielding great power, flourishing like a shade tree in its native soil.

36.verse: But I passed by again, and he was no longer there; I looked for him, but he could not be found.

37.verse: Observe the pure person, consider the upright; for the peaceful person will have posterity.

38.verse: But transgressors will all be destroyed; the posterity of the wicked will be cut off.

39.verse: ADONAI is the one who saves the righteous; he is their stronghold in time of trouble.

40.verse: ADONAI helps them and rescues them, rescues them from the wicked and saves them; because they take refuge in him.

1.verse: A psalm of David, serving as a reminder:

2.verse: ADONAI, don’t rebuke me when you are angry or discipline me when you are enraged,

3.verse: for your arrows penetrate me deeply, and your hand is pressing me down.

4.verse: Your indignation left no part of me intact; my sin made my whole body sick;

5.verse: for my iniquities loom high over my head as a heavy burden, too heavy for me.

6.verse: I have stinking, festering wounds because of my foolishness.

7.verse: I am bent down, prostrate completely; I go about mourning all day long.

8.verse: For my insides burn with fever, and my whole body is sick.

9.verse: I am numb, completely crushed; my anguished heart makes me groan aloud.

10.verse: Adonai, all my longing is known to you; my sighing is not hidden from you.

11.verse: My heart is throbbing, my strength is gone, and the light in my eyes has left me.

12.verse: My friends and companions shun my disease; even the closest keep their distance.

13.verse: Those seeking my life lay snares for me, those seeking to harm me speak of disaster and think up deceptions all day long.

14.verse: But I’m like a deaf man — I don’t hear it; and, like a mute, I don’t say a word.

15.verse: Yes, I’ve become like a man who doesn’t hear and in whose mouth are no defenses.

16.verse: For it is in you, ADONAI, that I hope. You will answer, Adonai my God.

17.verse: I said, “Don’t let them gloat over me or boast against me when my foot slips.”

18.verse: For I am about to fall, and my pain is always with me.

19.verse: I acknowledge my guilt, I am anxious because of my sin.

20.verse: But my enemies are alive and well, those who wrongfully hate me increase their numbers;

21.verse: and, since they repay good with evil, they oppose me because I pursue good.

22.verse: Don’t abandon me, ADONAI! My God, don’t be far from me!

1.verse: For the leader. Set in the style of Y’dutun. A psalm of David:

2.verse: I said, “I will watch how I behave, so that I won’t sin with my tongue; I will put a muzzle on my mouth whenever the wicked confront me.”

3.verse: I was silent, said nothing, not even good; but my pain kept being stirred up.

4.verse: My heart grew hot within me; whenever I thought of it, the fire burned. Then, [at last,] I let my tongue speak:

5.verse: “Make me grasp, ADONAI, what my end must be, what it means that my days are numbered; let me know what a transient creature I am.

6.verse: You have made my days like handbreadths; for you, the length of my life is like nothing.” Yes, everyone, no matter how firmly he stands, is merely a puff of wind. (Selah)

7.verse: Humans go about like shadows; their turmoil is all for nothing. They accumulate wealth, not knowing who will enjoy its benefits.

8.verse: Now, Adonai, what am I waiting for? You are my only hope.

9.verse: Rescue me from all my transgressions; don’t make me the butt of fools.

10.verse: I am silent, I keep my mouth shut, because it is you who have done it.

11.verse: Stop raining blows on me; the pounding of your fist is wearing me down.

12.verse: With rebukes you discipline people for their guilt; like a moth, you destroy what makes them attractive; yes, everyone is merely a puff of wind. (Selah)

13.verse: Hear my prayer, ADONAI, listen to my cry, don’t be deaf to my weeping; for with you, I am just a traveler passing through, like all my ancestors.

1.verse: For the leader. A psalm of David:

2.verse: I waited patiently for ADONAI, till he turned toward me and heard my cry.

3.verse: He brought me up from the roaring pit, up from the muddy ooze, and set my feet on a rock, making my footing firm.

4.verse: He put a new song in my mouth, a song of praise to our God. Many will look on in awe and put their trust in ADONAI.

5.verse: How blessed the man who trusts in ADONAI and does not look to the arrogant or to those who rely on things that are false.

6.verse: How much you have done, ADONAI my God! Your wonders and your thoughts toward us — none can compare with you! I would proclaim them, I would speak about them; but there’s too much to tell!

7.verse: Sacrifices and grain offerings you don’t want; burnt offerings and sin offerings you don’t demand. Instead, you have given me open ears;

8.verse: so then I said, “Here I am! I’m coming! In the scroll of a book it is written about me.

9.verse: Doing your will, my God, is my joy; your Torah is in my inmost being.

10.verse: I have proclaimed what is right in the great assembly; I did not restrain my lips, ADONAI, as you know.

11.verse: I did not hide your righteousness in my heart but declared your faithfulness and salvation; I did not conceal your grace and truth from the great assembly.”

12.verse: ADONAI, don’t withhold your mercy from me. Let your grace and truth preserve me always.

13.verse: For numberless evils surround me; my iniquities engulf me — I can’t even see; there are more of them than hairs on my head, so that my courage fails me.

14.verse: Be pleased, ADONAI, to rescue me! ADONAI, hurry and help me!

15.verse: May those who seek to sweep me away be disgraced and humiliated together. May those who take pleasure in doing me harm be turned back and put to confusion.

16.verse: May those who jeer at me, “Aha! Aha!” be aghast because of their shame.

17.verse: But may all those who seek you be glad and take joy in you. May those who love your salvation say always, “ADONAI is great and glorious!”

1.verse: For the leader. A psalm of David:

2.verse: How blessed are those who care for the poor! When calamity comes, ADONAI will save them.

3.verse: ADONAI will preserve them, keep them alive, and make them happy in the land. You will not hand them over to the whims of their enemies.

4.verse: ADONAI sustains them on their sickbed; when they lie ill, you make them recover.

5.verse: I said, “ADONAI, have pity on me! Heal me, for I have sinned against you!”

6.verse: My enemies say the worst about me: “When will he die and his name disappear?”

7.verse: When they come to see me they speak insincerely, their hearts meanwhile gathering falsehoods; then they go out and spread bad reports.

8.verse: All who hate me whisper together against me, imagining the worst about me.

9.verse: “A fatal disease has attached itself to him; now that he lies ill, he will never get up.”

10.verse: Even my close friend, on whom I relied, who shared my table, has turned against me.

11.verse: But you, ADONAI, have pity on me, put me on my feet, so I can pay them back.

12.verse: I will know you are pleased with me if my enemy doesn’t defeat me.

13.verse: You uphold me because of my innocence you establish me in your presence forever.

1.verse: Book II: Psalms 42–72 - For the leader. A maskil of the descendants of Korach:

2.verse: Just as a deer longs for running streams, God, I long for you.

3.verse: I am thirsty for God, for the living God! When can I come and appear before God?

4.verse: My tears are my food, day and night, while all day people ask me, “Where is your God?”

5.verse: I recall, as my feelings well up within me, how I’d go with the crowd to the house of God, with sounds of joy and praise from the throngs observing the festival.

6.verse: My soul, why are you so downcast? Why are you groaning inside me? Hope in God, since I will praise him again for the salvation that comes from his presence.

7.verse: My God, when I feel so downcast, I remind myself of you from the land of Yarden, from the peaks of Hermon, from the hill Mizar.

8.verse: Deep is calling to deep at the thunder of your waterfalls; all your surging rapids and waves are sweeping over me.

9.verse: By day ADONAI commands his grace, and at night his song is with me as a prayer to the God of my life.

10.verse: I say to God my Rock, “Why have you forgotten me? Why must I go about mourning, under pressure by the enemy?

11.verse: My adversaries’ taunts make me feel as if my bones were crushed, as they ask me all day long, ‘Where is your God?’ ”

1.verse: Judge me, God, and plead my cause against a faithless nation. Rescue me from those who deceive and from those who are unjust.

2.verse: For you are the God of my strength; why have you thrust me aside? Why must I go about mourning, under pressure by the enemy?

3.verse: Send out your light and your truth; let them be my guide; let them lead me to your holy mountain, to the places where you live.

4.verse: Then I will go to the altar of God, to God, my joy and delight; I will praise you on the lyre, God, my God.

5.verse: My soul, why are you so downcast? Why are you groaning inside me? Hope in God, since I will praise him again for being my Savior and God.

1.verse: For the leader. By the descendants of Korach. A maskil:

2.verse: God, we heard it with our ears; our fathers told us about it — a deed which you did in their days, back in days of old.

3.verse: With your hand you drove out nations to plant them in [the land], you crushed peoples to make room for them.

4.verse: For not by their own swords did they conquer the land, nor did their own arm give them victory; rather, it was your right hand, your arm and the light of your face; because you favored them.

5.verse: God, you are my king; command complete victory for Ya‘akov.

6.verse: Through you we pushed away our foes, through your name we trampled down our assailants.

7.verse: For I don’t rely on my bow, nor can my sword give me victory.

8.verse: No, you saved us from our adversaries; you put to shame those who hate us.

9.verse: We will boast in our God all day and give thanks to your name forever. (Selah)

10.verse: Yet now you have thrust us aside and disgraced us; you don’t march out with our armies.

11.verse: You make us retreat from the adversary, and those who hate us plunder us at will.

12.verse: You have handed us over like sheep to be eaten and scattered us among the nations.

13.verse: You sell your people for a pittance, you don’t even profit on the sale.

14.verse: You make us an object for our neighbors to mock, one of scorn and derision to those around us.

15.verse: You make us a byword among the nations; the peoples jeer at us, shaking their heads.

16.verse: All day long my disgrace is on my mind, and shame has covered my face

17.verse: at the sound of those who revile and insult, at the sight of the enemy bent on revenge.

18.verse: Though all this came on us, we did not forget you; we have not been false to your covenant;

19.verse: Our hearts have not turned back, and our steps did not turn away from your path,

20.verse: though you pressed us into a lair of jackals and covered us with death-dark gloom.

21.verse: If we had forgotten the name of our God or spread out our hands to a foreign god,

22.verse: wouldn’t God have discovered this, since he knows the secrets of the heart?

23.verse: For your sake we are put to death all day long, we are considered sheep to be slaughtered.

24.verse: Wake up, Adonai! Why are you asleep? Rouse yourself! Don’t thrust us off forever.

25.verse: Why are you turning your face away, forgetting our pain and misery?

26.verse: For we are lying flat in the dust, our bodies cling to the ground.

1.verse: For the leader. Set to “Lilies.” By the descendants of Korach. A maskil. A lovesong:

2.verse: My heart is stirred by a noble theme; I address my verses to the king; My tongue is the pen of an expert scribe.

3.verse: You are the most handsome of men; gracious speech flows from your lips. For God has blessed you forever.

4.verse: Warrior, strap your sword at your thigh; [gird on] your splendor and majesty.

5.verse: In your majesty, succeed, ride on in the cause of truth, meekness and righteousness. May your right hand teach you awesome things.

6.verse: Your arrows are sharp. The people fall under you, as they penetrate the hearts of the king’s enemies.

7.verse: Your throne, God, will last forever and ever; you rule your kingdom with a scepter of equity.

8.verse: You have loved righteousness and hated wickedness. Therefore God, your God, has anointed you with the oil of joy in preference to your companions.

9.verse: Your robes are all fragrant with myrrh, aloes and cassia; from ivory palaces stringed instruments bring you joy.

10.verse: Daughters of kings are among your favorites; at your right stands the queen in gold from Ofir.

11.verse: Listen, daughter! Think, pay attention! Forget your own people and your father’s house,

12.verse: and the king will desire your beauty; for he is your lord, so honor him.

13.verse: Then the daughter of Tzor, the richest of peoples, will court your favor with gifts.

14.verse: Inside [the palace], the king’s daughter looks splendid, attired in checker-work embroidered with gold.

15.verse: In brocade, she will be led to the king, to you, with the virgins in her retinue.

16.verse: They will be led in with gladness and joy, they will enter the king’s palace.

17.verse: You will have sons to succeed your ancestors; you will make them princes in all the land.

1.verse: For the leader. By the descendants of Korach. On ‘alamot [high-pitched musical instruments?]. A song:

2.verse: God is our refuge and strength, an ever-present help in trouble.

3.verse: Therefore we are unafraid, even if the earth gives way, even if the mountains tumble into the depths of the sea,

4.verse: even if its waters rage and foam, and mountains shake at its turbulence. (Selah)

5.verse: There is a river whose streams gladden the city of God, the holy habitation of ‘Elyon —

6.verse: God is in the city. It will not be moved — when daybreak comes, God will help it.

7.verse: Nations were in turmoil, kingdoms were moved; his voice thundered forth, and the earth melted away.

8.verse: ADONAI-Tzva’ot is with us, our fortress, the God of Ya‘akov. (Selah)

9.verse: Come and see the works of ADONAI, the astounding deeds he has done on the earth.

10.verse: To the ends of the earth he makes wars cease — he breaks the bow, snaps the spear, burns the shields in the fire.

11.verse: “Desist, and learn that I am God, supreme over the nations, supreme over the earth.”

1.verse: For the leader. A psalm of the descendants of Korach:

2.verse: Clap your hands, all you peoples! Shout to God with cries of joy!

3.verse: For ADONAI ‘Elyon is awesome, a great king over all the earth.

4.verse: He makes peoples subject to us, puts nations under our feet.

5.verse: He chooses our heritage for us, the pride of Ya‘akov, whom he loves. (Selah)

6.verse: God goes up to shouts of acclaim, ADONAI to a blast on the shofar.

7.verse: Sing praises to God, sing praises! Sing praises to our king, sing praises!

8.verse: For God is king of all the earth; sing praises in a maskil.

9.verse: God rules the nations; God sits on his holy throne.

1.verse: A song. A psalm of the descendants of Korach:

2.verse: Great is ADONAI and greatly to be praised, in the city of our God, his holy mountain,

3.verse: beautiful in its elevation, the joy of all the earth, Mount Tziyon, in the far north, the city of the great king.

4.verse: In its citadels God has been revealed as a strong defense.

5.verse: For the kings met by agreement; together they advanced.

6.verse: They saw and were filled with consternation; terrified, they took to flight.

7.verse: Trembling took hold of them, pains like those of a woman in labor,

8.verse: as when the wind out of the east wrecks the “Tarshish” ships.

9.verse: We heard it, and now we see for ourselves in the city of ADONAI-Tzva’ot, in the city of our God. May God establish it forever. (Selah)

10.verse: God, within your temple we meditate on your grace.

11.verse: God, your praise, like your name, extends to the ends of the earth. Your right hand is filled with righteousness.

12.verse: Let Mount Tziyon rejoice, let the daughters of Y’hudah be glad, because of your judgment [on the enemy].

13.verse: Walk through Tziyon, go all around it; count how many towers it has.

14.verse: Note its ramparts, pass through its citadels, so that you can tell generations to come

1.verse: For the leader. A psalm of the descendants of Korach:

2.verse: Hear this, all you peoples! Listen, everyone living on earth,

3.verse: regardless of whether low or high, regardless of whether rich or poor!

4.verse: My mouth is about to speak wisdom; my heart’s deepest thoughts will give understanding.

5.verse: I will listen with care to [God’s] parable, I will set my enigma to the music of the lyre.

6.verse: Why should I fear when the days bring trouble, when the evil of my pursuers surrounds me,

7.verse: the evil of those who rely on their wealth and boast how rich they are?

8.verse: No one can ever redeem his brother or give God a ransom for him ,

9.verse: because the price for him is too high (leave the idea completely alone!)

10.verse: to have him live on eternally and never see the pit.

11.verse: For he can see that wise men will die, likewise the fool and the brute will perish and leave their wealth to others.

12.verse: They think their homes will last forever, their dwellings through all generations; they give their own names to their estates.

13.verse: But people, even rich ones, will live only briefly; then, like animals, they will die.

14.verse: This is the manner of life of the foolish and those who come after, approving their words. (Selah)

15.verse: Like sheep, they are destined for Sh’ol; death will be their shepherd. The upright will rule them in the morning; and their forms will waste away in Sh’ol, until they need no dwelling.

16.verse: But God will redeem me from Sh’ol’s control, because he will receive me. (Selah)

17.verse: Don’t be afraid when someone gets rich, when the wealth of his family grows.

18.verse: For when he dies, he won’t take it with him; his wealth will not go down after him.

19.verse: True, while he lived, he thought himself happy — people praise you when you do well for yourself —

20.verse: but he will join his ancestors’ generations and never again see light.

1.verse: A psalm of Asaf: The Mighty One, God, ADONAI, is speaking, summoning the world from east to west.

2.verse: Out of Tziyon, the perfection of beauty, God is shining forth.

3.verse: Our God is coming and not staying silent. With a fire devouring ahead of him and a great storm raging around him,

4.verse: he calls to the heavens above and to earth, in order to judge his people.

5.verse: “Gather to me my faithful, those who made a covenant with me by sacrifice.”

6.verse: The heavens proclaim his righteousness, for God himself is judge. (Selah)

7.verse: “Listen, my people, I am speaking: Isra’el, I am testifying against you, I, God, your God.

8.verse: I am not rebuking you for your sacrifices; your burnt offerings are always before me.

9.verse: I have no need for a bull from your farm or for male goats from your pens;

10.verse: for all forest creatures are mine already, as are the animals on a thousand hills;

11.verse: I know all the birds in the mountains; whatever moves in the fields is mine.

12.verse: If I were hungry, I would not tell you; for the world is mine, and everything in it.

13.verse: Do I eat the flesh of bulls or drink the blood of goats?

14.verse: Offer thanksgiving as your sacrifice to God, pay your vows to the Most High,

15.verse: and call on me when you are in trouble; I will deliver you, and you will honor me.”

16.verse: But to the wicked God says: “What right do you have to proclaim my laws or take my covenant on your lips,

17.verse: when you so hate to receive instruction and fling my words behind you?

18.verse: When you see a thief, you join up with him, you throw in your lot with adulterers,

19.verse: you give your mouth free rein for evil and harness your tongue to deceit;

20.verse: you sit and speak against your kinsman, you slander your own mother’s son.

21.verse: When you do such things, should I stay silent? You may have thought I was just like you; but I will rebuke and indict you to your face.

22.verse: Consider this, you who forget God, or I will tear you to pieces, with no one to save you.

23.verse: “Whoever offers thanksgiving as his sacrifice honors me; and to him who goes the right way I will show the salvation of God.”

1.verse: For the leader. A psalm of David,

2.verse: when Natan the prophet came to him after his affair with Bat-Sheva:

3.verse: God, in your grace, have mercy on me; in your great compassion, blot out my crimes.

4.verse: Wash me completely from my guilt, and cleanse me from my sin.

5.verse: For I know my crimes, my sin confronts me all the time.

6.verse: Against you, you only, have I sinned and done what is evil from your perspective; so that you are right in accusing me and justified in passing sentence.

7.verse: True, I was born guilty, was a sinner from the moment my mother conceived me.

8.verse: Still, you want truth in the inner person; so make me know wisdom in my inmost heart.

9.verse: Sprinkle me with hyssop, and I will be clean; wash me, and I will be whiter than snow.

10.verse: Let me hear the sound of joy and gladness, so that the bones you crushed can rejoice.

11.verse: Turn away your face from my sins, and blot out all my crimes.

12.verse: Create in me a clean heart, God; renew in me a resolute spirit.

13.verse: Don’t thrust me away from your presence, don’t take your Ruach Kodesh away from me.

14.verse: Restore my joy in your salvation, and let a willing spirit uphold me.

15.verse: Then I will teach the wicked your ways, and sinners will return to you.

16.verse: Rescue me from the guilt of shedding blood, God, God of my salvation! Then my tongue will sing about your righteousness —

17.verse: Adonai, open my lips; then my mouth will praise you.

18.verse: For you don’t want sacrifices, or I would give them; you don’t take pleasure in burnt offerings.

19.verse: My sacrifice to God is a broken spirit; God, you won’t spurn a broken, chastened heart.

1.verse: For the leader. A maskil of David,

2.verse: when Do’eg from Edom came and told Sha’ul, “David has arrived at the house of Achimelekh”:

3.verse: Why do you boast of your evil, you tyrant, when God’s mercy is present every day?

4.verse: Your tongue, as sharp as a razor, plots destruction and works deception.

5.verse: You love evil more than good, lies rather than speaking uprightly. (Selah)

6.verse: You love all words that eat people up, you deceitful tongue!

7.verse: This is why God will strike you down, seize you, pluck you from your tent and uproot you from the land of the living. (Selah)

8.verse: The righteous will see and be awestruck; they will jeer at him, saying,

9.verse: “This fellow would not make God his refuge, but trusted in his own great wealth, relying on his evil plots.”

1.verse: For the leader. On machalat. A maskil of David:

2.verse: A brutish fool tells himself, “There isn’t any God.” Such people are depraved, all their deeds are vile, not one of them does what is good.

3.verse: God looks out from heaven upon the human race to see if even one is wise, if even one seeks God.

4.verse: Every one of them is unclean, altogether corrupt; not one of them does what is good, not a single one.

5.verse: Won’t these evildoers ever learn? They devour my people as if they were eating bread, and they never call on God!

6.verse: They will be gripped with terror, even though now they are not afraid; for God will scatter the bones of him who is besieging you. You are putting them to shame, because God has rejected them.

1.verse: For the leader. With stringed instruments. A maskil of David,

2.verse: when the Zifim came and told Sha’ul, “David is hiding with us”:

3.verse: God, deliver me by your name; in your power, vindicate me.

4.verse: God, hear my prayer; listen to the words from my mouth.

5.verse: For foreigners are rising against me, violent men are seeking my life; they give no thought to God. (Selah)

6.verse: But God is helping me; Adonai is my support.

7.verse: May he repay the evil to those who are lying in wait for me. In your faithfulness, destroy them!

1.verse: For the leader. With stringed instruments. A maskil of David:

2.verse: Listen, God, to my prayer! Don’t hide yourself from my plea!

3.verse: Pay attention to me, and answer me! I am panic-stricken as I make my complaint, I shudder

4.verse: at how the enemy shouts, at how the wicked oppress; for they keep heaping trouble on me and angrily tormenting me.

5.verse: My heart within me is pounding in anguish, the terrors of death press down on me,

6.verse: fear and trembling overwhelm me, horror covers me.

7.verse: I said, “I wish I had wings like a dove! Then I could fly away and be at rest.

8.verse: Yes, I would flee to a place far off, I would stay in the desert. (Selah)

9.verse: I would quickly find me a shelter from the raging wind and storm.”

10.verse: Confuse, Adonai, confound their speech! For I see violence and fighting in the city.

11.verse: Day and night they go about its walls; within are malice and mischief.

12.verse: Ruin is rife within it, oppression and fraud never leave its streets.
