13.verse: For it was not an enemy who insulted me; if it had been, I could have borne it. It was not my adversary who treated me with scorn; if it had been, I could have hidden myself.

14.verse: But it was you, a man of my own kind, my companion, whom I knew well.

15.verse: We used to share our hearts with each other; in the house of God we walked with the crowd.

16.verse: May he put death on them; let them go down alive to Sh’ol; for evil is in their homes and also in their hearts.

17.verse: But I will call on God, and ADONAI will save me.

18.verse: Evening, morning and noon I complain and moan; but he hears my voice.

19.verse: He redeems me and gives me peace, so that no one can come near me. For there were many who fought me.

20.verse: God will hear and will humble them, yes, he who has sat on his throne from the start. (Selah) For they never change, and they don’t fear God.

21.verse: [My companion] attacked those who were at peace with him; he broke his solemn word.

22.verse: What he said sounded smoother than butter, but his heart was at war. His words seemed more soothing than oil, but in fact they were sharp swords.

23.verse: Unload your burden on ADONAI, and he will sustain you. He will never permit the righteous to be moved.

1.verse: For the leader. Set to “The Silent Dove in the Distance.” By David; a mikhtam, when the P’lishtim captured him in Gat:

2.verse: Show me favor, God; for people are trampling me down — all day they fight and press on me.

3.verse: Those who are lying in wait for me would trample on me all day. For those fighting against me are many. Most High,

4.verse: when I am afraid, I put my trust in you.

5.verse: In God — I praise his word — in God I trust; I have no fear; what can human power do to me?

6.verse: All day long they twist my words; their only thought is to harm me.

7.verse: They gather together and hide themselves, spying on my movements, hoping to kill me.

8.verse: Because of their crime, they cannot escape; in anger, God, strike down the peoples.

9.verse: You have kept count of my wanderings; store my tears in your water-skin — aren’t they already recorded in your book?

10.verse: Then my enemies will turn back on the day when I call; this I know: that God is for me.

11.verse: In God — I praise his word — in ADONAI — I praise his word —

12.verse: in God I trust; I have no fear; what can mere humans do to me?

13.verse: God, I have made vows to you; I will fulfill them with thank offerings to you.

1.verse: For the leader. Set to “Do Not Destroy.” By David, a mikhtam, when he fled from Sha’ul into the cave:

2.verse: Show me favor, God, show me favor; for in you I have taken refuge. Yes, I will find refuge in the shadow of your wings until the storms have passed.

3.verse: I call to God, the Most High, to God, who is accomplishing his purpose for me.

4.verse: He will send from heaven and save me when those who would trample me down mock me. (Selah) God will send his grace and his truth.

5.verse: I am surrounded by lions, I am lying down among people breathing fire, men whose teeth are spears and arrows and their tongues sharp-edged swords.

6.verse: Be exalted, God, above heaven! May your glory be over all the earth!

7.verse: They prepared a snare for my feet, but I am bending over [to avoid it]. They dug a pit ahead of me, but they fell into it themselves. (Selah)

8.verse: My heart is steadfast, God, steadfast. I will sing and make music.

9.verse: Awake, my glory! Awake, lyre and lute! I will awaken the dawn.

10.verse: I will thank you, Adonai, among the peoples; I will make music to you among the nations.

11.verse: For your grace is great, all the way to heaven, and your truth, all the way to the skies.

1.verse: For the leader. Set to “Do Not Destroy.” By David, a mikhtam:

2.verse: [Rulers,] does your silence really speak justice? Are you judging people fairly?

3.verse: [No!] In your hearts you devise wrongs, your hands dispense violence in the land.

4.verse: From the womb, the wicked are estranged, liars on the wrong path since birth.

5.verse: Their venom is like snake’s venom; they are like a serpent that stops its ears,

6.verse: so as not to hear the voice of the charmer, no matter how well he plays.

7.verse: God, break their teeth in their mouth! Shatter the fangs of these lions, ADONAI!

8.verse: May they vanish like water that drains away. May their arrows be blunted when they aim their bows.

9.verse: May they be like a slug that melts as it moves, like a stillborn baby that never sees the sun.

10.verse: Before your cook-pots feel the heat of the burning thorns, may he blow them away, green and blazing alike.

11.verse: The righteous will rejoice to see vengeance done, they will wash their feet in the blood of the wicked;

1.verse: For the leader. Set to “Do Not Destroy.” By David; a mikhtam, when Sha’ul sent men to keep watch on David’s house in order to kill him:

2.verse: My God, rescue me from my enemies! Lift me up, out of reach of my foes!

3.verse: Rescue me from evildoers, save me from bloodthirsty men.

4.verse: For there they are, lying in wait to kill me. Openly they gather themselves against me, and not because I committed a crime or sinned, ADONAI.

5.verse: For no fault of mine, they run and prepare. Awaken to help me, and see!

6.verse: You, ADONAI Elohei-Tzva’ot, God of Isra’el, arouse yourself to punish all the nations; spare none of those wicked traitors. (Selah)

7.verse: They return at nightfall, snarling like dogs as they go around the city.

8.verse: Look what pours out of their mouth, what swords are on their lips, [as they say to themselves,] “No one is listening, anyway.”

9.verse: But you, ADONAI, laugh at them, you mock all the nations.

10.verse: My Strength, I will watch for you, for God is my fortress.

11.verse: God, who gives me grace, will come to me; God will let me gaze in triumph at my foes.

12.verse: Don’t kill them, or my people will forget; instead, by your power, make them wander to and fro; but bring them down, Adonai our Shield,

13.verse: for the sins their mouths make with each word from their lips. Let them be trapped by their pride for the curses and falsehoods they utter.

14.verse: Finish them off in wrath, finish them off, put an end to them, and let them know to the ends of the earth that God is Ruler in Ya‘akov. (Selah)

15.verse: They return at nightfall, snarling like dogs as they go around the city.

16.verse: They roam about, looking for food, prowling all night if they don’t get their fill.

17.verse: But as for me, I will sing of your strength; in the morning I will sing aloud of your grace. For you are my fortress, a refuge when I am in trouble.

1.verse: For the leader. Set to “Lily of Testimony.” A mikhtam of David for teaching about

2.verse: when he fought with Aram-Naharayim and with Aram-Tzovah, and Yo’av returned and killed 12,000 from Edom in the Salt Valley:

3.verse: God, you rejected us; you crushed us; you were angry; but now revive us.

4.verse: You made the land shake, split it apart; now repair the rifts, for it is collapsing.

5.verse: You made your people suffer hard times, had us drink a wine that made us stagger.

6.verse: To those who fear you because of the truth you gave a banner to rally around, (Selah)

7.verse: so that those you love could be rescued; so save with your right hand, and answer us!

8.verse: God in his holiness spoke, and I took joy [in his promise]: “I will divide Sh’khem and determine the shares in the Sukkot Valley.

9.verse: Gil‘ad is mine and M’nasheh mine, Efrayim my helmet, Y’hudah my scepter.

10.verse: Mo’av is my washpot; on Edom I throw my shoe; P’leshet, be crushed because of me!”

11.verse: Who will bring me into the fortified city? Who will lead me to Edom?

12.verse: God, have you rejected us? You don’t go out with our armies, God.

1.verse: For the leader. With stringed instruments. By David:

2.verse: Hear my cry, God; listen to my prayer.

3.verse: From the end of the earth, with fainting heart, I call out to you. Set me down on a rock far above where I am now.

4.verse: For you have been a refuge for me, a tower of strength in the face of the foe.

5.verse: I will live in your tent forever and find refuge in the shelter of your wings. (Selah)

6.verse: For you, God, have heard my vows; you have given me the heritage of those who fear your name.

7.verse: Prolong the life of the king! May his years go on for many generations.

8.verse: May he be enthroned in God’s presence forever! Appoint grace and truth to preserve him!

1.verse: For the leader. Set in the style of Y’dutun. A psalm of David:

2.verse: My soul waits in silence for God alone; my salvation comes from him.

3.verse: He alone is my rock and salvation, my stronghold; I won’t be greatly moved.

4.verse: How long will you assail a person in order to murder him, all of you, as if he were a sagging wall or a shaky fence?

5.verse: They only want to shake him from his height, they take delight in lying — with their mouths they bless, but inwardly they curse. (Selah)

6.verse: My soul, wait in silence for God alone, because my hope comes from him.

7.verse: He alone is my rock and salvation, my stronghold; I won’t be moved.

8.verse: My safety and honor rest on God. My strong rock and refuge are in God.

9.verse: Trust in him, people, at all times; pour out your heart before him; God is a refuge for us. (Selah)

10.verse: Ordinary folks are merely a breath and important people a sham; if you lay them on a balance-scale, they go up — both together are lighter than nothing.

11.verse: Don’t put your trust in extortion, don’t put false hopes in robbery; even if wealth increases, don’t set your heart on it.

12.verse: God has spoken once, I have heard it twice: strength belongs to God.

1.verse: A psalm of David, when he was in the desert of Y’hudah:

2.verse: O God, you are my God; I will seek you eagerly. My heart thirsts for you, my body longs for you in a land parched and exhausted, where no water can be found.

3.verse: I used to contemplate you in the sanctuary, seeing your power and glory;

4.verse: for your grace is better than life. My lips will worship you.

5.verse: Yes, I will bless you as long as I live; in your name I will lift up my hands.

6.verse: I am as satisfied as with rich food; my mouth praises you with joy on my lips

7.verse: when I remember you on my bed and meditate on you in the night watches.

8.verse: For you have been my help; in the shadow of your wings I rejoice;

9.verse: my heart clings to you; your right hand supports me.

10.verse: But those who seek to destroy my life — may they go to the lowest parts of the earth.

11.verse: May they be given over to the power of the sword; may they become prey for jackals.

1.verse: For the leader. A psalm of David:

2.verse: Hear my voice, God, as I plead: preserve my life from fear of the enemy.

3.verse: Hide me from the secret intrigues of the wicked and the open insurrection of evildoers.

4.verse: They sharpen their tongues like a sword; they aim their arrows, poisoned words,

5.verse: in order to shoot from cover at the innocent, shooting suddenly and fearing nothing.

6.verse: They support each other’s evil plans; they talk of hiding snares and ask, “Who would see them?”

7.verse: They search for ways to commit crimes, bringing their diligent search to completion when each of them has thought it through in the depth of his heart.

8.verse: Suddenly God shoots them down with an arrow, leaving them with wounds;

9.verse: their own tongues make them stumble. All who see them shake their heads.

10.verse: Everyone is awestruck — they acknowledge that it is God at work, they understand what he has done.

1.verse: For the leader. A psalm of David. A song:

2.verse: To you, God, in Tziyon, silence is praise; and vows to you are to be fulfilled.

3.verse: You who listen to prayer, to you all living creatures come.

4.verse: When deeds of wickedness overwhelm me, you will atone for our crimes.

5.verse: How blessed are those you choose and bring near, so that they can remain in your courtyards! We will be satisfied with the goodness of your house, the Holy Place of your temple.

6.verse: It is just that you answer us with awesome deeds, God of our salvation, you in whom all put their trust, to the ends of the earth and on distant seas.

7.verse: By your strength you set up the mountains. You are clothed with power.

8.verse: You still the roaring of the seas, their crashing waves, and the peoples’ turmoil.

9.verse: This is why those living at the ends of the earth stand in awe of your signs. The places where the sun rises and sets you cause to sing for joy.

10.verse: You care for the earth and water it, you enrich it greatly; with the river of God, full of water, you provide them grain and prepare the ground.

11.verse: Soaking its furrows and settling its soil, you soften it with showers and bless its growth.

12.verse: You crown the year with your goodness, your tracks overflow with richness.

13.verse: The desert pastures drip water, the hills are wrapped with joy,

1.verse: For the leader. A song. A psalm: Shout to God, all the earth!

2.verse: Sing the glory of his name, make his praise glorious.

3.verse: Tell God, “How awesome are your deeds! At your great power, your enemies cringe.

4.verse: All the earth bows down to you, sings praises to you, sings praises to your name.” (Selah)

5.verse: Come and see what God has done, his awesome dealings with humankind.

6.verse: He turned the sea into dry land. They passed through the river on foot; there we rejoiced in him.

7.verse: With his power he rules forever; his eyes keep watch on the nations. Let no rebel arise to challenge him. (Selah)

8.verse: Bless our God, you peoples! Let the sound of his praise be heard!

9.verse: He preserves our lives and keeps our feet from stumbling.

10.verse: For you, God, have tested us, refined us as silver is refined.

11.verse: You brought us into the net and bound our bodies fast.

12.verse: You made men ride over our heads; we went through fire and water. But you brought us out to a place of plenty.

13.verse: I will come into your house with burnt offerings, I will fulfill my vows to you,

14.verse: those my lips pronounced and my mouth spoke when I was in distress.

15.verse: I will offer you burnt offerings of fattened animals, along with the sweet smoke of rams; I will offer bulls and goats. (Selah)

16.verse: Come and listen, all you who fear God, and I will tell what he has done for me.

17.verse: I cried out to him with my mouth, his praise was on my tongue.

18.verse: Had I cherished evil thoughts, Adonai would not have listened.

19.verse: But in fact, God did listen; he paid attention to my prayer.

20.verse: Blessed be God, who did not reject my prayer or turn his grace away from me.

1.verse: For the leader. With stringed instruments. A psalm. A song:

2.verse: God, be gracious to us, and bless us. May he make his face shine toward us, (Selah)

3.verse: so that your way may be known on earth, your salvation among all nations.

4.verse: Let the peoples give thanks to you, God; let the peoples give thanks to you, all of them.

5.verse: Let the nations be glad and shout for joy, for you will judge the peoples fairly and guide the nations on earth. (Selah)

6.verse: Let the peoples give thanks to you, God; let the peoples give thanks to you, all of them.

7.verse: The earth has yielded its harvest; may God, our God, bless us.

1.verse: For the leader. A psalm of David. A song:

2.verse: Let God arise, let his enemies be scattered; let those who hate him flee from his presence.

3.verse: Drive them away as smoke is driven away; like wax melting in the presence of a fire, let the wicked perish in the presence of God.

4.verse: But let the righteous rejoice and be glad in God’s presence; yes, let them exult and rejoice.

5.verse: Sing to God, sing praises to his name; extol him who rides on the clouds by his name, Yah; and be glad in his presence.

6.verse: God in his holy dwelling, is a father to orphans and defender of widows.

7.verse: God gives homes to those who are alone and leads prisoners out into prosperity. But rebels must live in a parched wasteland.

8.verse: God, when you went out at the head of your people, when you marched out through the wilderness, (Selah)

9.verse: the earth quaked, and rain poured from the sky, at the presence of God. Even Sinai [shook] at the presence of God, the God of Isra’el.

10.verse: You rained down showers in plenty, God; when your heritage was weary, you restored it.

11.verse: Your flock settled in it; in your goodness, God, you provided for the poor.

12.verse: Adonai gives the command; the women with the good news are a mighty army.

13.verse: Kings and their armies are fleeing, fleeing, while the women at home divide the spoil.

14.verse: Even if you lie among the animal stalls, there are wings of a dove covered with silver and its plumes with green gold.

15.verse: When Shaddai scatters kings there, snow falls on Tzalmon.

16.verse: You mighty mountain, Mount Bashan! You rugged mountain, Mount Bashan!

17.verse: You rugged mountain, why look with envy at the mountain God wants for his place to live? Truly, ADONAI will live there forever.

18.verse: God’s chariots are myriads, repeated thousands; Adonai is among them as in Sinai, in holiness.

19.verse: After you went up into the heights, you led captivity captive, you took gifts among mankind, yes, even among the rebels, so that Yah, God, might live there.

20.verse: Blessed be Adonai! Every day he bears our burden, does God, our salvation. (Selah)

21.verse: Our God is a God who saves; from ADONAI Adonai comes escape from death.

22.verse: God will surely crush the heads of his enemies, the hairy crowns of those who continue in their guilt.

23.verse: Adonai said, “I will bring them back from Bashan, I will fetch [those rebels] even from the depths of the sea;

24.verse: so that you can wash your feet in their blood, and your dogs’ tongues too can get their share from your foes.

25.verse: They see your processions, God, the processions of my God, my king, in holiness.

26.verse: The singers are in front, the musicians last, in the middle are girls playing tambourines.

27.verse: “In choruses, bless God, Adonai, you whose source is Isra’el.”

28.verse: There is Binyamin, the youngest, at the head; the princes of Y’hudah, crowding along; the princes of Z’vulun; the princes of Naftali.

29.verse: God, summon your strength! Use your strength, God, as you did for us before,

30.verse: from your temple in Yerushalayim, where kings will bring tribute to you.

31.verse: Rebuke the wild beast of the reeds, that herd of bulls with their calves, the peoples, who ingratiate themselves with bars of silver; let him scatter the peoples who take pleasure in fighting.

32.verse: Let envoys come from Egypt, Let Ethiopia stretch out its hands to God.

33.verse: Sing to God, kingdoms of the earth! Sing praises to Adonai, (Selah)

34.verse: to him who rides on the most ancient heavens. Listen, as he utters his voice, a mighty voice!

35.verse: Acknowledge that strength belongs to God, with his majesty over Isra’el and his strength in the skies.

1.verse: For the leader. Set to “Lilies.” By David:

2.verse: Save me, God! For the water threatens my life.

3.verse: I am sinking down in the mud, and there is no foothold; I have come into deep water; the flood is sweeping over me.

4.verse: I am exhausted from crying, my throat is dry and sore, my eyes are worn out with looking for my God.

5.verse: Those who hate me for no reason outnumber the hairs on my head. My persecutors are powerful, my enemies accuse me falsely. Am I expected to return things I didn’t steal?

6.verse: God, you know how foolish I am; my guilt is not hidden from you.

7.verse: Let those who put their hope in you, Adonai ELOHIM-Tzva’ot, not be put to shame through me; let those who are seeking you, God of Isra’el, not be disgraced through me.

8.verse: For your sake I suffer insults, shame covers my face.

9.verse: I am estranged from my brothers, an alien to my mother’s children,

10.verse: because zeal for your house is eating me up, and on me are falling the insults of those insulting you.

11.verse: I weep bitterly, and I fast, but that too occasions insults.

12.verse: I clothe myself with sackcloth and become an object of scorn,

13.verse: the gossip of those sitting by the town gate, the theme of drunkards’ songs.

14.verse: As for me, ADONAI, let my prayer to you come at an acceptable time; In your great grace, God, answer me with the truth of your salvation.

15.verse: Rescue me from the mud! Don’t let me sink! Let me be rescued from those who hate me and from the deep water.

16.verse: Don’t let the floodwaters overwhelm me, don’t let the deep swallow me up, don’t let the pit close its mouth over me.

17.verse: Answer me, ADONAI, for your grace is good; in your great mercy, turn to me.

18.verse: Don’t hide your face from your servant, for I am in trouble; answer me quickly.

19.verse: Come near to me, and redeem me; ransom me because of my enemies.

20.verse: You know how I am insulted, shamed and disgraced; before you stand all my foes.

21.verse: Insults have broken my heart to the point that I could die. I hoped that someone would show compassion, but nobody did; and that there would be comforters, but I found none.

22.verse: They put poison in my food; in my thirst, they gave me vinegar to drink.

23.verse: Let their dining table before them become a snare; when they are at peace, let it become a trap;

24.verse: let their eyes be darkened, so that they can’t see, and let their bodies always be stumbling.

25.verse: Pour out your fury on them, let your fierce anger overtake them.

26.verse: Let the place where they live be desolate, with no one to live in their tents,

27.verse: for persecuting someone you had already stricken, for adding to the pain of those you wounded.

28.verse: Add guilt to their guilt, don’t let them enter your righteousness.

29.verse: Erase them from the book of life, let them not be written with the righteous.

30.verse: Meanwhile, I am afflicted and hurting; God, let your saving power raise me up.

31.verse: I will praise God’s name with a song and extol him with thanksgiving.

32.verse: This will please ADONAI more than a bull, with its horns and hoofs.

33.verse: The afflicted will see it and rejoice; you seeking after God, let your heart revive.

34.verse: For ADONAI pays attention to the needy and doesn’t scorn his captive people.

35.verse: Let heaven and earth praise him, the seas and whatever moves in them.

36.verse: For God will save Tziyon, he will build the cities of Y’hudah. [His people] will settle there and possess it.

1.verse: For the leader. By David. As a reminder:

2.verse: God, rescue me! ADONAI, hurry and help me!

3.verse: May those who seek my life be disgraced and humiliated. May those who take pleasure in doing me harm be turned back and put to confusion.

4.verse: May those who jeer, “Aha! Aha!” withdraw because of their shame.

5.verse: But may all those who seek you be glad and take joy in you. May those who love your salvation say always, “God is great and glorious!”

1.verse: In you, ADONAI, I have taken refuge; let me never be put to shame.

2.verse: In your righteousness, rescue me; and help me to escape. Turn your ear toward me, and deliver me.

3.verse: Be for me a sheltering rock, where I can always come. You have determined to save me, because you are my bedrock and stronghold.

4.verse: My God, help me escape from the power of the wicked, from the grasp of the unjust and ruthless.

5.verse: For you are my hope, Adonai ELOHIM, in whom I have trusted since I was young.

6.verse: From birth I have relied on you; it was you who took me from my mother’s womb.

7.verse: To many, I am an amazing example; but you are strong protection for me.

8.verse: My mouth is full of praise for you, filled with your glory all day long.

9.verse: Don’t reject me when I grow old; when my strength fails, don’t abandon me.

10.verse: For my enemies are talking about me, those seeking my life are plotting together.

11.verse: They say, “God has abandoned him; go after him, and seize him, because no one will save him.”

12.verse: God, don’t distance yourself from me! My God, hurry to help me!

13.verse: May those who are opposed to me be put to shame and ruin; may those who seek to harm me be covered with scorn and disgrace.

14.verse: But I, I will always hope and keep adding to your praise.

15.verse: All day long my mouth will tell of your righteous deeds and acts of salvation, though their number is past my knowing.

16.verse: I will come in the power of Adonai ELOHIM and recall your righteousness, yours alone.

17.verse: God, you have taught me since I was young, and I still proclaim your wonderful works.

18.verse: So now that I’m old, and my hair is gray, don’t abandon me, God, till I have proclaimed your strength to the next generation, your power to all who will come,

19.verse: your righteousness too, God, which reaches to the heights. God, you have done great things; who is there like you?

20.verse: You have made me see much trouble and hardship, but you will revive me again and bring me up from the depths of the earth.

21.verse: You will increase my honor; turn and comfort me.

22.verse: As for me, I will praise you with a lyre for your faithfulness, my God. I will sing praises to you with a lute, Holy One of Isra’el.

23.verse: My lips will shout for joy; I will sing your praise, because you have redeemed me.

24.verse: All day long my tongue will speak of your righteousness. For those who are seeking to harm me will be put to shame and disgraced.

1.verse: By Shlomo: God, give the king your fairness in judgment, endow this son of kings with your righteousness,

2.verse: so that he can govern your people rightly and your poor with justice.

3.verse: May mountains and hills provide your people with peace through righteousness.

4.verse: May he defend the oppressed among the people, save the needy and crush the oppressor.

5.verse: May they fear you as long as the sun endures and as long as the moon, through all generations.

6.verse: May he be like rain falling on mown grass, like showers watering the land.

7.verse: In his days, let the righteous flourish and peace abound, till the moon is no more.

8.verse: May his empire stretch from sea to sea, from the [Euphrates] River to the ends of the earth.

9.verse: May desert-dwellers bow before him; may his enemies lick the dust.

10.verse: The kings of Tarshish and the coasts will pay him tribute; the kings of Sh’va and S’va will offer gifts.

11.verse: Yes, all kings will prostrate themselves before him; all nations will serve him.

12.verse: For he will rescue the needy when they cry, the poor too and those with none to help them.

13.verse: He will have pity on the poor and needy; and the lives of the needy he will save.

14.verse: He will redeem them from oppression and violence; their blood will be precious in his view.

15.verse: May [the king] live long! May they give him gold from the land of Sh’va! May they pray for him continually; yes, bless him all day long.

16.verse: May there be an abundance of grain in the land, all the way to the tops of the mountains. May its crops rustle like the L’vanon. May people blossom in the city like the grasses in the fields.

17.verse: May his name endure forever, his name, Yinnon, as long as the sun. May people bless themselves in him, may all nations call him happy.

18.verse: Blessed be ADONAI, God, the God of Isra’el, who alone works wonders.

19.verse: Blessed be his glorious name forever, and may the whole earth be filled with his glory. Amen. Amen.

20.verse: This completes the prayers of David the son of Yishai.

1.verse: Book III: Psalms 73–89 - A psalm of Asaf: How good God is to Isra’el, to those who are pure in heart!

2.verse: But as for me, I lost my balance, my feet nearly slipped,

3.verse: when I grew envious of the arrogant and saw how the wicked prosper.

4.verse: For when their death comes, it is painless; and meanwhile, their bodies are healthy;

5.verse: they don’t have ordinary people’s troubles, they aren’t plagued like others.

6.verse: So for them, pride is a necklace; and violence clothes them like a robe.

7.verse: Their eyes peep out through folds of fat; evil thoughts overflow from their hearts.

8.verse: They scoff and speak with malice, they loftily utter threats.

9.verse: They set their mouths against heaven; their tongues swagger through the earth.

10.verse: Therefore his people return here and [thoughtlessly] suck up that whole cup of water.

11.verse: Then they ask, “How does God know? Does the Most High really have knowledge?”

12.verse: Yes, this is what the wicked are like; those free of misfortune keep increasing their wealth.

13.verse: It’s all for nothing that I’ve kept my heart clean and washed my hands, staying free of guilt;

14.verse: for all day long I am plagued; my punishment comes every morning.

15.verse: If I had said, “I will talk like them,” I would have betrayed a generation of your children.

16.verse: When I tried to understand all this, I found it too hard for me —

17.verse: until I went into the sanctuaries of God and grasped what their destiny would be.

18.verse: Indeed, you place them on a slippery slope and make them fall to their ruin.

19.verse: How suddenly they are destroyed, swept away by terrors!

20.verse: They are like a dream when one awakens; Adonai, when you rouse yourself, you will despise their phantoms.

21.verse: When I had a sour attitude and felt stung by pained emotions,

22.verse: I was too stupid to understand; I was like a brute beast with you.

23.verse: Nevertheless, I am always with you; you hold my right hand.

24.verse: You will guide me with your advice; and afterwards, you will receive me with honor.

25.verse: Whom do I have in heaven but you? And with you, I lack nothing on earth.

26.verse: My mind and body may fail; but God is the rock for my mind and my portion forever.

27.verse: Those who are far from you will perish; you destroy all who adulterously leave you.

28.verse: But for me, the nearness of God is my good; I have made Adonai ELOHIM my refuge, so that I can tell of all your works.

1.verse: A maskil of Asaf: Why have you rejected us forever, God, with your anger smoking against the sheep you once pastured?

2.verse: Remember your community, which you acquired long ago, the tribe you redeemed to be your very own. Remember Mount Tziyon, where you came to live.

3.verse: Hurry your steps to these endless ruins, to the sanctuary devastated by the enemy.

4.verse: The roar of your foes filled your meeting-place; they raised their own banners as a sign of their conquest.

5.verse: The place seemed like a thicket of trees when lumbermen hack away with their axes.

6.verse: With hatchet and hammer they banged away, smashing all the carved woodwork.

7.verse: They set your sanctuary on fire, tore down and profaned the abode of your name.

8.verse: They said to themselves, “We will oppress them completely.” They have burned down all God’s meeting-places in the land.

9.verse: We see no signs, there is no prophet any more; none of us knows how long it will last.

10.verse: How much longer, God, will the foe jeer at us? Will the enemy insult your name forever?

11.verse: Why do you hold back your hand? Draw your right hand from your coat, and finish them off!

12.verse: God has been my king from earliest times, acting to save throughout all the earth.

13.verse: By your strength you split the sea in two, in the water you smashed sea monsters’ heads,

14.verse: you crushed the heads of Livyatan and gave it as food to the creatures of the desert.

15.verse: You cut channels for springs and streams, you dried up rivers that had never failed.

16.verse: The day is yours, and the night is yours; it was you who established light and sun.

17.verse: It was you who fixed all the limits of the earth, you made summer and winter.

18.verse: Remember how the enemy scoffs at ADONAI, how a brutish people insults your name.

19.verse: Don’t hand over the soul of your dove to wild beasts, don’t forget forever the life of your poor.

20.verse: Look to the covenant, for the land’s dark places are full of the haunts of violence.

21.verse: Don’t let the oppressed retreat in confusion; let the poor and needy praise your name.

22.verse: Arise, God, and defend your cause; remember how brutish men insult you all day.

23.verse: Don’t forget what your foes are saying, the ever-rising uproar of your adversaries.

1.verse: For the leader. Set to “Do Not Destroy!” A psalm of Asaf. A song:

2.verse: We give thanks to you, God, we give thanks; your name is near, people tell of your wonders.

3.verse: “At the time of my own choice, I will dispense justice fairly.

4.verse: When the earth quakes, with all living on it, it is I who hold its support-pillars firm.” (Selah)

5.verse: To the boastful I say, “Do not boast!” and to the wicked, “Don’t flaunt your strength!

6.verse: Don’t flaunt your strength so proudly; don’t speak arrogantly, with your nose in the air!

7.verse: For you will not be raised to power by those in the east, the west or the desert;

8.verse: since God is the judge; and it is he who puts down one and lifts up another.

9.verse: In ADONAI’s hand there is a cup of wine, foaming, richly spiced; when he pours it out, all the wicked of the earth will drain it, drinking it to the dregs.”

10.verse: But I will always speak out, singing praises to the God of Ya‘akov.

1.verse: For the leader. With string music. A psalm of Asaf. A song:

2.verse: In Y’hudah God is known; his name is great in Isra’el.

3.verse: His tent is in Shalem, his place is in Tziyon.

4.verse: There he broke the flashing arrows, the shield, the sword, and the weapons of war. (Selah)

5.verse: You are glorious, majestic, more so than mountains of prey.

6.verse: The bravest have been stripped of their spoil and now are sleeping their final sleep; not one of these courageous men finds strength to raise his hands.

7.verse: At your rebuke, God of Ya‘akov, riders and horses lie stunned.

8.verse: You are fearsome! When once you are angry, who can stand in your presence?

9.verse: You pronounce sentence from heaven; the earth grows silent with fear

10.verse: when God arises to judge, to save all the humble of the earth. (Selah)

11.verse: Human wrath serves only to praise you; what remains of this wrath you wear as an ornament.

12.verse: Make vows to ADONAI your God, and keep them; all who are around him must bring presents to the one who should be feared.

1.verse: For the leader. For Y’dutun. A psalm of Asaf:

2.verse: I cry aloud to God, aloud to God; and he hears me.

3.verse: On the day of my distress I am seeking Adonai; my hands are lifted up; my tears flow all night without ceasing; my heart refuses comfort.

4.verse: When remembering God, I moan; when I ponder, my spirit fails. (Selah)

5.verse: You hold my eyelids [and keep me from sleeping]; I am too troubled to speak.

6.verse: I think about the days of old, the years of long ago;

7.verse: in the night I remember my song, I commune with myself, my spirit inquires:

8.verse: “Will Adonai reject forever? will he never show his favor again?

9.verse: Has his grace permanently disappeared? Is his word to all generations done away?

10.verse: Has God forgotten to be compassionate? Has he in anger withheld his mercy?” (Selah)

11.verse: Then I add, “That’s my weakness — [supposing] the Most High’s right hand could change.”

12.verse: So I will remind myself of Yah’s doings; yes, I will remember your wonders of old.

13.verse: I will meditate on your work and think about what you have done.

14.verse: God, your way is in holiness. What god is as great as God?

15.verse: You are the God who does wonders, you revealed your strength to the peoples.

16.verse: With your arm you redeemed your people, the descendants of Ya‘akov and Yosef. (Selah)

17.verse: The water saw you, God; the water saw you and writhed in anguish, agitated to its depths.

18.verse: The clouds poured water, the skies thundered, and your arrows flashed here and there.

19.verse: The sound of your thunder was in the whirlwind, the lightning flashes lit up the world, the earth trembled and shook.

20.verse: Your way went through the sea, your path through the turbulent waters; but your footsteps could not be traced.

1.verse: A maskil of Asaf: Listen, my people, to my teaching; turn your ears to the words from my mouth.

2.verse: I will speak to you in parables and explain mysteries from days of old.

3.verse: The things which we have heard and known, and which our fathers told us

4.verse: we will not hide from their descendants; we will tell the generation to come the praises of ADONAI and his strength, the wonders that he has performed.

5.verse: He raised up a testimony in Ya‘akov and established a Torah in Isra’el. He commanded our ancestors to make this known to their children,

6.verse: so that the next generation would know it, the children not yet born, who would themselves arise and tell their own children,

7.verse: who could then put their confidence in God, not forgetting God’s deeds, but obeying his mitzvot.

8.verse: Then they would not be like their ancestors, a stubborn, rebellious generation, a generation with unprepared hearts, with spirits unfaithful to God.

9.verse: The people of Efrayim, though armed with bows and arrows, turned their backs on the day of battle.

10.verse: They did not keep the covenant of God and refused to live by his Torah.

11.verse: They forgot what he had done, his wonders which he had shown them.

12.verse: He had done wonderful things in the presence of their ancestors in the land of Egypt, in the region of Tzo‘an.

13.verse: He split the sea and made them pass through, he made the waters stand up like a wall.

14.verse: He also led them by day with a cloud and all night long with light from a fire.

15.verse: He broke apart the rocks in the desert and let them drink as if from boundless depths;

16.verse: yes, he brought streams out of the rock, making the water flow down like rivers.

17.verse: Yet they sinned still more against him, rebelling in the wilderness against the Most High;

18.verse: in their hearts they tested God by demanding food that would satisfy their cravings.

19.verse: Yes, they spoke against God by asking, “Can God spread a table in the desert?

20.verse: True, he struck the rock, and water gushed out, until the vadis overflowed; but what about bread? Can he give that? Can he provide meat for his people?”

21.verse: Therefore, when ADONAI heard, he was angry; fire blazed up against Ya‘akov; his anger mounted against Isra’el;

22.verse: because they had no faith in God, no trust in his power to save.

23.verse: So he commanded the skies above and opened the doors of heaven.

24.verse: He rained down man on them as food; he gave them grain from heaven —

25.verse: mortals ate the bread of angels; he provided for them to the full.

26.verse: He stirred up the east wind in heaven, brought on the south wind by his power,

27.verse: and rained down meat on them like dust, birds flying thick as the sand on the seashore.

28.verse: He let them fall in the middle of their camp, all around their tents.

29.verse: So they ate till they were satisfied; he gave them what they craved.

30.verse: They were still fulfilling their craving, the food was still in their mouths,

31.verse: when the anger of God rose up against them and slaughtered their strongest men, laying low the young men of Isra’el.

32.verse: Still, they kept on sinning and put no faith in his wonders.

33.verse: Therefore, he ended their days in futility and their years in terror.

34.verse: When he brought death among them, they would seek him; they would repent and seek God eagerly,

35.verse: remembering that God was their Rock, El ‘Elyon their Redeemer.

36.verse: But they tried to deceive him with their words, they lied to him with their tongues;

37.verse: for their hearts were not right with him, and they were unfaithful to his covenant.

38.verse: Yet he, because he is full of compassion, forgave their sin and did not destroy; many times he turned away his anger and didn’t rouse all his wrath.

39.verse: So he remembered that they were but flesh, a wind that blows past and does not return.

40.verse: How often they rebelled against him in the desert and grieved him in the wastelands!

41.verse: Repeatedly they challenged God and pained the Holy One of Isra’el.

42.verse: They didn’t remember how he used his hand on the day he redeemed them from their enemy,

43.verse: how he displayed his signs in Egypt, his wonders in the region of Tzo‘an.

44.verse: He turned their rivers into blood, so they couldn’t drink from their streams.

45.verse: He sent swarms of flies, which devoured them, and frogs, which destroyed them.

46.verse: He gave their harvest to shearer-worms, the fruit of their labor to locusts.

47.verse: He destroyed their vineyards with hail and their sycamore-figs with frost.

48.verse: Their cattle too he gave over to the hail and their flocks to lightning bolts.

49.verse: He sent over them his fierce anger, fury, indignation and trouble, with a company of destroying angels

50.verse: to clear a path for his wrath. He did not spare them from death, but gave them over to the plague,

51.verse: striking all the firstborn in Egypt, the firstfruits of their strength in the tents of Ham.

52.verse: But his own people he led out like sheep, guiding them like a flock in the desert.

53.verse: He led them safely, and they weren’t afraid, even when the sea overwhelmed their foes.

54.verse: He brought them to his holy land, to the hill-country won by his right hand.

55.verse: He expelled nations before them, apportioned them property to inherit and made Isra’el’s tribes live in their tents.

56.verse: Yet they tested El ‘Elyon and rebelled against him, refusing to obey his instructions.

57.verse: They turned away and were faithless, like their fathers; they were unreliable, like a bow without tension.

58.verse: They provoked him with their high places and made him jealous with their idols.

59.verse: God heard, and he was angry; he came to detest Isra’el completely.

60.verse: He abandoned the tabernacle at Shiloh, the tent he had made where he could live among people.

61.verse: He gave his strength into exile, his pride to the power of the foe.

62.verse: He gave his people over to the sword and grew angry with his own heritage.

63.verse: Fire consumed their young men, their virgins had no wedding-song,

64.verse: their cohanim fell by the sword, and their widows could not weep.

65.verse: Then Adonai awoke, as if from sleep, like a warrior shouting for joy from wine.

66.verse: He struck his foes, driving them back and putting them to perpetual shame.

67.verse: Rejecting the tents of Yosef and passing over the tribe of Efrayim,

68.verse: he chose the tribe of Y’hudah, Mount Tziyon, which he loved.

69.verse: He built his sanctuary like the heights; like the earth, he made it to last forever.

70.verse: He chose David to be his servant, taking him from the sheep-yards;

71.verse: from tending nursing ewes he brought him to shepherd Ya‘akov his people, Isra’el his heritage.

72.verse: With upright heart he shepherded them and guided them with skillful hands.

1.verse: A psalm of Asaf: God, the pagans have entered your heritage. They have defiled your holy temple and turned Yerushalayim into rubble.

2.verse: They have given the corpses of your servants as food for the birds in the air, yes, the flesh of those faithful to you for the wild animals of the earth.

3.verse: All around Yerushalayim they have shed their blood like water, and no one is left to bury them.

4.verse: We suffer the taunts of our neighbors, we are mocked and scorned by those around us.

5.verse: How long, ADONAI? Will you be angry forever? How long will your jealousy burn like fire?

6.verse: Pour out your wrath on the nations that don’t know you, on the kingdoms that don’t call out your name;

7.verse: for they have devoured Ya‘akov and left his home a waste.

8.verse: Don’t count past iniquities against us, but let your compassion come quickly to meet us, for we have been brought very low.

9.verse: Help us, God of our salvation, for the sake of the glory of your name. Deliver us, forgive our sins, for your name’s sake.

10.verse: Why should the nations ask, “Where is their God?” Let the vengeance taken on your servants’ shed blood be known among the nations before our eyes.

11.verse: Let the groaning of the captives come before you; by your great strength save those condemned to death.

12.verse: Repay our neighbors sevenfold where they can feel it for the insults they inflicted on you, Adonai.

13.verse: Then we, your people and the flock in your pasture, will give you thanks forever. From generation to generation we will proclaim your praise.

1.verse: For the leader. Set to “Lilies.” A testimony. A psalm of Asaf:

2.verse: Shepherd of Isra’el, listen! You who lead Yosef like a flock, you whose throne is on the k’ruvim, shine out!

3.verse: Before Efrayim, Binyamin and M’nasheh, rouse your power; and come to save us.

4.verse: God, restore us! Make your face shine, and we will be saved.

5.verse: ADONAI, God of armies, how long will you be angry with your people’s prayers?

6.verse: You have fed them tears as their bread and made them drink tears in abundance.

7.verse: You make our neighbors fight over us, and our enemies mock us.

8.verse: God of armies, restore us! Make your face shine, and we will be saved.

9.verse: You brought a vine out of Egypt, you expelled the nations and planted it,

10.verse: you cleared a space for it; then it took root firmly and filled the land.

11.verse: The mountains were covered with its shade, the mighty cedars with its branches;

12.verse: It put out branches as far as the sea and shoots to the [Euphrates] River.

13.verse: Why did you break down [the vineyard’s] wall, so that all passing by can pluck [its fruit]?

14.verse: The boar from the forest tears it apart; wild creatures from the fields feed on it.

15.verse: God of armies, please come back! Look from heaven, see, and tend this vine!

16.verse: Protect what your right hand planted, the son you made strong for yourself.

17.verse: It is burned by fire, it is cut down; they perish at your frown of rebuke.

18.verse: Help the man at your right hand, the son of man you made strong for yourself.

19.verse: Then we won’t turn away from you — if you revive us, we will call on your name.

1.verse: For the Leader. On the gittit. By Asaf:

2.verse: Sing for joy to God our strength! Shout to the God of Ya‘akov!

3.verse: Start the music! Beat the drum! Play the sweet lyre and the lute!

4.verse: Sound the shofar at Rosh-Hodesh and at full moon for the pilgrim feast,

5.verse: because this is a law for Isra’el, a ruling of the God of Ya‘akov.

6.verse: He placed it as a testimony in Y’hosef when he went out against the land of Egypt. I heard an unfamiliar voice say,

7.verse: “I lifted the load from his shoulder; his hands were freed from the [laborer’s] basket.

8.verse: You called out when you were in trouble, and I rescued you; I answered you from the thundercloud; I tested you at the M’rivah Spring [by saying,] (Selah)

9.verse: “‘Hear, my people, while I give you warning! Isra’el, if you would only listen to me!

10.verse: There is not to be with you any foreign god; you are not to worship an alien god.

11.verse: I am ADONAI your God, who brought you up from the land of Egypt. Open your mouth, and I will fill it.’

12.verse: “But my people did not listen to my voice; Isra’el would have none of me.

13.verse: So I gave them over to their stubborn hearts, to live by their own plans.

14.verse: How I wish my people would listen to me, that Isra’el would live by my ways!

15.verse: I would quickly subdue their enemies and turn my hand against their foes.

16.verse: Those who hate ADONAI would cringe before him, while [Isra’el’s] time would last forever.

1.verse: A psalm of Asaf: Elohim [God] stands in the divine assembly; there with the elohim [judges], he judges:

2.verse: “How long will you go on judging unfairly, favoring the wicked? (Selah)

3.verse: Give justice to the weak and fatherless! Uphold the rights of the wretched and poor!

4.verse: Rescue the destitute and needy; deliver them from the power of the wicked!”

5.verse: They don’t know, they don’t understand, they wander about in darkness; meanwhile, all the foundations of the earth are being undermined.

6.verse: “My decree is: ‘You are elohim [gods, judges], sons of the Most High all of you.

7.verse: Nevertheless, you will die like mortals; like any prince, you will fall.’”

8.verse: Rise up, Elohim, and judge the earth; for all the nations are yours.

1.verse: A song. A psalm of Asaf:

2.verse: God, don’t remain silent! Don’t stay quiet, God, or still;

3.verse: because here are your enemies, causing an uproar; those who hate you are raising their heads,

4.verse: craftily conspiring against your people, consulting together against those you treasure.

5.verse: They say, “Come, let’s wipe them out as a nation; let the name of Isra’el be remembered no more!”

6.verse: With one mind they plot their schemes; the covenant they have made is against you —

7.verse: the tents of Edom and the Yishma‘elim, Mo’av and the Hagrim,

8.verse: G’val, ‘Amon and ‘Amalek, P’leshet with those living in Tzor; (Selah)

9.verse: Ashur too is allied with them, to reinforce the descendants of Lot.

10.verse: Do to them as you did to Midyan, to Sisra and Yavin at Vadi Kishon —

11.verse: they were destroyed at ‘Ein-Dor and became manure for the ground.

12.verse: Make their leaders like ‘Orev and Ze’ev, all their princes like Zevach and Tzalmuna,

13.verse: who said, “Let’s take possession of God’s meadows for ourselves.”

14.verse: My God, make them like whirling dust, like chaff driven by the wind.

15.verse: Like fire burning up the forest, like a flame that sets the mountains ablaze,

16.verse: drive them away with your storm, terrify them with your tempest.

17.verse: Fill their faces with shame, so that they will seek your name, ADONAI.

18.verse: Let them be ashamed and fearful forever; yes, let them perish in disgrace.

1.verse: For the leader. On the gittit. A psalm of the sons of Korach:

2.verse: How deeply loved are your dwelling-places, ADONAI-Tzva’ot!

3.verse: My soul yearns, yes, faints with longing for the courtyards of ADONAI; my heart and body cry for joy to the living God.

4.verse: As the sparrow finds herself a home and the swallow her nest, where she lays her young, [so my resting-place is] by your altars, ADONAI-Tzva’ot, my king and my God.

5.verse: How happy are those who live in your house; they never cease to praise you! (Selah)

6.verse: How happy the man whose strength is in you, in whose heart are [pilgrim] highways.

7.verse: Passing through the [dry] Baka Valley, they make it a place of springs, and the early rain clothes it with blessings.

8.verse: They go from strength to strength and appear before God in Tziyon.

9.verse: ADONAI, God of armies, hear my prayer; listen, God of Ya‘akov. (Selah)

10.verse: God, see our shield [the king]; look at the face of your anointed.

11.verse: Better a day in your courtyards than a thousand [days elsewhere]. Better just standing at the door of my God’s house than living in the tents of the wicked.

12.verse: For ADONAI, God, is a sun and a shield; ADONAI bestows favor and honor; he will not withhold anything good from those whose lives are pure.

1.verse: For the leader. A psalm of the sons of Korach:

2.verse: ADONAI, you have shown favor to your land; you have restored the fortunes of Ya‘akov,

3.verse: taken away the guilt of your people, pardoned all their sin, (Selah)

4.verse: withdrawn all your wrath, turned from your fierce anger.

5.verse: Restore us, God of our salvation, renounce your displeasure with us.

6.verse: Are you to stay angry with us forever? Will your fury last through all generations?

7.verse: Won’t you revive us again, so your people can rejoice in you?

8.verse: Show us your grace, ADONAI; grant us your salvation.

9.verse: I am listening. What will God, ADONAI, say? For he will speak peace to his people, to his holy ones — but only if they don’t relapse into folly.

10.verse: His salvation is near for those who fear him, so that glory will be in our land.

11.verse: Grace and truth have met together; justice and peace have kissed each other.

12.verse: Truth springs up from the earth, and justice looks down from heaven.

13.verse: ADONAI will also grant prosperity; our land will yield its harvest.

1.verse: A prayer of David: Listen, ADONAI, and answer me, for I am poor and needy.

2.verse: Preserve my life, for I am faithful; save your servant, who puts his trust in you because you are my God.

3.verse: Take pity on me, Adonai, for I cry to you all day.

4.verse: Fill your servant’s heart with joy, for to you, Adonai, I lift my heart.

5.verse: Adonai, you are kind and forgiving, full of grace toward all who call on you.

6.verse: Listen, ADONAI, to my prayer; pay attention to my pleading cry.

7.verse: On the day of my trouble I am calling on you, for you will answer me.

8.verse: There is none like you among the gods, Adonai; no deeds compare with yours.

9.verse: All the nations you have made will come and bow before you, Adonai; they will honor your name.

10.verse: For you are great, and you do wonders; you alone are God.

11.verse: ADONAI, teach me your way, so that I can live by your truth; make me single-hearted, so that I can fear your name.

12.verse: I will thank you, Adonai my God, with my whole heart; and I will glorify your name forever.

13.verse: For your grace toward me is so great! You have rescued me from the lowest part of Sh’ol.

14.verse: God, arrogant men are rising against me, a gang of brutes is seeking my life, and to you they pay no attention.

15.verse: But you, Adonai, are a merciful, compassionate God, slow to anger and rich in grace and truth.

16.verse: Turn to me, and show me your favor; strengthen your servant, save your slave-girl’s son.

17.verse: Give me a sign of your favor, so that those who hate me will see it and be ashamed, because you, ADONAI, have helped and comforted me.

1.verse: A psalm of the sons of Korach. A song: On the holy mountains is [the city’s] foundation.

2.verse: ADONAI loves the gates of Tziyon more than all the dwellings in Ya‘akov.

3.verse: Glorious things are said about you, city of God. (Selah)

4.verse: I count Rahav and Bavel among those who know me; Of P’leshet, Tzor and Ethiopia [they will say], “This one was born there.”

5.verse: But of Tziyon it will be said, “This one and that was born in it, for the Most High himself establishes it.”

6.verse: When he registers the peoples, ADONAI will record, “This one was born there.” (Selah)

7.verse: Singers and dancers alike say, “For me, you are the source of everything.”

1.verse: A song. A psalm of the sons of Korach. For the leader. Set to “Sickness that Causes Suffering.” A maskil of Heiman the Ezrachi.

2.verse: ADONAI, God of my salvation, when I cry out to you in the night,

3.verse: let my prayer come before you, turn your ear to my cry for help!

4.verse: For I am oversupplied with troubles, which have brought me to the brink of Sh’ol.

5.verse: I am counted among those going down to the pit, like a man who is beyond help,

6.verse: left by myself among the dead, like the slain who lie in the grave — you no longer remember them; they are cut off from your care.

7.verse: You plunged me into the bottom of the pit, into dark places, into the depths.

8.verse: Your wrath lies heavily on me; your waves crashing over me keep me down. (Selah)

9.verse: You separated me from my close friends, made me repulsive to them; I am caged in, with no escape;

10.verse: my eyes grow dim from suffering. I call on you, ADONAI, every day; I spread out my hands to you.

11.verse: Will you perform wonders for the dead? Can the ghosts of the dead rise up and praise you? (Selah)

12.verse: Will your grace be declared in the grave, or your faithfulness in Abaddon?

13.verse: Will your wonders be known in the dark, or your righteousness in the land of oblivion?

14.verse: But I cry out to you, ADONAI; my prayer comes before you in the morning.

15.verse: So why, ADONAI, do you reject me? Why do you hide your face from me?

16.verse: Since my youth I have been miserable, close to death; I am numb from bearing these terrors of yours.

17.verse: Your fierce anger has overwhelmed me, your terrors have shriveled me up.

18.verse: They surge around me all day like a flood, from all sides they close in on me.

1.verse: A maskil of Eitan the Ezrachi:

2.verse: I will sing about ADONAI’s acts of grace forever, with my mouth proclaim your faithfulness to all generations;

3.verse: because I said, “Grace is built to last forever; in the heavens themselves you established your faithfulness.”

4.verse: You said, “I made a covenant with the one I chose, I swore to my servant David,

5.verse: ‘I will establish your dynasty forever, build up your throne through all generations.’” (Selah)

6.verse: Let the heavens praise your wonders, ADONAI, your faithfulness in the assembly of the angels.

7.verse: For who in the skies can be compared with ADONAI? Which of these gods can rival ADONAI,

8.verse: a God dreaded in the great assembly of the holy ones and feared by all around him?

9.verse: ADONAI Elohei-Tzva’ot! Who is as mighty as you, Yah? Your faithfulness surrounds you.

10.verse: You control the raging of the sea; when its waves rear up, you calm them.

11.verse: You crushed Rahav like a carcass; with your strong arm you scattered your foes.

12.verse: The heavens are yours, and the earth is yours; you founded the world and everything in it.

13.verse: You created north and south; Tavor and Hermon take joy in your name.

14.verse: Your arm is mighty, your hand is strong, your right hand is lifted high.

15.verse: Righteousness and justice are the foundation of your throne; grace and truth attend you.

16.verse: How happy are the people who know the joyful shout! They walk in the light of your presence, ADONAI.

17.verse: They rejoice in your name all day and are lifted up by your righteousness,

18.verse: for you yourself are the strength in which they glory. Our power grows by pleasing you,

19.verse: for our shield comes from ADONAI — our king is from the Holy One of Isra’el.

20.verse: There was a time when you spoke in a vision; you declared to your loyal [prophets], “I have given help to a warrior, I have raised up someone chosen from the people.

21.verse: I have found David my servant and anointed him with my holy oil.

22.verse: My hand will always be with him, and my arm will give him strength.

23.verse: No enemy will outwit him, no wicked man overcome him.

24.verse: I will crush his foes before him and strike down those who hate him.

25.verse: My faithfulness and grace will be with him; through my name his power will grow.

26.verse: I will put his hand on the sea and his right hand on the rivers.

27.verse: He will call to me, ‘You are my father, my God, the Rock of my salvation.’

28.verse: I will give him the position of firstborn, the highest of the kings of the earth.

29.verse: I will keep my grace for him forever, and in my covenant be faithful with him.

30.verse: I will establish his dynasty forever, and his throne as long as the heavens last.

31.verse: “If his descendants abandon my Torah and fail to live by my rulings,

32.verse: if they profane my regulations and don’t obey my mitzvot,

33.verse: I will punish their disobedience with the rod and their guilt with lashes.

34.verse: But I won’t withdraw my grace from him or be false to my faithfulness.

35.verse: I will not profane my covenant or change what my lips have spoken.

36.verse: I have sworn by my holiness once and for all; I will not lie to David —

37.verse: his dynasty will last forever, his throne like the sun before me.

38.verse: It will be established forever, like the moon, which remains a faithful witness in the sky.” (Selah)

39.verse: But you spurned your anointed one, rejected and vented your rage on him.

40.verse: You renounced the covenant with your servant and defiled his crown in the dust.

41.verse: You broke through all his defenses and left his strongholds in ruins.

42.verse: All who pass by plunder him; he is an object of scorn to his neighbors.

43.verse: You raised up the right hand of his foes and made all his enemies rejoice.

44.verse: You drive back his drawn sword and fail to support him in battle.

45.verse: You brought an end to his splendor and hurled his throne to the ground.

46.verse: You cut short the days of his youth and covered him with shame. (Selah)

47.verse: How long, ADONAI? Will you hide yourself forever? How long will your fury burn like fire?

48.verse: Remember how little time I have! Was it for no purpose that you created all humanity?

49.verse: Who can live and not see death? Who can save himself from the power of the grave? (Selah)

50.verse: Where, Adonai, are the acts of grace you once did, those which, in your faithfulness, you swore to David?

51.verse: Remember, Adonai, the taunts hurled at your servants, which I carry in my heart [from] so many peoples!

52.verse: Your enemies, ADONAI, have flung their taunts, flung them in the footsteps of your anointed one.

1.verse: Book IV: Psalms 90–106 - A prayer of Moshe the man of God: Adonai, you have been our dwelling place in every generation.

2.verse: Before the mountains were born, before you had formed the earth and the world, from eternity past to eternity future you are God.

3.verse: You bring frail mortals to the point of being crushed, then say, “People, repent!”

4.verse: For from your viewpoint a thousand years are merely like yesterday or a night watch.

5.verse: When you sweep them away, they become like sleep; by morning they are like growing grass,

6.verse: growing and flowering in the morning, but by evening cut down and dried up.

7.verse: For we are destroyed by your anger, overwhelmed by your wrath.

8.verse: You have placed our faults before you, our secret sins in the full light of your presence.

9.verse: All our days ebb away under your wrath; our years die away like a sigh.

10.verse: The span of our life is seventy years, or if we are strong, eighty; yet at best it is toil and sorrow, over in a moment, and then we are gone.

11.verse: Who grasps the power of your anger and wrath to the degree that the fear due you should inspire?

12.verse: So teach us to count our days, so that we will become wise.

13.verse: Return, ADONAI! How long must it go on? Take pity on your servants!

14.verse: Fill us at daybreak with your love, so that we can sing for joy as long as we live.

15.verse: Let our joy last as long as the time you made us suffer, for as many years as we experienced trouble.

16.verse: Show your deeds to your servants and your glory to their children.

17.verse: May the favor of Adonai our God be on us, prosper for us all the work that we do — yes, prosper the work that we do.

1.verse: You who live in the shelter of ‘Elyon, who spend your nights in the shadow of Shaddai,

2.verse: who say to ADONAI, “My refuge! My fortress! My God, in whom I trust!” —

3.verse: he will rescue you from the trap of the hunter and from the plague of calamities;

4.verse: he will cover you with his pinions, and under his wings you will find refuge; his truth is a shield and protection.

5.verse: You will not fear the terrors of night or the arrow that flies by day,

6.verse: or the plague that roams in the dark, or the scourge that wreaks havoc at noon.

7.verse: A thousand may fall at your side, ten thousand at your right hand; but it won’t come near you.

8.verse: Only keep your eyes open, and you will see how the wicked are punished.

9.verse: For you have made ADONAI, the Most High, who is my refuge, your dwelling-place.

10.verse: No disaster will happen to you, no calamity will come near your tent;

11.verse: for he will order his angels to care for you and guard you wherever you go.

12.verse: They will carry you in their hands, so that you won’t trip on a stone.

13.verse: You will tread down lions and snakes, young lions and serpents you will trample underfoot.

14.verse: “Because he loves me, I will rescue him; because he knows my name, I will protect him.

15.verse: He will call on me, and I will answer him. I will be with him when he is in trouble. I will extricate him and bring him honor.

16.verse: I will satisfy him with long life and show him my salvation.”

1.verse: A psalm. A song for Shabbat:

2.verse: It is good to give thanks to ADONAI and sing praises to your name, ‘Elyon,

3.verse: to tell in the morning about your grace and at night about your faithfulness,

4.verse: to the music of a ten-stringed [harp] and a lute, with the melody sounding on a lyre.

5.verse: For, ADONAI, what you do makes me happy; I take joy in what your hands have made.

6.verse: How great are your deeds, ADONAI! How very deep your thoughts!

7.verse: Stupid people can’t know, fools don’t understand,

8.verse: that when the wicked sprout like grass, and all who do evil prosper, it is so that they can be eternally destroyed,

9.verse: while you, ADONAI, are exalted forever.

10.verse: For your enemies, ADONAI, your enemies will perish; all evildoers will be scattered.

11.verse: But you have given me the strength of a wild bull; you anoint me with fresh olive oil.

12.verse: My eyes have gazed with pleasure on my enemies’ ruin, my ears have delighted in the fall of my foes.

13.verse: The righteous will flourish like a palm tree, they will grow like a cedar in the L’vanon.

14.verse: Planted in the house of ADONAI, they will flourish in the courtyards of our God.

15.verse: Even in old age they will be vigorous, still full of sap, still bearing fruit,

1.verse: ADONAI is king, robed in majesty; ADONAI is robed, girded with strength; The world is well established; it cannot be moved.

2.verse: Your throne was established long ago; you have existed forever.

3.verse: ADONAI, the deep is raising up, the deep is raising up its voice, the deep is raising its crashing waves.

4.verse: More than the sound of rushing waters or the mighty breakers of the sea, ADONAI on high is mighty.

5.verse: Your instructions are very sure; holiness befits your house, ADONAI, for all time to come.

1.verse: God of vengeance, ADONAI! God of vengeance, appear!

2.verse: Assert yourself as judge of the earth! Pay back the proud as they deserve!

3.verse: How long are the wicked, ADONAI, how long are the wicked to triumph?

4.verse: They pour out insolent words, they go on bragging, all these evildoers.

5.verse: They crush your people, ADONAI, they oppress your heritage.

6.verse: They kill widows and strangers and murder the fatherless.

7.verse: They say, “Yah isn’t looking; the God of Ya‘akov won’t notice.”

8.verse: Take notice, yourselves, you boors among the people! You fools, when will you understand?

9.verse: Will the one who planted the ear not hear? Will the one who formed the eye not see?

10.verse: Will the one who disciplines nations not correct them? Will the teacher of humanity not know?

11.verse: ADONAI understands that people’s thoughts are merely a puff of wind.

12.verse: How happy the man whom you correct, Yah, whom you teach from your Torah,

13.verse: giving him respite from days of trouble, till a pit is dug for the wicked!

14.verse: For ADONAI will not desert his people, he will not abandon his heritage.

15.verse: Justice will once again become righteous, and all the upright in heart will follow it.

16.verse: Who will champion my cause against the wicked? Who will stand up for me against evildoers?

17.verse: If ADONAI hadn’t helped me, I would soon have dwelt in the land of silence.

18.verse: When I said, “My foot is slipping!” your grace, ADONAI, supported me.

19.verse: When my cares within me are many, your comforts cheer me up.

20.verse: Can unjust judges be allied with you, those producing wrong in the name of law?

21.verse: They band together against the righteous and condemn the innocent to death.

22.verse: But ADONAI has become my stronghold, my God is my rock of refuge.

23.verse: But he repays them as their guilt deserves; he will cut them off with their own evil; ADONAI our God will cut them off.

1.verse: Come, let’s sing to ADONAI! Let’s shout for joy to the Rock of our salvation!

2.verse: Let’s come into his presence with thanksgiving; let’s shout for joy to him with songs of praise.

3.verse: For ADONAI is a great God, a great king greater than all gods.

4.verse: He holds the depths of the earth in his hands; the mountain peaks too belong to him.

5.verse: The sea is his — he made it — and his hands shaped the dry land.

6.verse: Come, let’s bow down and worship; let’s kneel before ADONAI who made us.

7.verse: For he is our God, and we are the people in his pasture, the sheep in his care. If only today you would listen to his voice:

8.verse: “Don’t harden your hearts, as you did at M’rivah, as you did on that day at Massah in the desert,

9.verse: when your fathers put me to the test; they challenged me, even though they saw my work.

10.verse: For forty years I loathed that generation; I said, ‘This is a people whose hearts go astray, they don’t understand how I do things.’

11.verse: Therefore I swore in my anger that they would not enter my rest.”

1.verse: Sing to ADONAI a new song! Sing to ADONAI, all the earth!

2.verse: Sing to ADONAI, bless his name! Proclaim his victory day after day!

3.verse: Declare his glory among the nations, his wonders among all peoples!

4.verse: For ADONAI is great, and greatly to be praised; he is to be feared more than all gods.

5.verse: For all the gods of the peoples are idols, but ADONAI made the heavens.

6.verse: In his presence are honor and majesty; in his sanctuary, strength and splendor.

7.verse: Give ADONAI his due, you families from the peoples; give ADONAI his due of glory and strength;

8.verse: give ADONAI the glory due to his name; bring an offering, and enter his courtyards.

9.verse: Worship ADONAI in holy splendor; tremble before him, all the earth!

10.verse: Say among the nations, “ADONAI is king!” The world is firmly established, immovable. He will judge the peoples fairly.

11.verse: Let the heavens rejoice; let the earth be glad; let the sea roar, and everything in it;

12.verse: let the fields exult and all that is in them. Then all the trees in the forest will sing

13.verse: before ADONAI, because he has come, he has come to judge the earth; he will judge the world rightly and the peoples with his faithfulness.

1.verse: ADONAI is king, let the earth rejoice, let the many coasts and islands be glad.

2.verse: Clouds and thick darkness surround him; righteousness and justice are the foundation of his throne.

3.verse: Fire goes before him, setting ablaze his foes on every side.

4.verse: His flashes of lightning light up the world; the earth sees it and trembles.

5.verse: The mountains melt like wax at the presence of ADONAI, at the presence of the Lord of all the earth.

6.verse: The heavens declare his righteousness, and all the peoples see his glory.

7.verse: All who worship images will be put to shame, those who make their boast in worthless idols. Bow down to him, all you gods!

8.verse: Tziyon hears and is glad, ADONAI; the daughters of Y’hudah rejoice at your rulings.

9.verse: For you, ADONAI, most high over all the earth, you are exalted far above all gods.

10.verse: You who love ADONAI, hate evil! He keeps his faithful servants safe. He rescues them from the power of the wicked.

11.verse: Light is sown for the righteous and joy for the upright in heart.

12.verse: Rejoice in ADONAI, you righteous; and give thanks on recalling his holiness.

1.verse: A psalm: Sing a new song to ADONAI, because he has done wonders. His right hand, his holy arm have won him victory.

2.verse: ADONAI has made known his victory; revealed his vindication in full view of the nations,

3.verse: remembered his grace and faithfulness to the house of Isra’el. All the ends of the earth have seen the victory of our God.

4.verse: Shout for joy to ADONAI, all the earth! Break forth, sing for joy, sing praises!

5.verse: Sing praises to ADONAI with the lyre, with the lyre and melodious music!

6.verse: With trumpets and the sound of the shofar, shout for joy before the king, ADONAI!

7.verse: Let the sea roar, and everything in it; the world, and those living in it.

8.verse: Let the floods clap their hands; let the mountains sing together for joy

9.verse: before ADONAI, for he has come to judge the earth; he will judge the world rightly and the peoples fairly.

1.verse: ADONAI is king; let the peoples tremble. He sits enthroned on the k’ruvim; let the earth shake!

2.verse: ADONAI is great in Tziyon; he is high above all the peoples.

3.verse: Let them praise your great and fearsome name (he is holy):

4.verse: “Mighty king who loves justice, you established fairness, justice and righteousness in Ya‘akov.”

5.verse: Exalt ADONAI our God! Prostrate yourselves at his footstool (he is holy).

6.verse: Moshe and Aharon among his cohanim and Sh’mu’el among those who call on his name called on ADONAI, and he answered them.

7.verse: He spoke to them in the column of cloud; they kept his instructions and the law that he gave them.

8.verse: ADONAI our God, you answered them. To them you were a forgiving God, although you took vengeance on their wrongdoings.

9.verse: Exalt ADONAI our God, bow down toward his holy mountain, for ADONAI our God is holy!

1.verse: A psalm of thanksgiving: Shout for joy to ADONAI, all the earth!

2.verse: Serve ADONAI with gladness. Enter his presence with joyful songs.

3.verse: Be aware that ADONAI is God; it is he who made us; and we are his, his people, the flock in his pasture.

4.verse: Enter his gates with thanksgiving, enter his courtyards with praise; give thanks to him, and bless his name.

5.verse: For ADONAI is good, his grace continues forever, and his faithfulness lasts through all generations.

1.verse: A psalm of David: I am singing of grace and justice; I am singing to you, ADONAI.

2.verse: I will follow the path of integrity; when will you come to me? I will run my life with a sincere heart inside my own house.

3.verse: I will not allow before my eyes any shameful thing. I hate those who act crookedly; what they do does not attract me.

4.verse: Deviousness will depart from me; I will not tolerate evil.

5.verse: If someone slanders another in secret, I will cut him off. Haughty eyes and proud hearts I cannot abide.

6.verse: I look to the faithful of the land, so that they can be my companions; those who live lives of integrity can be servants of mine.

7.verse: No deceitful person can live in my house; no liar can be my advisor.

8.verse: Every morning I will destroy all the wicked of the land, cutting off all evildoers from the city of ADONAI.

1.verse: Prayer of a sufferer overcome by weakness and pouring out his complaint before ADONAI:

2.verse: ADONAI, hear my prayer! Let my cry for help reach you!

3.verse: Don’t hide your face from me when I am in such distress! Turn your ear toward me; when I call, be quick to reply!

4.verse: For my days are vanishing like smoke, my bones are burning like a furnace.

5.verse: I am stricken and withered like grass; I forget to eat my food.

6.verse: Because of my loud groaning, I am just skin and bones.

7.verse: I am like a great owl in the desert, I’ve become like an owl in the ruins.

8.verse: I lie awake and become like a bird alone on the roof.

9.verse: My enemies taunt me all day long; mad with rage, they make my name a curse.

10.verse: For I have been eating ashes like bread and mingling tears with my drink

11.verse: because of your furious anger, since you picked me up just to toss me aside.

12.verse: My days decline like an evening shadow; I am drying up like grass.

13.verse: But you, ADONAI, are enthroned forever; your renown will endure through all generations.

14.verse: You will arise and take pity on Tziyon, for the time has come to have mercy on her; the time determined has come.

15.verse: For your servants love her very stones; they take pity even on her dust.

16.verse: The nations will fear the name of ADONAI and all the kings on earth your glory,

17.verse: when ADONAI has rebuilt Tziyon, and shows himself in his glory,

18.verse: when he has heeded the plea of the poor and not despised their prayer.

19.verse: May this be put on record for a future generation; may a people yet to be created praise ADONAI.

20.verse: For he has looked down from the height of his sanctuary; from heaven ADONAI surveys the earth

21.verse: to listen to the sighing of the prisoner, to set free those who are sentenced to death,

22.verse: to proclaim the name of ADONAI in Tziyon and his praise in Yerushalayim

23.verse: when peoples and kingdoms have been gathered together to serve ADONAI.

24.verse: He has broken my strength in midcourse, he has cut short my days.

25.verse: I plead, “God, your years last through all generations; so don’t take me away when my life is half over!

26.verse: In the beginning, you laid the foundations of the earth; heaven is the work of your hands.

27.verse: They will vanish, but you will remain; like clothing, they will all grow old; yes, you will change them like clothing, and they will pass away.

28.verse: But you remain the same, and your years will never end.

1.verse: By David: Bless ADONAI, my soul! Everything in me, bless his holy name!

2.verse: Bless ADONAI, my soul, and forget none of his benefits!

3.verse: He forgives all your offenses, he heals all your diseases,

4.verse: he redeems your life from the pit, he surrounds you with grace and compassion,

5.verse: he contents you with good as long as you live, so that your youth is renewed like an eagle’s.

6.verse: ADONAI brings vindication and justice to all who are oppressed.

7.verse: He made his ways known to Moshe, his mighty deeds to the people of Isra’el.

8.verse: ADONAI is merciful and compassionate, slow to anger and rich in grace.

9.verse: He will not always accuse, he will not keep his anger forever.

10.verse: He has not treated us as our sins deserve or paid us back for our offenses,

11.verse: because his mercy toward those who fear him is as far above earth as heaven.

12.verse: He has removed our sins from us as far as the east is from the west.

13.verse: Just as a father has compassion on his children, ADONAI has compassion on those who fear him.

14.verse: For he understands how we are made, he remembers that we are dust.

15.verse: Yes, a human being’s days are like grass, he sprouts like a flower in the countryside —

16.verse: but when the wind sweeps over, it’s gone; and its place knows it no more.

17.verse: But the mercy of ADONAI on those who fear him is from eternity past to eternity future, and his righteousness extends to his children’s children,

18.verse: provided they keep his covenant and remember to follow his precepts.

19.verse: ADONAI has established his throne in heaven; his kingly power rules everything.
