20.verse: Bless ADONAI, you angels of his, you mighty warriors who obey his word, who carry out his orders!

21.verse: Bless ADONAI, all his troops, who serve him and do what he wants!

22.verse: Bless ADONAI, all his works, in every place where he rules! Bless ADONAI, my soul!

1.verse: Bless ADONAI, my soul! ADONAI, my God, you are very great; you are clothed with glory and majesty,

2.verse: wrapped in light as with a robe. You spread out the heavens like a curtain,

3.verse: you laid the beams of your palace on the water. You make the clouds your chariot, you ride on the wings of the wind.

4.verse: You make winds your messengers, fiery flames your servants.

5.verse: You fixed the earth on its foundations, never to be moved.

6.verse: You covered it with the deep like a garment; the waters stood above the mountains.

7.verse: At your rebuke they fled; at the sound of your thunder they rushed away,

8.verse: flowing over hills, pouring into valleys, down to the place you had fixed for them.

9.verse: You determined a boundary they could not cross; they were never to cover the earth again.

10.verse: You make springs gush forth in the vadis; they flow between the hills,

11.verse: supplying water to all the wild animals; the wild donkeys quench their thirst.

12.verse: On their banks the birds of the air build their nests; among the branches they sing.

13.verse: You water the mountains from your palace; the earth is satisfied with how you provide —

14.verse: You grow grass for the cattle; and for people you grow the plants they need to bring forth bread from the earth,

15.verse: wine that gladdens the human heart, oil to make faces glow, and food to sustain their strength.

16.verse: ADONAI’s trees are satisfied — the cedars of the L’vanon, which he has planted.

17.verse: In them sparrows build their nests, while storks live in the fir trees.

18.verse: For the wild goats there are the high mountains, while the coneys find refuge in the rocks.

19.verse: You made the moon to mark the seasons, and the sun knows when to set.

20.verse: You bring darkness, and it is night, the time when all forest animals prowl.

21.verse: The young lions roar after their prey and seek their food from God.

22.verse: The sun rises, they slink away and lie down to rest in their dens;

23.verse: while people go out to their work, laboring on till evening.

24.verse: What variety there is in your works, ADONAI! How many [of them there are]! In wisdom you have made them all; the earth is full of your creations.

25.verse: Look at the sea, so great, so wide! It teems with countless creatures, living beings, both large and small.

26.verse: The ships are there, sailing to and fro; Livyatan, which you formed to play there.

27.verse: All of them look to you to give them their food when they need it.

28.verse: When you give it to them, they gather it; when you open your hand, they are well satisfied.

29.verse: If you hide your face, they vanish; if you hold back their breath, they perish and return to their dust.

30.verse: If you send out your breath, they are created, and you renew the face of the earth.

31.verse: May the glory of ADONAI last forever! May ADONAI rejoice in his works!

32.verse: When he looks at the earth, it trembles; when he touches the mountains, they pour out smoke.

33.verse: I will sing to ADONAI as long as I live, sing praise to my God all my life.

34.verse: May my musings be pleasing to him; I will rejoice in ADONAI.

35.verse: May sinners vanish from the earth and the wicked be no more! Bless ADONAI, my soul! Halleluyah!

1.verse: Give thanks to ADONAI! Call on his name! Make his deeds known among the peoples.

2.verse: Sing to him, sing praises to him, talk about all his wonders.

3.verse: Glory in his holy name; let those seeking ADONAI have joyful hearts.

4.verse: Seek ADONAI and his strength; always seek his presence.

5.verse: Remember the wonders he has done, his signs and his spoken rulings.

6.verse: You descendants of Avraham his servant, you offspring of Ya‘akov, his chosen ones,

7.verse: he is ADONAI our God! His rulings are everywhere on earth.

8.verse: He remembers his covenant forever, the word he commanded to a thousand generations,

9.verse: the covenant he made with Avraham, the oath he swore to Yitz’chak,

10.verse: and established as a law for Ya‘akov, for Isra’el as an everlasting covenant:

11.verse: “To you I will give the land of Kena‘an as your allotted heritage.”

12.verse: When they were but few in number, and not only few, but aliens there too,

13.verse: wandering from nation to nation, from this kingdom to that people,

14.verse: he allowed no one to oppress them. Yes, for their sakes he rebuked even kings:

15.verse: “Don’t touch my anointed ones or do my prophets harm!”

16.verse: He called down famine on the land, broke off all their food supply,

17.verse: but sent a man ahead of them — Yosef, who was sold as a slave.

18.verse: They shackled his feet with chains, and they bound him in irons;

19.verse: until the time when his word proved true, God’s utterance kept testing him.

20.verse: The king sent and had him released, the ruler of peoples set him free;

21.verse: he made him lord of his household, in charge of all he owned,

22.verse: correcting his officers as he saw fit and teaching his counselors wisdom.

23.verse: Then Isra’el too came into Egypt, Ya‘akov lived as an alien in the land of Ham.

24.verse: There God made his people very fruitful, made them too numerous for their foes,

25.verse: whose hearts he turned to hate his people, and treat his servants unfairly.

26.verse: He sent his servant Moshe and Aharon, whom he had chosen.

27.verse: They worked his signs among them, his wonders in the land of Ham.

28.verse: He sent darkness, and the land grew dark; they did not defy his word.

29.verse: He turned their water into blood and caused their fish to die.

30.verse: Their land swarmed with frogs, even in the royal chambers.

31.verse: He spoke, and there came swarms of insects and lice throughout their land.

32.verse: He gave them hail instead of rain, with fiery [lightning] throughout their land.

33.verse: He struck their vines and fig trees, shattering trees all over their country.

34.verse: He spoke, and locusts came, also grasshoppers without number;

35.verse: they ate up everything green in their land, devoured the fruit of their ground.

36.verse: He struck down all the firstborn in their land, the firstfruits of all their strength.

37.verse: Then he led his people out, laden with silver and gold; among his tribes not one stumbled.

38.verse: Egypt was happy to have them leave, because fear of [Isra’el] had seized them.

39.verse: He spread out a cloud to screen them off and fire to give them light at night.

40.verse: When they asked, he brought them quails and satisfied them with food from heaven.

41.verse: He split a rock, and water gushed out, flowing as a river over the dry ground,

42.verse: for he remembered his holy promise to his servant Avraham.

43.verse: He led out his people with joy, his chosen ones with singing.

44.verse: Then he gave them the lands of the nations, and they possessed what peoples had toiled to produce,

45.verse: in order to obey his laws and follow his teachings. Halleluyah!

1.verse: Halleluyah! Give thanks to ADONAI; for he is good, for his grace continues forever.

2.verse: Who can express ADONAI’s mighty doings or proclaim in full his praise?

3.verse: How happy are those who act justly, who always do what is right!

4.verse: Remember me, ADONAI, when you show favor to your people, keep me in mind when you save them;

5.verse: so I can see how well things are going with those whom you have chosen, so that I can rejoice in your nation’s joy, and glory in your heritage.

6.verse: Together with our ancestors, we have sinned, done wrong, acted wickedly.

7.verse: Our ancestors in Egypt failed to grasp the meaning of your wonders. They didn’t keep in mind your great deeds of grace but rebelled at the sea, at the Sea of Suf.

8.verse: Yet he saved them for his own name’s sake, to make known his mighty power.

9.verse: He rebuked the Sea of Suf, and it dried up; he led them through its depths as through a desert.

10.verse: He saved them from hostile hands, redeemed them from the power of the foe.

11.verse: The water closed over their adversaries; not one of them was left.

12.verse: Then they believed his words, and they sang his praise.

13.verse: But soon they forgot his deeds and wouldn’t wait for his counsel.

14.verse: In the desert they gave way to insatiable greed; in the wastelands they put God to the test.

15.verse: He gave them what they wanted but sent meagerness into their souls.

16.verse: In the camp they were jealous of Moshe and Aharon, ADONAI’s holy one.

17.verse: The earth opened up and swallowed Datan and closed over Aviram’s allies.

18.verse: A fire blazed out against that group, the flames consumed the wicked.

19.verse: In Horev they fashioned a calf, they worshipped a cast metal image.

20.verse: Thus they exchanged their Glory for the image of an ox that eats grass!

21.verse: They forgot God, who had saved them, who had done great things in Egypt,

22.verse: wonders in the land of Ham, fearsome deeds by the Sea of Suf.

23.verse: Therefore he said that he would destroy them, [and he would have,] had not Moshe his chosen one stood before him in the breach to turn back his destroying fury.

24.verse: Next, they rejected the beautiful land, they didn’t trust his promise;

25.verse: and they complained in their tents, they didn’t obey ADONAI.

26.verse: Therefore, raising his hand, he swore to them that he would strike them down in the desert

27.verse: and strike down their descendants among the nations, dispersing them in foreign lands.

28.verse: Now they joined themselves to Ba‘al-P‘or and ate meat sacrificed to dead things.

29.verse: Thus they provoked him to anger with their deeds, so that a plague broke out among them.

30.verse: Then Pinchas stood up and executed judgment; so the plague was checked.

31.verse: That was credited to him as righteousness, through all generations forever.

32.verse: They angered him at the M’rivah Spring, and Moshe suffered on their account;

33.verse: for when they embittered his spirit, [Moshe] spoke up without thinking.

34.verse: They failed to destroy the peoples, as ADONAI had ordered them to do,

35.verse: but mingled with the nations and learned to follow their ways.

36.verse: They went on to serve their idols, which became a snare for them.

37.verse: They even sacrificed their sons and their daughters to demons.

38.verse: Yes, they shed innocent blood, the blood of their own sons and daughters, whom they sacrificed to Kena‘an’s false gods, polluting the land with blood.

39.verse: Thus they were defiled by their deeds; they prostituted themselves by their actions,

40.verse: For this ADONAI’s fury blazed up against his people, and he detested his heritage.

41.verse: He handed them over to the power of the nations, and those who hated them ruled over them.

42.verse: Their enemies oppressed them and kept them in subjection to their power.

43.verse: Many times [God] rescued them, but they kept making plans to rebel. Thus they were brought low by their own wrongdoing.

44.verse: Still he took pity on their distress whenever he heard their cry.

45.verse: For their sakes he kept in mind his covenant and in his limitless grace relented,

46.verse: causing them to be treated with compassion by all who had taken them captive.

47.verse: Save us, ADONAI our God! Gather us from among the nations, so that we can thank your holy name and glory in praising you.

48.verse: Blessed be ADONAI, the God of Isra’el, from eternity past to eternity future. Now let all the people say, “Amen! Halleluyah!”

1.verse: Book V: Psalms 107–150 - Give thanks to ADONAI; for he is good, for his grace continues forever.

2.verse: Let those redeemed by ADONAI say it, those he redeemed from the power of the foe.

3.verse: He gathered them from the lands, from the east and from the west, from the north and from the sea.

4.verse: They wandered in the desert, on paths through the wastes, without finding any inhabited city.

5.verse: They were hungry and thirsty, their life was ebbing away.

6.verse: In their trouble they cried to ADONAI, and he rescued them from their distress.

7.verse: He led them by a direct path to a city where they could live.

8.verse: Let them give thanks to ADONAI for his grace, for his wonders bestowed on humanity!

9.verse: For he has satisfied the hungry, filled the starving with good.

10.verse: Some lived in darkness, in death-dark gloom, bound in misery and iron chains,

11.verse: because they defied God’s word, scorned the counsel of the Most High.

12.verse: So he humbled their hearts by hard labor; when they stumbled, no one came to their aid.

13.verse: In their trouble they cried to ADONAI, and he rescued them from their distress.

14.verse: He led them from darkness, from death-dark gloom, shattering their chains.

15.verse: Let them give thanks to ADONAI for his grace, for his wonders bestowed on humanity!

16.verse: For he shattered bronze doors and cut through iron bars.

17.verse: There were foolish people who suffered affliction because of their crimes and sins;

18.verse: they couldn’t stand to eat anything; they were near the gates of death.

19.verse: In their trouble they cried to ADONAI, and he rescued them from their distress;

20.verse: he sent his word and healed them, he delivered them from destruction.

21.verse: Let them give thanks to ADONAI for his grace, for his wonders bestowed on humanity!

22.verse: Let them offer sacrifices of thanksgiving and proclaim his great deeds with songs of joy.

23.verse: Those who go down to the sea in ships, plying their trade on the great ocean,

24.verse: saw the works of ADONAI, his wonders in the deep.

25.verse: For at his word the storm-wind arose, lifting up towering waves.

26.verse: The sailors were raised up to the sky, then plunged into the depths. At the danger, their courage failed them,

27.verse: they reeled and staggered like drunk men, and all their skill was swallowed up.

28.verse: In their trouble they cried to ADONAI, and he rescued them from their distress.

29.verse: He silenced the storm and stilled its waves,

30.verse: and they rejoiced as the sea grew calm. Then he brought them safely to their desired port.

31.verse: Let them give thanks to ADONAI for his grace, for his wonders bestowed on humanity!

32.verse: Let them extol him in the assembly of the people and praise him in the leaders’ council.

33.verse: He turns rivers into desert, flowing springs into thirsty ground,

34.verse: productive land into salt flats, because the people living there are so wicked.

35.verse: But he also turns desert into pools of water, dry land into flowing springs;

36.verse: there he gives the hungry a home, and they build a city to live in;

37.verse: there they sow fields and plant vineyards, which yield an abundant harvest.

38.verse: He blesses them, their numbers grow, and he doesn’t let their livestock decrease.

39.verse: When their numbers fall, and they grow weak, because of oppression, disaster and sorrow,

40.verse: he pours contempt on princes and leaves them to wander in trackless wastes.

41.verse: But the needy he raises up from their distress and increases their families like sheep.

42.verse: When the upright see this, they rejoice; while the wicked are reduced to silence.

43.verse: Let whoever is wise observe these things and consider ADONAI’s loving deeds.

1.verse: A song. A psalm of David:

2.verse: My heart is steadfast, God. I will sing and make music with my glory.

3.verse: Awake, lute and lyre! I will awaken the dawn.

4.verse: I will thank you, ADONAI, among the peoples; I will make music to you among the nations.

5.verse: For your grace is great, above heaven, and your truth, all the way to the skies.

6.verse: Be exalted, God, above heaven! May your glory be over all the earth,

7.verse: in order that those you love can be rescued; so save with your right hand, and answer me!

8.verse: God in his holiness spoke, and I took joy [in his promise]: “I will divide Sh’khem and determine the shares in the Sukkot Valley.

9.verse: Gil‘ad is mine and M’nasheh mine, Efrayim my helmet, Y’hudah my scepter.

10.verse: Mo’av is my washpot; on Edom I throw my shoe; Over P’leshet I shout in triumph.”

11.verse: Who will bring me into the fortified city? Who will lead me to Edom?

12.verse: God, have you rejected us? You don’t go out with our armies, God.

13.verse: Help us against our enemy, for human help is worthless.

1.verse: For the leader. A psalm of David: God, whom I praise, don’t remain silent!

2.verse: For wicked and deceitful men have opened their mouths against me, spoken against me with lying tongues,

3.verse: surrounded me with hateful words, and attacked me without cause.

4.verse: In return for my love they became my accusers, even though I prayed for them.

5.verse: They repay me evil for good and hatred for my love.

6.verse: [They say,] “Appoint a wicked man over him, may an accuser stand at his right.

7.verse: When he is tried, let him be found guilty, may even his plea be counted a sin.

8.verse: May his days be few, may someone else take his position.

9.verse: May his children be fatherless and his wife a widow.

10.verse: May his children be wandering beggars, foraging for food from their ruined homes.

11.verse: May creditors seize all he owns and strangers make off with his earnings.

12.verse: May no one treat him kindly, and may no one take pity on his orphaned children.

13.verse: May his posterity be cut off; may his name be erased within a generation.

14.verse: May the wrongs of his ancestors be remembered by ADONAI, and may the sin of his mother not be erased;

15.verse: may they always be before ADONAI, so he can cut off all memory of them from the earth.

16.verse: For he did not remember to show kindness but hounded the downtrodden, the poor and the brokenhearted to death.

17.verse: He loved cursing; may it recoil on him! He didn’t like blessing; may it stay far from him!

18.verse: He clothed himself with cursing as routinely as with his coat; May it enter inside him as easily as water, as easily as oil into his bones.

19.verse: May it cling to him like the coat he wears, like the belt he wraps around himself.”

20.verse: This is what my adversaries want ADONAI to do, those who speak evil against me.

21.verse: But you, God, ADONAI, treat me as your name demands; rescue me, because your grace is good.

22.verse: For I am poor and needy, and my heart within me is wounded.

23.verse: Like a lengthening evening shadow, I am gone; I am shaken off like a locust.

24.verse: My knees are weak from lack of food, my flesh wastes away for lack of nourishment.

25.verse: I have become the object of their taunts; when they see me, they shake their heads.

26.verse: Help me, ADONAI, my God! Save me, in keeping with your grace;

27.verse: so that they will know that this comes from your hand, that you, ADONAI, have done it.

28.verse: Let them go on cursing; but you, bless! When they attack, let them be put to shame; but let your servant rejoice.

29.verse: Let my adversaries be clothed with confusion, let them wear their own shame like a robe.

30.verse: I will eagerly thank ADONAI with my mouth, I will praise him right there in the crowd,

31.verse: because he stands alongside a needy person to defend him from unjust accusers.

1.verse: A psalm of David: ADONAI says to my Lord, “Sit at my right hand, until I make your enemies your footstool.”

2.verse: ADONAI will send your powerful scepter out from Tziyon, so that you will rule over your enemies around you.

3.verse: On the day your forces mobilize, your people willingly offer themselves in holy splendors from the womb of the dawn; the dew of your youth is yours.

4.verse: ADONAI has sworn it, and he will never retract — “You are a cohen forever, to be compared with Malki-Tzedek.”

5.verse: Adonai at your right hand will shatter kings on the day of his anger.

6.verse: He will pass judgment among the nations, filling it with dead bodies; he will shatter heads throughout an extensive territory.

7.verse: He will drink from a stream as he goes on his way; therefore he will hold his head high.

1.verse: Halleluyah! I will wholeheartedly give thanks to ADONAI in the council of the upright and in the assembly.

2.verse: The deeds of ADONAI are great, greatly desired by all who enjoy them.

3.verse: His work is full of majesty and splendor, and his righteousness continues forever.

4.verse: He has gained renown for his wonders. ADONAI is merciful and compassionate.

5.verse: He gives food to those who fear him. He remembers his covenant forever.

6.verse: He shows his people how powerfully he works by giving them the nations as their heritage.

7.verse: The works of his hands are truth and justice; all his precepts can be trusted.

8.verse: They have been established forever and ever, to be carried out truly and honestly.

9.verse: He sent redemption to his people and decreed that his covenant should last forever. His name is holy and fearsome —

10.verse: the first and foremost point of wisdom is the fear of ADONAI; all those living by it gain good common sense. His praise stands forever.

1.verse: Halleluyah! How happy is anyone who fears ADONAI, who greatly delights in his mitzvot.

2.verse: His descendants will be powerful on earth, a blessed generation of upright people.

3.verse: Wealth and riches are in his house, and his righteousness stands forever.

4.verse: To the upright he shines like a light in the dark, merciful, compassionate and righteous.

5.verse: Things go well with the person who is merciful and lends, who conducts his affairs with fairness;

6.verse: for he will never be moved. The righteous will be remembered forever.

7.verse: He will not be frightened by bad news; he remains steady, trusting in ADONAI.

8.verse: His heart is set firm, he will not be afraid, till finally he looks in triumph at his enemies.

9.verse: He distributes freely, he gives to the poor; his righteousness stands forever. His power will be increased honorably.

10.verse: The wicked will be angry when they see this; they will gnash their teeth and waste away, the desires of the wicked will come to nothing.

1.verse: Halleluyah! Servants of ADONAI, give praise! Give praise to the name of ADONAI!

2.verse: Blessed be the name of ADONAI from this moment on and forever!

3.verse: From sunrise until sunset ADONAI’s name is to be praised.

4.verse: ADONAI is high above all nations, his glory above the heavens.

5.verse: Who is like ADONAI our God, seated in the heights,

6.verse: humbling himself to look on heaven and on earth.

7.verse: He raises the poor from the dust, lifts the needy from the rubbish heap,

8.verse: in order to give him a place among princes, among the princes of his people.

9.verse: He causes the childless woman to live at home happily as a mother of children. Halleluyah!

1.verse: When Isra’el came out of Egypt, the house of Ya‘akov from a people of foreign speech,

2.verse: Y’hudah became [God’s] sanctuary, Isra’el his domain.

3.verse: The sea saw this and fled; the Yarden turned back;

4.verse: the mountains skipped like rams, the hills like young sheep.

5.verse: Why is it, sea, that you flee? Why, Yarden, do you turn back?

6.verse: Why, mountains, do you skip like rams; and you hills like young sheep?

7.verse: Tremble, earth, at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the God of Ya‘akov,

8.verse: who turned the rock into a pool of water, flint into flowing spring.

1.verse: Not to us, ADONAI, not to us, but to your name give glory, because of your grace and truth.

2.verse: Why should the nations ask, “Where is their God?”

3.verse: Our God is in heaven; he does whatever pleases him.

4.verse: Their idols are mere silver and gold, made by human hands.

5.verse: They have mouths, but they can’t speak; they have eyes, but they can’t see;

6.verse: they have ears, but they can’t hear; they have noses, but they can’t smell;

7.verse: they have hands, but they can’t feel; they have feet, but they can’t walk; with their throats they can’t make a sound.

8.verse: The people who make them will become like them, along with everyone who trusts in them.

9.verse: Isra’el, trust in ADONAI! He is their help and shield.

10.verse: House of Aharon, trust in ADONAI! He is their help and shield.

11.verse: You who fear ADONAI, trust in ADONAI! He is their help and shield.

12.verse: ADONAI has kept us in mind, and he will bless. He will bless the house of Isra’el; he will bless the house of Aharon;

13.verse: he will bless those who fear ADONAI, great and small alike.

14.verse: May ADONAI increase your numbers, both yours and those of your children.

15.verse: May you be blessed by ADONAI, the maker of heaven and earth.

16.verse: Heaven belongs to ADONAI, but the earth he has given to humankind.

17.verse: The dead can’t praise ADONAI, not those who sink down into silence.

18.verse: But we will bless ADONAI from now on and forever. Halleluyah!

1.verse: I love that ADONAI heard my voice when I prayed;

2.verse: because he turned his ear to me, I will call on him as long as I live.

3.verse: The cords of death were all around me, Sh’ol’s constrictions held me fast; I was finding only distress and anguish.

4.verse: But I called on the name of ADONAI: “Please, ADONAI! Save me!”

5.verse: ADONAI is merciful and righteous; yes, our God is compassionate.

6.verse: ADONAI preserves the thoughtless; when I was brought low, he saved me.

7.verse: My soul, return to your rest! For ADONAI has been generous toward you.

8.verse: Yes, you have rescued me from death, my eyes from tears and my feet from falling.

9.verse: I will go on walking in the presence of ADONAI in the lands of the living.

10.verse: I will keep on trusting even when I say, “I am utterly miserable,”

11.verse: even when, in my panic, I declare, “Everything human is deceptive.”

12.verse: How can I repay ADONAI for all his generous dealings with me?

13.verse: I will raise the cup of salvation and call on the name of ADONAI.

14.verse: I will pay my vows to ADONAI in the presence of all his people.

15.verse: From ADONAI’s point of view, the death of those faithful to him is costly.

16.verse: Oh, ADONAI! I am your slave; I am your slave, the son of your slave-girl; you have removed my fetters.

17.verse: I will offer a sacrifice of thanks to you and will call on the name of ADONAI.

18.verse: I will pay my vows to ADONAI in the presence of all his people,

19.verse: in the courtyards of ADONAI’s house, there in your very heart, Yerushalayim. Halleluyah!

1.verse: Praise ADONAI, all you nations! Worship him, all you peoples!

2.verse: For his grace has overcome us, and ADONAI’s truth continues forever. Halleluyah!

1.verse: Give thanks to ADONAI; for he is good, for his grace continues forever.

2.verse: Now let Isra’el say, “His grace continues forever.”

3.verse: Now let the house of Aharon say, “His grace continues forever.”

4.verse: Now let those who fear ADONAI say, “His grace continues forever.”

5.verse: From my being hemmed in I called on Yah; he answered and gave me more room.

6.verse: With ADONAI on my side, I fear nothing — what can human beings do to me?

7.verse: With ADONAI on my side as my help, I will look with triumph at those who hate me.

8.verse: It is better to take refuge in ADONAI than to trust in human beings;

9.verse: better to take refuge in ADONAI than to put one’s trust in princes.

10.verse: The nations all surrounded me; in the name of ADONAI I cut them down.

11.verse: They surrounded me on every side in the name of ADONAI I cut them down.

12.verse: They surrounded me like bees but were extinguished [as quickly] as a fire in thorns; in the name of ADONAI I cut them down.

13.verse: You pushed me hard to make me fall, but ADONAI helped me.

14.verse: Yah is my strength and my song, and he has become my salvation.

15.verse: The sound of rejoicing and victory is heard in the tents of the righteous: “ADONAI’s right hand struck powerfully!

16.verse: ADONAI’s right hand is raised in triumph! ADONAI’s right hand struck powerfully!”

17.verse: I will not die; no, I will live and proclaim the great deeds of Yah!

18.verse: Yah disciplined me severely, but did not hand me over to death.

19.verse: Open the gates of righteousness for me; I will enter them and thank Yah.

20.verse: This is the gate of ADONAI; the righteous can enter it.

21.verse: I am thanking you because you answered me; you became my salvation.

22.verse: The very rock that the builders rejected has become the cornerstone!

23.verse: This has come from ADONAI, and in our eyes it is amazing.

24.verse: This is the day ADONAI has made, a day for us to rejoice and be glad.

25.verse: Please, ADONAI! Save us! Please, ADONAI! Rescue us!

26.verse: Blessed is he who comes in the name of ADONAI. We bless you from the house of ADONAI.

27.verse: ADONAI is God, and he gives us light. Join in the pilgrim festival with branches all the way to the horns of the altar.

28.verse: You are my God, and I thank you. You are my God; I exalt you.

29.verse: Give thanks to ADONAI; for he is good, for his grace continues forever.

1.verse: א (Alef) How happy are those whose way of life is blameless, who live by the Torah of ADONAI!

2.verse: How happy are those who observe his instruction, who seek him wholeheartedly!

3.verse: They do nothing wrong but live by his ways.

4.verse: You laid down your precepts for us to observe with care.

5.verse: May my ways be steady in observing your laws.

6.verse: Then I will not be put to shame, since I will have fixed my sight on all your mitzvot.

7.verse: I thank you with a sincere heart as I learn your righteous rulings.

8.verse: I will observe your laws; don’t completely abandon me!

9.verse: ב (Bet) How can a young man keep his way pure? By guarding it according to your word.

10.verse: I seek you with all my heart; don’t let me stray from your mitzvot.

11.verse: I treasure your word in my heart, so that I won’t sin against you.

12.verse: Blessed are you, ADONAI! Teach me your laws.

13.verse: I proclaim with my mouth all the rulings you have spoken.

14.verse: I rejoice in the way of your instruction more than in any kind of wealth.

15.verse: I will meditate on your precepts and keep my eyes on your ways.

16.verse: I will find my delight in your regulations. I will not forget your word.

17.verse: ג (Gimel) Deal generously with your servant; then I will live and observe your word.

18.verse: Open my eyes, so that I will see wonders from your Torah.

19.verse: Though I’m just a wanderer on the earth, don’t hide your mitzvot from me.

20.verse: I am continually consumed with longing for your rulings.

21.verse: You rebuke the proud, the cursed, who stray from your mitzvot.

22.verse: Remove scorn and contempt from me, because I observe your instruction.

23.verse: Even when princes sit and plot against me, your servant meditates on your laws.

24.verse: Also your instructions are my delight; they are my counselors.

25.verse: ד (Dalet) I lie prostrate in the dust; revive me, in keeping with your word.

26.verse: I told you of my ways, and you answered me; teach me your laws.

27.verse: Make me understand the way of your precepts, and I will meditate on your wonders.

28.verse: I am melting away from anxiety and grief; renew my strength, in keeping with your word.

29.verse: Keep deceitful ways far from me, and favor me with your Torah.

30.verse: I choose the way of trust; I set your rulings [before me].

31.verse: I cling to your instruction; ADONAI, don’t let me be put to shame!

32.verse: I will run the way of your mitzvot, for you have broadened my understanding.

33.verse: ה (Heh) Teach me, ADONAI, the way of your laws; keeping them will be its own reward for me.

34.verse: Give me understanding; then I will keep your Torah; I will observe it with all my heart.

35.verse: Guide me on the path of your mitzvot, for I take pleasure in it.

36.verse: Bend my heart toward your instructions and not toward selfish gain.

37.verse: Turn my eyes away from worthless things; with your ways, give me life.

38.verse: Fulfill your promise, which you made to your servant, which you made to those who fear you.

39.verse: Avert the disgrace which I dread, for your rulings are good.

40.verse: See how I long for your precepts; in your righteousness, give me life!

41.verse: ו (Vav) May your grace come to me, ADONAI, your salvation, as you promised;

42.verse: then I will have an answer for those who taunt me; for I trust in your word.

43.verse: Don’t take away completely my power to speak the truth; for I put my hope in your rulings;

44.verse: and I will keep your Torah always, forever and ever.

45.verse: I will go wherever I like, for I have sought your precepts.

46.verse: I will speak of your instructions even to kings without being ashamed.

47.verse: I will delight myself in your mitzvot, which I have loved.

48.verse: I will lift my hands to your mitzvot, which I love; and I will meditate on your laws.

49.verse: ז (Zayin) Remember your promise to your servant, through which you have given me hope.

50.verse: In my distress my comfort is this: that your promise gives me life.

51.verse: Though the arrogant scorn me completely, I have not turned away from your Torah.

52.verse: ADONAI, I keep in mind your age-old rulings; in them I take comfort.

53.verse: Fury seizes me when I think of the wicked, because they abandon your Torah.

54.verse: Your laws have become my songs wherever I make my home.

55.verse: I remember your name, ADONAI, at night; and I observe your Torah.

56.verse: This [comfort] has come to me, because I observe your precepts.

57.verse: ח (Het) ADONAI, I say that my task is to observe your words.

58.verse: I beg your favor with my whole heart; show pity to me, in keeping with your promise.

59.verse: I thought about my ways and turned my feet toward your instruction.

60.verse: I hurry, I don’t delay, to observe your mitzvot.

61.verse: Even when the cords of the wicked close around me, I don’t forget your Torah.

62.verse: At midnight I rise to give you thanks because of your righteous rulings.

63.verse: I am a friend of all who fear you, of those who observe your precepts.

64.verse: The earth, ADONAI, is full of your grace; teach me your laws.

65.verse: ט (Tet) You have treated your servant well, ADONAI, in keeping with your word.

66.verse: Teach me good judgment and knowledge, because I trust in your mitzvot.

67.verse: Before I was humbled, I used to go astray; but now I observe your word.

68.verse: You are good, and you do good; teach me your laws.

69.verse: The arrogant are slandering me, but I will wholeheartedly keep your precepts.

70.verse: Their hearts are as thick as fat, but I take delight in your Torah.

71.verse: It is for my good that I have been humbled; it was so that I would learn your laws.

72.verse: The Torah you have spoken means more to me than a fortune in gold and silver.

73.verse: י (Yud) Your hands made and formed me; give me understanding, so I can learn your mitzvot.

74.verse: Those who fear you rejoice at the sight of me, because I put my hope in your word.

75.verse: I know, ADONAI, that your rulings are righteous, that even when you humble me you are faithful.

76.verse: Let your grace comfort me, in keeping with your promise to your servant.

77.verse: Show me pity, and I will live, for your Torah is my delight.

78.verse: Let the proud be ashamed, because they wrong me with lies; as for me, I will meditate on your precepts.

79.verse: Let those who fear you turn to me, along with those who know your instruction.

80.verse: Let my heart be pure in your laws, so that I won’t be put to shame.

81.verse: כ (Kaf) I am dying to know your salvation; my hope is in your word.

82.verse: My eyes fail from watching for your promise; I ask, “When will you comfort me?”

83.verse: For I have shriveled like a wineskin in a smoky room; still, I don’t forget your laws.

84.verse: How long can your servant stay alive? When will you bring judgment on my persecutors?

85.verse: The arrogant have dug pits for me to fall in; this is not in keeping with your Torah!

86.verse: All your mitzvot [show your] faithfulness; they are hounding me with lies; help me!

87.verse: They have nearly ended my life on earth, but I have not abandoned your precepts.

88.verse: In keeping with your grace, revive me; and I will observe your spoken instructions.

89.verse: ל (Lamed) Your word continues forever, ADONAI, firmly fixed in heaven;

90.verse: your faithfulness through all generations; you established the earth, and it stands.

91.verse: Yes, it stands today, in keeping with your rulings; for all things are your servants.

92.verse: If your Torah had not been my delight, I would have perished in my distress.

93.verse: I will never forget your precepts, for with them you have made me alive.

94.verse: I am yours; save me because I seek your precepts.

95.verse: The wicked hope to destroy me, but I focus on your instruction.

96.verse: I see the limits of all perfection, but your mitzvah has no bounds.

97.verse: מ (Mem) How I love your Torah! I meditate on it all day.

98.verse: I am wiser than my foes, because your mitzvot are mine forever.

99.verse: I have more understanding than all my teachers, because I meditate on your instruction.

100.verse: I understand more than my elders, because I keep your precepts.

101.verse: I keep my feet from every evil way, in order to observe your word.

102.verse: I don’t turn away from your rulings, because you have instructed me.

103.verse: How sweet to my tongue is your promise, truly sweeter than honey in my mouth!

104.verse: From your precepts I gain understanding; this is why I hate every false way.

105.verse: נ (Nun) Your word is a lamp for my foot and light on my path.

106.verse: I have sworn an oath and confirmed it, that I will observe your righteous rulings.

107.verse: I am very much distressed; ADONAI, give me life, in keeping with your word.

108.verse: Please accept my mouth’s voluntary offerings, ADONAI; and teach me your rulings.

109.verse: I am continually taking my life in my hands, yet I haven’t forgotten your Torah.

110.verse: The wicked have set a trap for me, yet I haven’t strayed from your precepts.

111.verse: I take your instruction as a permanent heritage, because it is the joy of my heart.

112.verse: I have resolved to obey your laws forever, at every step.

113.verse: ס (Samekh) I hate doubleminded people, but I love your Torah.

114.verse: You are my hiding-place and shield; I put my hope in your word.

115.verse: Leave me alone, you evildoers, so that I can keep my God’s mitzvot.

116.verse: Uphold me, as you promised; and I will live; don’t disappoint me in my hope.

117.verse: Support me; and I will be saved, always putting my attention on your laws.

118.verse: You reject all who stray from your laws, for what they deceive themselves with is false.

119.verse: You discard the wicked of the earth like slag; this is why I love your instruction.

120.verse: My body trembles for fear of you; your rulings make me afraid.

121.verse: ע (‘Ayin) I have done what is just and right; don’t abandon me to my oppressors.

122.verse: Guarantee your servant’s well-being; don’t let the arrogant oppress me.

123.verse: My eyes fail from watching for your salvation and for [the fulfillment of] your righteous promise.

124.verse: Deal with your servant in accordance with your grace, and teach me your laws.

125.verse: I am your servant; give me understanding, so that I can know your instruction.

126.verse: The time has come for ADONAI to act, because they are breaking your Torah.

127.verse: Therefore I love your mitzvot more than gold, more than fine gold.

128.verse: Thus I direct my steps by [your] precepts; every false way I hate.

129.verse: פ (Peh) Your instruction is a wonder; this is why I follow it.

130.verse: Your words are a doorway that lets in light, giving understanding to the thoughtless.

131.verse: My mouth is wide open, as I pant with longing for your mitzvot.

132.verse: Turn to me, and show me your favor; in keeping with [your] judgment for those who love your name.

133.verse: Guide my footsteps by your word; don’t let any kind of sin rule me.

134.verse: Redeem me from human oppression, and I will observe your precepts.

135.verse: Make your face shine on your servant, and teach me your laws.

136.verse: Rivers of tears flow down from my eyes, because they don’t observe your Torah.

137.verse: צ (Tzadeh) You are righteous, ADONAI; and your rulings are upright.

138.verse: You have commanded your instructions in righteousness and great faithfulness.

139.verse: My zeal is destroying me, because my foes have forgotten your words.

140.verse: Your word is refined to complete purity, and your servant loves it.

141.verse: I may be small and despised, but I do not forget your precepts.

142.verse: Your righteousness is eternal righteousness, and your Torah is truth.

143.verse: Trouble and distress have overtaken me, but your mitzvot are my delight.

144.verse: Your instruction is righteous forever; give me understanding, and I will live.

145.verse: ק (Kuf) Wholeheartedly I am calling on you; answer me, ADONAI; I will keep your laws.

146.verse: I am calling on you; save me; and I will observe your instruction.

147.verse: I rise before dawn and cry for help; I put my hope in your word.

148.verse: My eyes are open before the night watches, so that I can meditate on your promise.

149.verse: In your grace, hear my voice; ADONAI, in keeping with your justice, revive me.

150.verse: The pursuers of carnality are getting close; they are distancing themselves from your Torah.

151.verse: You are close by, ADONAI; and all your mitzvot are truth.

152.verse: Long ago I learned from your instruction that you established it forever.

153.verse: ר (Resh) Look at my distress, and rescue me, for I do not forget your Torah.

154.verse: Plead my cause, and redeem me; in keeping with your promise, revive me.

155.verse: Salvation is far away from the wicked, because they don’t seek your laws.

156.verse: Great is your compassion, ADONAI; in keeping with your rulings, revive me.

157.verse: Although my persecutors and foes are many, I have not turned away from your instruction.

158.verse: I look at traitors with disgust, because they don’t keep your word.

159.verse: See how I love your precepts, ADONAI; in keeping with your grace, revive me.

160.verse: The main thing about your word is that it’s true; and all your just rulings last forever.

161.verse: ש (Shin) Princes persecute me for no reason, but my heart stands in awe of your words.

162.verse: I take joy in your promise, like someone who finds much booty.

163.verse: I hate falsehood, I detest it; but I love your Torah.

164.verse: I praise you seven times a day because of your righteous rulings.

165.verse: Those who love your Torah have great peace; nothing makes them stumble.

166.verse: I hope for your deliverance, ADONAI; I obey your mitzvot.

167.verse: My soul observes your instruction, and I love it so much!

168.verse: I observe your precepts and instruction, for all my ways lie open before you.

169.verse: ת (Tav) Let my cry come before you, ADONAI; in keeping with your word, give me understanding.

170.verse: Let my prayer come before you; in keeping with your promise, rescue me.

171.verse: Let my lips speak praise, because you teach me your laws.

172.verse: Let my tongue sing of your promise, because all your mitzvot are righteous.

173.verse: Let your hand be ready to help me, because I choose your precepts.

174.verse: I long for your deliverance, ADONAI; and your Torah is my delight.

175.verse: Let me live, and I will praise you; let your rulings help me.

176.verse: I strayed like a lost sheep; seek out your servant; for I do not forget your mitzvot.

1.verse: A song of ascents: I called to ADONAI in my distress, and he answered me.

2.verse: Rescue me, ADONAI, from lips that tell lies, from a tongue full of deceit.

3.verse: What has he in store for you, deceitful tongue? What more will he do to you?

4.verse: A warrior’s sharp arrows, with red-hot coals from a broom tree.

5.verse: How wretched I am, that I’m an alien in Meshekh, that I must live among the tents of Keidar!

6.verse: I have had to live far too long with those who hate peace.

7.verse: I am all for peace; but when I speak, they are for war.

1.verse: A song of ascents: If I raise my eyes to the hills, from where will my help come?

2.verse: My help comes from ADONAI, the maker of heaven and earth.

3.verse: He will not let your foot slip — your guardian is not asleep.

4.verse: No, the guardian of Isra’el never slumbers or sleeps.

5.verse: ADONAI is your guardian; at your right hand ADONAI provides you with shade —

6.verse: the sun can’t strike you during the day or even the moon at night.

7.verse: ADONAI will guard you against all harm; he will guard your life.

8.verse: ADONAI will guard your coming and going from now on and forever.

1.verse: A song of ascents. By David: I was glad when they said to me, “The house of ADONAI! Let’s go!”

2.verse: Our feet were already standing at your gates, Yerushalayim.

3.verse: Yerushalayim, built as a city fostering friendship and unity.

4.verse: The tribes have gone up there, the tribes of ADONAI, as a witness to Isra’el, to give thanks to the name of ADONAI.

5.verse: For there the thrones of justice were set up, the thrones of the house of David.

6.verse: Pray for shalom in Yerushalayim; may those who love you prosper.

7.verse: May shalom be within your ramparts, prosperity in your palaces.

8.verse: For the sake of my family and friends, I say, “Shalom be within you!”

9.verse: For the sake of the house of ADONAI our God, I will seek your well-being.

1.verse: A song of ascents: I raise my eyes to you, whose throne is in heaven.

2.verse: As a servant looks to the hand of his master, or a slave-girl to the hand of her mistress, so our eyes turn to ADONAI our God, until he has mercy on us.

3.verse: Have mercy on us, ADONAI, have mercy; for we have had our fill of contempt,

4.verse: more than our fill of scorn from the complacent and contempt from the arrogant.

1.verse: A song of ascents. By David: If ADONAI hadn’t been for us — let Isra’el repeat it —

2.verse: If ADONAI hadn’t been for us when people rose to attack us,

3.verse: then, when their anger blazed against us, they would have swallowed us alive!

4.verse: Then the water would have engulfed us, the torrent would have swept over us.

5.verse: Yes, the raging water would have swept right over us.

6.verse: Blessed be ADONAI, who did not leave us to be a prey for their teeth!

7.verse: We escaped like a bird from the hunter’s trap; the trap is broken, and we have escaped.

8.verse: Our help is in the name of ADONAI, the maker of heaven and earth.

1.verse: A song of ascents: Those who trust in ADONAI are like Mount Tziyon, which cannot be moved but remains forever.

2.verse: Yerushalayim! Mountains all around it! Thus ADONAI is around his people henceforth and forever.

3.verse: For the scepter of wickedness will not rule the inheritance of the righteous, so that the righteous will not themselves turn their hands to evil.

4.verse: Do good, ADONAI, to the good, to those upright in their hearts.

5.verse: But as for those who turn aside to their own crooked ways, may ADONAI turn them away, along with those who do evil. Shalom on Isra’el!

1.verse: A song of ascents: When ADONAI restored Tziyon’s fortunes, we thought we were dreaming.

2.verse: Our mouths were full of laughter, and our tongues shouted for joy. Among the nations it was said, “ADONAI has done great things for them!”

3.verse: ADONAI did do great things with us; and we are overjoyed.

4.verse: Return our people from exile, ADONAI, as streams fill vadis in the Negev.

5.verse: Those who sow in tears will reap with cries of joy.

6.verse: He who goes out weeping as he carries his sack of seed will come home with cries of joy as he carries his sheaves of grain.

1.verse: A song of ascents. By Shlomo: Unless ADONAI builds the house, its builders work in vain. Unless ADONAI guards the city, the guard keeps watch in vain.

2.verse: In vain do you get up early and put off going to bed, working hard to earn a living; for he provides for his beloved, even when they sleep.

3.verse: Children too are a gift from ADONAI; the fruit of the womb is a reward.

4.verse: The children born when one is young. are like arrows in the hand of a warrior.

5.verse: How blessed is the man who has filled his quiver with them; he will not have to be embarrassed when contending with foes at the city gate.

1.verse: A song of ascents: How happy is everyone who fears ADONAI, who lives by his ways.

2.verse: You will eat what your hands have produced; you will be happy and prosperous.

3.verse: Your wife will be like a fruitful vine in the inner parts of your house. Your children around the table will be like shoots from an olive tree.

4.verse: This is the kind of blessing that will fall on him who fears ADONAI.

5.verse: May ADONAI bless you from Tziyon! May you see Yerushalayim prosper all the days of your life,

6.verse: and may you live to see your children’s children! Shalom on Isra’el.

1.verse: A song of ascents: Since I was young they have often attacked me — let Isra’el repeat it —

2.verse: since I was young they have often attacked me, but they haven’t overcome me.

3.verse: The plowmen plowed on my back; wounding me with long furrows.

4.verse: But ADONAI is righteous; he cuts me free from the yoke of the wicked.

5.verse: Let all who hate Tziyon be thrown back in confusion.

6.verse: Let them be like grass on the roof, which dries out before it grows up

7.verse: and never fills the reaper’s hands or the arms of the one who binds sheaves,

8.verse: so that no passer-by says, “ADONAI’s blessing on you! We bless you in the name of ADONAI!”

1.verse: A song of ascents. By David: ADONAI, I call to you from the depths;

2.verse: hear my cry, Adonai! Let your ears pay attention to the sound of my pleading.

3.verse: Yah, if you kept a record of sins, who, Adonai, could stand?

4.verse: But with you there is forgiveness, so that you will be feared.

5.verse: I wait longingly for ADONAI; I put my hope in his word.

6.verse: Everything in me waits for Adonai more than guards on watch wait for morning, more than guards on watch wait for morning.

7.verse: Isra’el, put your hope in ADONAI! For grace is found with ADONAI, and with him is unlimited redemption.

8.verse: He will redeem Isra’el from all their wrongdoings.

1.verse: A song of ascents. By David: ADONAI, my heart isn’t proud; I don’t set my sight too high, I don’t take part in great affairs or in wonders far beyond me.

2.verse: No, I keep myself calm and quiet, like a little child on its mother’s lap — I keep myself like a little child.

3.verse: Isra’el, put your hope in ADONAI from now on and forever!

1.verse: A song of ascents: ADONAI, remember in David’s favor all the hardships he endured,

2.verse: how he swore to ADONAI, vowed to the Mighty One of Ya‘akov,

3.verse: “I will not enter the house where I live or get into my bed,

4.verse: I will not allow myself to sleep or even close my eyes,

5.verse: until I find a place for ADONAI, a dwelling for the Mighty One of Ya‘akov.”

6.verse: We heard about it in Efrat, we found it in the Fields of Ya‘ar.

7.verse: Let’s go into his dwelling and prostrate ourselves at his footstool.

8.verse: Go up, ADONAI, to your resting-place, you and the ark through which you give strength.

9.verse: May your cohanim be clothed with righteousness; may those loyal to you shout for joy.

10.verse: For the sake of your servant David, don’t turn away the face of your anointed one.

11.verse: ADONAI swore an oath to David, an oath he will not break: “One of the sons from your own body I will set on your throne.

12.verse: If your sons keep my covenant and my instruction, which I will teach them, then their descendants too, forever, will sit on your throne.”

13.verse: For ADONAI has chosen Tziyon, he has wanted it as his home.

14.verse: “This is my resting-place forever, I will live here because I so much want to.

15.verse: I will bless it with plenty of meat, I will give its poor their fill of food.

16.verse: Its cohanim I will clothe with salvation, and its faithful will shout for joy.

17.verse: I will make a king sprout there from David’s line and prepare a lamp for my anointed one.

18.verse: His enemies I will clothe with shame, but on him there will be a shining crown.”

1.verse: A song of ascents. By David: Oh, how good, how pleasant it is for brothers to live together in harmony.

2.verse: It is like fragrant oil on the head that runs down over the beard, over the beard of Aharon, and flows down on the collar of his robes.

3.verse: It is like the dew of Hermon that settles on the mountains of Tziyon. For it was there that ADONAI ordained the blessing of everlasting life.

1.verse: A song of ascents: Come, bless ADONAI, all you servants of ADONAI, who serve each night in the house of ADONAI.

2.verse: Lift your hands toward the sanctuary, and bless ADONAI.

3.verse: May ADONAI, the maker of heaven and earth, bless you from Tziyon.

1.verse: Halleluyah! Give praise to the name of ADONAI! Servants of ADONAI, give praise!

2.verse: You who stand in the house of ADONAI, in the courtyards of the house of our God,

3.verse: praise Yah, for ADONAI is good; sing to his name, because it is pleasant.

4.verse: For Yah chose Ya‘akov for himself, Isra’el as his own unique treasure.

5.verse: I know that ADONAI is great, that our Lord is above all gods.

6.verse: ADONAI does whatever pleases him, in heaven, on earth, in the seas, in all the depths.

7.verse: He raises clouds from the ends of the earth, he makes the lightning flash in the rain and brings the wind out from his storehouses.

8.verse: He struck down Egypt’s firstborn, humans and animals alike.

9.verse: He sent signs and wonders among you, Egypt, against Pharaoh and all his subjects.

10.verse: He struck many nations, and slaughtered mighty kings —

11.verse: Sichon king of the Emori, ‘Og king of Bashan, and all the kingdoms of Kena‘an.

12.verse: Then he gave their land as a heritage, to be possessed by Isra’el his people.

13.verse: ADONAI, your name continues forever, your renown, ADONAI, through all generations.

14.verse: For ADONAI will vindicate his people, he will take pity on his servants.

15.verse: The idols of the nations are mere silver and gold, made by human hands.

16.verse: They have mouths, but they can’t speak; they have eyes, but they can’t see;

17.verse: they have ears, but they can’t listen; and they have no breath in their mouths;

18.verse: The people who make them will become like them, along with everyone who trusts in them.

19.verse: House of Isra’el, bless ADONAI! House of Aharon, bless ADONAI!

20.verse: House of Levi, bless ADONAI! You who fear ADONAI, bless ADONAI!

21.verse: Blessed be ADONAI out of Tziyon, he who dwells in Yerushalayim! Halleluyah!

1.verse: Give thanks to ADONAI, for he is good, for his grace continues forever.

2.verse: Give thanks to the God of gods, for his grace continues forever.

3.verse: Give thanks to the Lord of lords, for his grace continues forever;

4.verse: to him who alone has done great wonders, for his grace continues forever;

5.verse: to him who skillfully made the heavens, for his grace continues forever;

6.verse: to him who spread out the earth on the water, for his grace continues forever;

7.verse: to him who made the great lights, for his grace continues forever;

8.verse: the sun to rule the day, for his grace continues forever;

9.verse: the moon and stars to rule the night, for his grace continues forever;

10.verse: to him who struck down Egypt’s firstborn, for his grace continues forever;

11.verse: and brought Isra’el out from among them, for his grace continues forever;

12.verse: with a mighty hand and an outstretched arm, for his grace continues forever;

13.verse: to him who split apart the Sea of Suf, for his grace continues forever;

14.verse: and made Isra’el cross right through it, for his grace continues forever;

15.verse: but swept Pharaoh and his army into the Sea of Suf, for his grace continues forever;

16.verse: to him who led his people through the desert, for his grace continues forever;

17.verse: to him who struck down great kings, for his grace continues forever;

18.verse: yes, he slaughtered powerful kings, for his grace continues forever;

19.verse: Sichon king of the Emori, for his grace continues forever;

20.verse: and ‘Og king of Bashan, for his grace continues forever;

21.verse: then he gave their land as a heritage, for his grace continues forever;

22.verse: to be possessed by Isra’el his servant, for his grace continues forever;

23.verse: who remembers us whenever we are brought low, for his grace continues forever;

24.verse: and rescues us from our enemies, for his grace continues forever;

25.verse: who provides food for every living creature, for his grace continues forever.

26.verse: Give thanks to the God of heaven, for his grace continues forever.

1.verse: By the rivers of Bavel we sat down and wept as we remembered Tziyon.

2.verse: We had hung up our lyres on the willows that were there,

3.verse: when those who had taken us captive asked us to sing them a song; our tormentors demanded joy from us — “Sing us one of the songs from Tziyon!”

4.verse: How can we sing a song about ADONAI here on foreign soil?

5.verse: If I forget you, Yerushalayim, may my right hand wither away!

6.verse: May my tongue stick to the roof of my mouth if I fail to remember you, if I fail to count Yerushalayim the greatest of all my joys.

7.verse: Remember, ADONAI, against the people of Edom the day of Yerushalayim’s fall, how they cried, “Tear it down! Tear it down! Raze it to the ground!”

8.verse: Daughter of Bavel, you will be destroyed! A blessing on anyone who pays you back for the way you treated us!

9.verse: A blessing on anyone who seizes your babies and smashes them against a rock!

1.verse: By David: I give you thanks with all my heart. Not to idols, but to you I sing praise.

2.verse: I bow down toward your holy temple and give thanks to your name for your grace and truth; for you have made your word [even] greater than the whole of your reputation.

3.verse: When I called, you answered me, you made me bold and strong.

4.verse: All the kings of the earth will thank you, ADONAI, when they hear the words you have spoken.

5.verse: They will sing about ADONAI’s ways, “Great is the glory of ADONAI!”

6.verse: For though ADONAI is high, he cares for the lowly; while the proud he perceives from afar.

7.verse: You keep me alive when surrounded by danger; you put out your hand when my enemies rage; with your right hand you save me.

8.verse: ADONAI will fulfill his purpose for me. Your grace, ADONAI, continues forever. Don’t abandon the work of your hands!

1.verse: For the leader. A psalm of David: ADONAI, you have probed me, and you know me.

2.verse: You know when I sit and when I stand up, you discern my inclinations from afar,

3.verse: you scrutinize my daily activities. You are so familiar with all my ways

4.verse: that before I speak even a word, ADONAI, you know all about it already.

5.verse: You have hemmed me in both behind and in front and laid your hand on me.

6.verse: Such wonderful knowledge is beyond me, far too high for me to reach.

7.verse: Where can I go to escape your Spirit? Where can I flee from your presence?

8.verse: If I climb up to heaven, you are there; if I lie down in Sh’ol, you are there.

9.verse: If I fly away with the wings of the dawn and land beyond the sea,

10.verse: even there your hand would lead me, your right hand would hold me fast.

11.verse: If I say, “Let darkness surround me, let the light around me be night,”

12.verse: even darkness like this is not too dark for you; rather, night is as clear as day, darkness and light are the same.

13.verse: For you fashioned my inmost being, you knit me together in my mother’s womb.

14.verse: I thank you because I am awesomely made, wonderfully; your works are wonders — I know this very well.

15.verse: My bones were not hidden from you when I was being made in secret, intricately woven in the depths of the earth.

16.verse: Your eyes could see me as an embryo, but in your book all my days were already written; my days had been shaped before any of them existed.

17.verse: God, how I prize your thoughts! How many of them there are!

18.verse: If I count them, there are more than grains of sand; if I finish the count, I am still with you.

19.verse: God, if only you would kill off the wicked! Men of blood, get away from me!

20.verse: They invoke your name for their crafty schemes; yes, your enemies misuse it.

21.verse: ADONAI, how I hate those who hate you! I feel such disgust with those who defy you!

22.verse: I hate them with unlimited hatred! They have become my enemies too.

23.verse: Examine me, God, and know my heart; test me, and know my thoughts.

24.verse: See if there is in me any hurtful way, and lead me along the eternal way.

1.verse: For the leader. A psalm of David:

2.verse: Rescue me, ADONAI, from evil people, protect me from violent people.

3.verse: They plan evil things in their hearts — they continually stir up bitter strife.

4.verse: They have made their tongues as sharp as a snake’s; viper’s venom is under their lips. (Selah)

5.verse: Keep me, ADONAI, from the hands of the wicked, protect me from violent people who are trying to trip me up.

6.verse: The arrogant hide snares for me; they spread nets by the side of the road, hoping to trap me there. (Selah)

7.verse: I said to ADONAI, “You are my God; listen, ADONAI, to my plea for mercy.”

8.verse: ADONAI, Adonai, my saving strength, my helmet shielding my head in battle,

9.verse: ADONAI, don’t grant the wicked their wishes; make their plot fail, so they won’t grow proud. (Selah)

10.verse: May the heads of those who surround me be engulfed in the evil they spoke of, themselves.

11.verse: May burning coals rain down on them, may they be flung into the fire, flung into deep pits, never to rise again.

12.verse: Let slanderers find no place in the land; let the violent and evil be hunted relentlessly.

13.verse: I know that ADONAI gives justice to the poor and maintains the rights of the needy.

1.verse: A psalm of David: ADONAI, I have called you; come to me quickly! Listen to my plea when I call to you.

2.verse: Let my prayer be like incense set before you, my uplifted hands like an evening sacrifice.

3.verse: Set a guard, ADONAI, over my mouth; keep watch at the door of my lips.

4.verse: Don’t let my heart turn to anything evil or allow me to act wickedly with men who are evildoers; keep me from eating their delicacies.

5.verse: Let the righteous strike me, let him correct me; it will be an act of love. Let my head not refuse such choice oil, for I will keep on praying about their wickedness.

6.verse: When their rulers are thrown down from the cliff, [the wicked] will hear that my words were fitting.

7.verse: As when one plows and breaks the ground into clods, our bones are strewn at the mouth of Sh’ol.

8.verse: For my eyes, ADONAI, Adonai, are on you; in you I take refuge; don’t pour out my life.

9.verse: Keep me from the trap they have set for me, from the snares of evildoers.

10.verse: Let the wicked fall into their own nets, while I pass by in safety.

1.verse: A maskil of David, when he was in the cave. A prayer:

2.verse: With my voice I cry to ADONAI, with my voice I plead to ADONAI for mercy.

3.verse: Before him I pour out my complaint, before him I tell my trouble.

4.verse: When my spirit faints within me, you watch over my path. By the road that I am walking they have hidden a snare for me.

5.verse: Look to my right, and see that no one recognizes me. I have no way of escape; nobody cares for me.

6.verse: I cried out to you, ADONAI; I said, “You are my refuge, my portion in the land of the living.”

7.verse: Listen to my cry, for I have been brought very low. Rescue me from my persecutors, for they are too strong for me.

1.verse: A psalm of David: ADONAI, hear my prayer; listen to my pleas for mercy. In your faithfulness, answer me, and in your righteousness.

2.verse: Don’t bring your servant to trial, since in your sight no one alive would be considered righteous.

3.verse: For an enemy is pursuing me; he has crushed my life into the ground and left me to live in darkness, like those who have been long dead.

4.verse: My spirit faints within me; my heart is appalled within me.

5.verse: I remember the days of old, reflecting on all your deeds, thinking about the work of your hands.

6.verse: I spread out my hands to you, I long for you like a thirsty land. (Selah)

7.verse: Answer me quickly, ADONAI, because my spirit is fainting. Don’t hide your face from me, or I’ll be like those who drop down into a pit.

8.verse: Make me hear of your love in the morning, because I rely on you. Make me know the way I should walk, because I entrust myself to you.

9.verse: ADONAI, rescue me from my enemies; I have hidden myself with you.

10.verse: Teach me to do your will, because you are my God; Let your good Spirit guide me on ground that is level.

11.verse: For your name’s sake, ADONAI, preserve my life; in your righteousness, bring me out of distress.

12.verse: In your grace, cut off my enemies; destroy all those harassing me; because I am your servant.

1.verse: By David: Blessed be ADONAI, my rock, who trains my hands for war and my fingers for battle.

2.verse: He shows me grace; and he is my fortress, my stronghold, in whom I find shelter, my shield, in whom I take refuge, who subdues my people under me.

3.verse: ADONAI, what are mere mortals, that you notice them at all; humans, that you think about them?

4.verse: Man is like a puff of wind, his days like a fleeting shadow.

5.verse: ADONAI, lower the heavens, and come down; touch the mountains, make them pour out smoke.

6.verse: Shoot out lightning, and scatter them; send out your arrows, and rout them.

7.verse: Reach out your hands from on high; rescue me; save me out of deep water, out of the power of strangers,

8.verse: whose mouths speak worthless words and whose right hands swear false oaths.

9.verse: God, I will sing a new song to you; sing praises to you with a ten-stringed harp.

10.verse: You give kings their victories; you save your servant David from the cruel sword.

11.verse: Rescue me, save me from the power of strangers, whose mouths speak worthless words and whose right hands swear false oaths.

12.verse: Our sons in their youth will be like full-grown saplings, our daughters will be like sculptured pillars fit for the corner of a palace.

13.verse: Our barns are full with crops of every kind; the sheep in our fields number thousands, tens of thousands.

14.verse: our oxen are well-fed, our city walls have no breach, our people are not taken captive, and there are no cries of protest in our cities’ open places.

15.verse: How happy the people who live in such conditions! How happy the people whose God is ADONAI!

1.verse: Praise. By David: I will praise you to the heights, my God, the king; I will bless your name forever and ever.

2.verse: Every day I will bless you; I will praise your name forever and ever.

3.verse: Great is ADONAI and greatly to be praised; his greatness is beyond all searching out.

4.verse: Each generation will praise your works to the next and proclaim your mighty acts.

5.verse: I will meditate on the glorious splendor of your majesty and on the story of your wonders.

6.verse: People will speak of your awesome power, and I will tell of your great deeds.

7.verse: They will gush forth the fame of your abounding goodness, and they will sing of your righteousness.

8.verse: ADONAI is merciful and compassionate, slow to anger and great in grace.

9.verse: ADONAI is good to all; his compassion rests on all his creatures.

10.verse: All your creatures will thank you, ADONAI, and your faithful servants will bless you.

11.verse: They will speak of the glory of your kingship, and they will tell about your might;

12.verse: to let everyone know of your mighty acts and the glorious majesty of your kingship.

13.verse: Your kingship is an everlasting kingship, your reign continues through all generations.

14.verse: ADONAI supports all who fall and lifts up all who are bent over.

15.verse: The eyes of all are looking to you; you give them their food at the right time.

16.verse: You open your hand and satisfy the desire of every living thing.

17.verse: ADONAI is righteous in all his ways, full of grace in all he does.

18.verse: ADONAI is close to all who call on him, to all who sincerely call on him.

19.verse: He fulfills the desire of those who fear him; he hears their cry and saves them.

20.verse: ADONAI protects all who love him, but all the wicked he destroys.

21.verse: My mouth will proclaim the praise of ADONAI; all people will bless his holy name forever and ever.

1.verse: Halleluyah! Praise ADONAI, my soul!

2.verse: I will praise ADONAI as long as I live. I will sing praise to my God all my life.

3.verse: Don’t put your trust in princes or in mortals, who cannot help.

4.verse: When they breathe their last, they return to dust; on that very day all their plans are gone.

5.verse: Happy is he whose help is Ya‘akov’s God, whose hope is in ADONAI his God.

6.verse: He made heaven and earth, the sea and everything in them; he keeps faith forever.

7.verse: He secures justice for the oppressed, he gives food to the hungry. ADONAI sets prisoners free,

8.verse: ADONAI opens the eyes of the blind, ADONAI lifts up those who are bent over. ADONAI loves the righteous.

9.verse: ADONAI watches over strangers, he sustains the fatherless and widows; but the way of the wicked he twists.

10.verse: ADONAI will reign forever, your God, Tziyon, through all generations. Halleluyah!

1.verse: Halleluyah! How good it is to sing praises to our God! How sweet, how fitting to praise him!

2.verse: ADONAI is rebuilding Yerushalayim, gathering the dispersed of Isra’el.

3.verse: He heals the brokenhearted and binds up their wounds.

4.verse: He determines how many stars there are and calls them all by name.

5.verse: Our Lord is great, his power is vast, his wisdom beyond all telling.

6.verse: ADONAI sustains the humble but brings the wicked down to the ground.

7.verse: Sing to ADONAI with thanks, sing praises on the lyre to our God.

8.verse: He veils the sky with clouds; he provides the earth with rain; he makes grass grow on the hills;

9.verse: he gives food to the animals, even to the young ravens when they cry.

10.verse: He takes no delight in the strength of a horse, no pleasure in a runner’s speed.

11.verse: ADONAI takes pleasure in those who fear him, in those who wait for his grace.

12.verse: Glorify ADONAI, Yerushalayim! Praise your God, Tziyon!

13.verse: For he strengthens the bars of your gates, he blesses your children within you,

14.verse: he brings peace within your borders, he gives you your fill of the finest wheat.

15.verse: He sends his word out over the earth, his command runs swiftly.

16.verse: Thus he gives snow like wool, scatters hoarfrost like ashes,

17.verse: sends crystals of ice like crumbs of bread — who can withstand such cold?

18.verse: Then he sends his word out and melts them; he makes the winds blow, and the water flows.

19.verse: He reveals his words to Ya‘akov, his laws and rulings to Isra’el.

20.verse: He has not done this for other nations; they do not know his rulings. Halleluyah!

1.verse: Halleluyah! Praise ADONAI from the heavens! Praise him in the heights!

2.verse: Praise him, all his angels! Praise him, all his armies!

3.verse: Praise him, sun and moon! Praise him, all shining stars!

4.verse: Praise him, highest heaven, and waters above the heavens!

5.verse: Let them praise the name of ADONAI; for he commanded, and they were created.

6.verse: He established them forever and ever; he has given a law to which they must conform.

7.verse: Praise ADONAI from the earth, sea monsters and watery depths,

8.verse: fire and hail, snow and mist, storm-winds that obey his word,

9.verse: mountains and every hill, fruit trees and all cedars,

10.verse: wild animals and all livestock, creeping reptiles, flying birds,

11.verse: kings of the earth and all peoples, princes and all rulers on earth,

12.verse: young men and women alike, old men and children.

13.verse: Let them praise the name of ADONAI, for his name alone is exalted; his glory is above both earth and heaven.

14.verse: He has increased the power of his people, granted praise to all his faithful, to the descendants of Isra’el, a people close to him. Halleluyah!

1.verse: Halleluyah! Sing to ADONAI a new song, his praise in the assembly of the faithful.

2.verse: Let Isra’el rejoice in their maker, let Tziyon’s children take joy in their king.

3.verse: Let them praise his name with dancing, make melody to him with tambourine and lyre;

4.verse: for ADONAI takes delight in his people, he crowns the humble with salvation.

5.verse: Let the faithful exult gloriously, let them sing for joy on their beds.

6.verse: Let the high praises of God be in their throats, but a two-edged sword in their hands

7.verse: to carry out vengeance on the nations and punishment on the peoples,

8.verse: to bind their kings with chains and put their nobles in irons,

9.verse: to execute the judgments decreed for them; for this will glorify all his faithful. Halleluyah!

1.verse: Halleluyah! Praise God in his holy place! Praise him in the heavenly dome of his power!

2.verse: Praise him for his mighty deeds! Praise him for his surpassing greatness!

3.verse: Praise him with a blast on the shofar! Praise him with lute and lyre!

4.verse: Praise him with tambourines and dancing! Praise him with flutes and strings!

5.verse: Praise him with clanging cymbals! Praise him with loud crashing cymbals!

6.verse: Let everything that has breath praise ADONAI! Halleluyah!
